description: Comprehensive sustainability guidelines for product evaluation across all categories - SICOSI System - Brazilian Market Focus. Updated with EU ESPR/DPP and expanded product categories.
source: Based on ISO standards, EU ESPR, EMBRAPA guidelines, Brazilian certifications, and global sustainability standards, ISSB, GPC (GS1)

indicators.name: Product Lifespan
indicators.description: Evaluation of the expected operational lifespan of the electronic product, specifically verifying that it functions reliably for more than 5 years under normal usage conditions.
indicators.measurement: Review manufacturer warranty and technical specifications, conduct accelerated aging tests if available, and verify compliance with durability requirements through third-party testing reports or certifications.
indicators.target: Product lifespan greater than 5 years

indicators.name: Modular Component Design
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the electronic product is designed with modular components that allow easy replacement and repair, enhancing product lifespan and reducing waste.
indicators.measurement: Verify product design documentation and physical inspection to confirm modularity of key components; assess availability of replacement parts and ease of disassembly using standard tools.
indicators.target: Product must have modular design enabling replacement of at least 80% of critical components without specialized tools.

indicators.name: Spare Parts Availability
indicators.description: Evaluates whether spare parts for the electronic product are available for a minimum period of 7 years after purchase to ensure long-term repairability and durability.
indicators.measurement: Verify manufacturer declarations and warranty documents for spare parts availability duration; check authorized service centers and parts catalogs; confirm compliance with relevant regulations such as ESPR and WEEE Directive.
indicators.target: Spare parts must be available for at least 7 years after the product's market release date.

indicators.name: Software Update Support
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the electronic product receives software updates for a minimum duration of 5 years to ensure security, functionality, and longevity.
indicators.measurement: Verify manufacturer documentation and update policies; check software update logs or release notes; confirm update availability through product support channels over a 5-year period.
indicators.target: Software updates must be provided and supported for at least 5 years from the product's release date.

indicators.name: Robust Construction
indicators.description: Evaluation of the product's physical build quality to ensure resistance to wear and mechanical stress over its expected lifespan.
indicators.measurement: Conduct standardized mechanical stress tests such as drop, vibration, and abrasion tests; inspect materials used for wear resistance; review manufacturer durability test reports.
indicators.target: Product must demonstrate resistance to wear through passing standardized mechanical stress tests without functional degradation or structural damage.

indicators.name: Standardized Fasteners
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the product uses standardized screws and fasteners that do not require proprietary tools, facilitating easier repair and maintenance.
indicators.measurement: Inspect the product to verify the type of screws and fasteners used; confirm that only common standardized tools (e.g., Phillips, Torx) are needed and no proprietary or unique tools are required for disassembly.
indicators.target: All screws and fasteners must be standardized and compatible with common tools, with zero proprietary fasteners used.

indicators.name: Adhesive Minimization
indicators.description: Evaluates the extent to which adhesives are minimized in the product design to facilitate easier disassembly and repair, reducing the need for destructive methods.
indicators.measurement: Inspect product assembly to identify adhesive usage; verify manufacturer documentation on adhesive types and quantities; perform disassembly tests to assess ease of component separation without adhesive removal tools.
indicators.target: Minimal or no use of permanent adhesives that hinder disassembly and repair processes.
data_sources: ESPR (European Single Market for Green Products Regulation)

indicators.name: Repair Documentation Access
indicators.description: Evaluates the availability and accessibility of repair manuals and technical documentation provided by the manufacturer to facilitate product repair and maintenance.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of downloadable repair manuals and technical documents on the manufacturer's official website or through authorized service portals; check for completeness, clarity, and language availability relevant to the Brazilian market.
indicators.target: Repair manuals and documentation must be publicly accessible online without restrictive paywalls or registration barriers.

indicators.name: Repairability Score
indicators.description: Evaluation of the product's ease of repair based on a standardized repairability score, reflecting the accessibility of components and availability of repair information.
indicators.measurement: Verify the repairability score using the iFixit standard methodology, which assesses disassembly complexity, availability of spare parts, and repair documentation.
indicators.target: Repairability score greater than 7 out of 10 according to the iFixit standard.

indicators.name: Replaceable Battery and Components
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the electronic product has a battery and key components that can be easily replaced by the user or a technician to extend product lifespan and reduce waste.
indicators.measurement: Verify through product technical documentation and teardown reports that the battery and at least three key components (e.g., screen, motherboard, charging port) are designed for replacement without specialized tools or soldering; confirm availability of replacement parts and repair instructions.
indicators.target: Battery and minimum three key components must be replaceable without specialized equipment or permanent damage to the product.
data_sources: ESPR (European Single Market for Ecodesign Requirements)

indicators.name: Right to Repair Compliance
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the electronic product complies with the EU Right to Repair requirements, ensuring availability of spare parts, repair information, and design facilitating repairability.
indicators.measurement: Verify manufacturer documentation for availability of repair manuals and spare parts for at least 7 years; check product design for modularity and ease of disassembly; confirm compliance with EU ESPR and WEEE Directive requirements through certification or declarations.
indicators.target: Full compliance with EU Right to Repair regulations, including availability of spare parts and repair information for a minimum of 7 years after product release.

indicators.name: Easy Disassembly
indicators.description: Evaluates the product's design for facilitating easy disassembly to enable efficient material separation during recycling processes.
indicators.measurement: Verify presence of modular components, use of standardized fasteners, and availability of disassembly instructions; conduct physical disassembly tests to assess time and effort required for separating key materials.
indicators.target: Product components should be designed for disassembly within 15 minutes using common tools without damaging materials to ensure effective material separation.

indicators.name: Plastic Type Marking
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether plastic components in electronic products are clearly marked with standardized recycling codes to facilitate proper sorting and recycling.
indicators.measurement: Inspect product plastic parts for visible and legible resin identification codes (e.g., numbers 1-7 inside recycling triangles) according to ISO standards; verify manufacturer documentation and labeling compliance.
indicators.target: All plastic components must be clearly marked with standardized recycling codes to ensure recyclability and compliance with WEEE Directive requirements.

indicators.name: Rare Earth Metal Reduction
indicators.description: Evaluates the extent to which the product minimizes the use of rare earth metals to enhance recyclability and reduce environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Verify material composition through manufacturer declarations and material safety data sheets (MSDS); conduct laboratory analysis to quantify rare earth metal content; review compliance with EU Ecodesign requirements under ESPR and WEEE Directive restrictions.
indicators.target: Significant reduction or elimination of rare earth metals compared to conventional products, aiming for less than 0.1% by weight where feasible.

indicators.name: Take-back Programs
indicators.description: Evaluation of the availability and accessibility of manufacturer or retailer take-back programs for end-of-life electronic products to ensure proper recycling and disposal.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of documented take-back programs through manufacturer declarations, check retailer participation in take-back initiatives, and confirm program compliance with local regulations such as the WEEE Directive and ESPR requirements.
indicators.target: Product must have an active take-back program accessible to consumers in Brazil, ensuring collection and recycling of end-of-life electronics.

indicators.name: Recyclability Rate
indicators.description: Evaluation of the percentage of the electronic product's materials that can be recycled at end-of-life, ensuring minimal environmental impact through effective material recovery.
indicators.measurement: Calculate the recyclability rate by analyzing the product's material composition and verifying the proportion of recyclable materials using standardized material assessment protocols and lifecycle analysis tools in accordance with ESPR and WEEE Directive guidelines.
indicators.target: Recyclability rate greater than 85%

indicators.name: Energy Star Certification
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the electronic product meets recognized energy efficiency standards by being certified under Energy Star or an equivalent certification.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of valid Energy Star certification labels or equivalent certifications on the product or in official product documentation, cross-checking with certification databases where applicable.
indicators.target: Product must be certified under Energy Star or an equivalent recognized energy efficiency certification.

indicators.name: Low Standby Power
indicators.description: Evaluates the standby power consumption of electronic products to ensure minimal energy use when not in active operation, reducing overall energy waste.
indicators.measurement: Measure the power consumption of the device in standby mode using a calibrated power meter under standardized test conditions as specified by ESPR or equivalent protocols.
indicators.target: Standby power consumption less than 0.5 watts (< 0.5W).

indicators.name: Energy-efficient Components
indicators.description: Evaluation of the use of energy-efficient components such as LED displays and other low-power technologies that reduce overall energy consumption of electronic products.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of LED displays or equivalent energy-saving components through product specifications and technical datasheets; confirm energy efficiency claims via third-party certifications and manufacturer declarations.
indicators.target: Use of LED displays or equivalent energy-efficient components that demonstrably reduce power consumption compared to conventional alternatives.

indicators.name: Power Management Features
indicators.description: Evaluation of the presence and effectiveness of power management features that reduce energy consumption during idle or low-use periods in electronic devices.
indicators.measurement: Verify device specifications and settings for power management capabilities such as automatic sleep mode, hibernation, and adjustable power states; perform energy consumption tests during idle periods using power meters.
indicators.target: Devices should implement automatic power management features that reduce energy consumption by at least 30% during idle states compared to full operation.

indicators.name: Procel Certification
indicators.description: Evaluation of the product's energy efficiency based on compliance with the Procel certification standards, which indicate energy-saving performance for electronics in the Brazilian market.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of the Procel certification label on the product or in official product documentation; cross-check with the Brazilian National Program for Energy Conservation (Procel) database or manufacturer declarations confirming certification.
indicators.target: Product must hold valid Procel certification indicating compliance with Brazilian energy efficiency requirements.
data_sources: Brazilian National Program for Energy Conservation (Procel) Database

indicators.name: Recycled Content
indicators.description: Evaluates the proportion of recycled materials used in the product's components to reduce environmental impact and resource depletion.
indicators.measurement: Verify the percentage of recycled content through manufacturer declarations, material composition analysis, and certification documentation confirming recycled material use.
indicators.target: Recycled content greater than 30%

indicators.name: RoHS Compliance
indicators.description: Evaluation of the absence of hazardous substances in electronic products according to the Restriction of Hazardous Substances (RoHS) directive, ensuring materials do not contain restricted hazardous chemicals above specified limits.
indicators.measurement: Verify product compliance through laboratory chemical analysis (e.g., XRF spectroscopy), review of manufacturer declarations of conformity, and certification documentation confirming RoHS adherence.
indicators.target: No presence of restricted hazardous substances above RoHS limits (e.g., lead, mercury, cadmium, hexavalent chromium, PBB, PBDE) as defined by the EU RoHS directive.

indicators.name: Conflict-Free Minerals
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the electronic product uses minerals sourced from conflict-free regions, ensuring ethical supply chains and compliance with responsible sourcing standards.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of conflict-free minerals certification through supplier declarations, third-party audit reports, and certification labels on the product or documentation.
indicators.target: Product must be certified as using 100% conflict-free minerals according to recognized certification schemes.

indicators.name: Reduced Recyclable Packaging
indicators.description: Evaluates the extent to which electronic products use minimized packaging materials that are fully recyclable, aiming to reduce waste and environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Verify packaging weight relative to product weight; assess packaging material composition for recyclability through material analysis and documentation; confirm compliance with packaging reduction targets and recyclability criteria via manufacturer declarations and third-party audits.
indicators.target: Packaging weight reduced by at least 20% compared to conventional packaging, with 100% of packaging materials being recyclable.

indicators.name: Ocean-bound Plastic Use
indicators.description: Evaluates the incorporation of ocean-bound plastic materials in electronic products where applicable, aiming to reduce marine pollution by utilizing recovered plastics.
indicators.measurement: Verify the percentage of ocean-bound plastic content through manufacturer declarations, material certifications, and third-party lab testing of plastic components; cross-check with supply chain documentation and product sustainability reports.
indicators.target: Use of ocean-bound plastic materials in applicable components, with a minimum incorporation rate defined by the manufacturer or sustainability standard.

textiles_clothing.name: Textiles, Clothing & Footwear

indicators.name: Organic or Recycled Fiber Content
indicators.description: Evaluation of the fiber composition in textiles to ensure that more than 50% of the fibers used are either organic or recycled, promoting sustainable material sourcing.
indicators.measurement: Verify fiber content through supplier declarations, laboratory fiber composition analysis, and review of product certifications indicating organic or recycled material percentages.
indicators.target: At least 50% of the fibers used in the product must be certified organic or recycled.
data_sources: Product labels indicating recycled or organic content

indicators.name: Harmful Chemicals Absence
indicators.description: Evaluates whether textile products are free from harmful chemicals as defined by the OEKO-TEX Standard 100, ensuring consumer safety and environmental protection.
indicators.measurement: Verify product certification against OEKO-TEX Standard 100 through label inspection and cross-check with certified product databases; conduct chemical residue testing if certification is unavailable.
indicators.target: Textile products must comply with OEKO-TEX Standard 100 limits, indicating no presence of harmful chemicals above allowed thresholds.

indicators.name: Sustainable Fiber Sourcing
indicators.description: Evaluation of the sourcing of textile fibers to ensure they come from sustainable origins such as Better Cotton Initiative (BCI) cotton and Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) certified viscose, promoting environmental and social responsibility.
indicators.measurement: Verify supplier documentation and product labels for certification claims of BCI cotton and FSC viscose; conduct audits or request third-party verification reports confirming sustainable sourcing; cross-check compliance with relevant standards and bans such as ESPR textile ban.
indicators.target: 100% of cotton fibers sourced from BCI certified producers and 100% of viscose fibers sourced from FSC certified forests.

indicators.name: Biodegradable or Recyclable Materials
indicators.description: Evaluation of textile and clothing products based on the use of materials that are either biodegradable or recyclable, ensuring reduced environmental impact and compliance with sustainability regulations.
indicators.measurement: Verify product material composition through manufacturer declarations and product labels; confirm certification compliance via GOTS, Bluesign, and Cradle to Cradle certificates; cross-check adherence to ESPR textile ban and ISO 14001 environmental management standards.
indicators.target: 100% of materials used in the product are biodegradable or recyclable, complying with ESPR textile ban requirements.

indicators.name: Natural Fiber Preference
indicators.description: Evaluates the proportion of natural fibers used in textile products compared to synthetic fibers, prioritizing natural fibers to reduce environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Analyze fiber composition through product labels, manufacturer declarations, and laboratory fiber content testing to verify that natural fibers constitute the majority of the material used.
indicators.target: Natural fibers must constitute over 50% of the total fiber content in the textile product.

indicators.name: Brazilian Organic Cotton
indicators.description: Evaluation of the use of organic cotton sourced specifically from Brazil in textile products, ensuring sustainable agricultural practices and reduced environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Verify the origin of cotton fibers through supplier documentation and traceability systems; confirm organic certification status via recognized certificates; conduct audits or request third-party verification reports.
indicators.target: 100% of cotton fibers used in the product are certified organic and sourced from Brazil.

indicators.name: Digital Product Passport Compliance
indicators.description: Evaluation of the product's adherence to Digital Product Passport (DPP) requirements, ensuring traceability and transparency of material composition and sustainability credentials.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence and completeness of the Digital Product Passport data through product labels, QR codes, or manufacturer-provided digital records; cross-check material information against recognized sustainability certifications and regulatory compliance.
indicators.target: 100% of products must have a compliant Digital Product Passport providing full material disclosure and sustainability information.

indicators.name: Low Water Consumption
indicators.description: Evaluation of the water usage during the textile manufacturing process, focusing on minimizing water consumption to reduce environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Quantify total water consumption per kilogram of textile produced using factory water audit reports and verify compliance through third-party water footprint assessments.
indicators.target: Water consumption below industry average benchmarks, ideally less than 50 liters per kilogram of textile produced.

indicators.name: Renewable Energy Use
indicators.description: Evaluation of the proportion of renewable energy utilized during the textile or clothing production process to reduce environmental impact and comply with sustainability standards.
indicators.measurement: Verify energy consumption records and energy sourcing reports from manufacturers; conduct audits to assess the percentage of renewable energy used; review certifications indicating renewable energy compliance.
indicators.target: At least 50% of total energy consumption in production sourced from renewable energy.

indicators.name: Reduced Chemical Dyes
indicators.description: Evaluation of the use of natural or low-impact chemical dyes in textile production to minimize environmental and health impacts associated with conventional dyeing processes.
indicators.measurement: Verification through review of dye types used in production, chemical input records, laboratory analysis of fabric samples for hazardous substances, and compliance audits against recognized dye standards.
indicators.target: Use of 100% natural or certified low-impact dyes, avoiding banned or hazardous chemical dyes as per ESPR textile ban regulations.

indicators.name: Local Production
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether textile and clothing products are manufactured locally or regionally to minimize transport-related greenhouse gas emissions.
indicators.measurement: Verify the origin of production through manufacturer declarations, supply chain documentation, and transport distance analysis; assess compliance with local/regional production criteria by mapping production sites within defined geographic boundaries.
indicators.target: At least 80% of production processes occur within the local or regional area to significantly reduce transport emissions.

indicators.name: Zero Liquid Discharge
indicators.description: Evaluation of the implementation of zero liquid discharge (ZLD) systems in textile production to eliminate wastewater discharge by recycling and reusing all process water.
indicators.measurement: Verify installation and operation of ZLD systems through factory audits, review of wastewater treatment records, and water quality testing to confirm no liquid effluent is discharged.
indicators.target: 100% elimination of liquid effluent discharge through closed-loop water recycling systems.

indicators.name: High-Quality Construction
indicators.description: Evaluation of the garment's construction quality to ensure longevity and resistance to wear and tear over time.
indicators.measurement: Inspect stitching density and type, fabric tensile strength tests, abrasion resistance tests, and seam strength evaluations according to ISO 13934-1 and ISO 12947 standards.
indicators.target: Garments must demonstrate high stitching density (>12 stitches per 3 cm), abrasion resistance exceeding 20,000 rubs, and seam strength meeting or exceeding ISO standards to ensure longevity.

indicators.name: Timeless Design
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the textile or clothing product features a timeless design that avoids fast fashion trends, promoting longer use and reducing waste.
indicators.measurement: Review product design documentation and marketing materials to verify the absence of fast fashion characteristics; assess product lifecycle claims and check for certifications indicating sustainable design practices.
indicators.target: Product must demonstrate design longevity by avoiding fast fashion trends, supporting extended use beyond typical seasonal cycles.

indicators.name: Reinforced Seams Quality
indicators.description: Evaluation of the presence and integrity of reinforced seams and quality stitching in textile products to ensure enhanced durability and resistance to wear.
indicators.measurement: Visual inspection and tensile strength testing of seams using standardized seam strength tests (e.g., ASTM D1683), complemented by microscopic analysis of stitch uniformity and thread quality.
indicators.target: Seams must be reinforced with double or triple stitching, exhibiting a minimum seam strength of 15 Newtons per millimeter and no visible stitch defects.

indicators.name: Colorfastness and Shape Retention
indicators.description: Evaluation of the textile's ability to maintain original color without fading and retain its shape after repeated washing and wear.
indicators.measurement: Conduct standardized colorfastness tests (e.g., ISO 105 series) and dimensional stability tests after multiple wash cycles as per ISO 6330 or equivalent protocols.
indicators.target: No significant color change (grade 4 or higher on gray scale) and less than 3% dimensional change after 5 wash cycles.

indicators.name: Fair Wages and Conditions
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether textile and clothing products are manufactured under fair wages and safe working conditions, ensuring compliance with labor rights and social responsibility standards.
indicators.measurement: Verification through audit reports, worker interviews, wage slips, and compliance certificates from recognized social responsibility standards; assessment of workplace safety records and labor practice documentation.
indicators.target: All manufacturing sites must comply with fair wage standards and safe working conditions as defined by SA8000, with zero violations reported.

indicators.name: No Child Labor
indicators.description: Evaluation of the absence of child labor practices in the production of textiles and clothing, ensuring compliance with labor laws and ethical standards.
indicators.measurement: Verification through supplier audits, review of labor records, third-party certification checks, and on-site inspections to confirm no employment of individuals under the legal working age.
indicators.target: Zero instances of child labor in the entire supply chain.

indicators.name: Safe Working Environments
indicators.description: Evaluation of the implementation and maintenance of safe and healthy working conditions in textile and clothing manufacturing facilities to protect workers from hazards and ensure compliance with labor safety standards.
indicators.measurement: Verification through on-site safety audits, review of occupational health and safety management systems, incident and accident records, worker interviews, and compliance checks against recognized standards and certifications.
indicators.target: 100% compliance with occupational health and safety standards ensuring zero tolerance for unsafe working conditions and continuous improvement in workplace safety.

indicators.name: Supply Chain Transparency
indicators.description: Evaluation of the extent to which the textile product's supply chain is openly disclosed, ensuring traceability and accountability from raw material sourcing to finished product. This includes verification of social and environmental practices throughout the supply chain.
indicators.measurement: Review of supply chain documentation and disclosures, verification of traceability reports, audits of supplier practices, and cross-checking certifications that require transparency such as SA8000 and Fair Trade. Use of third-party verification tools and manufacturer declarations to confirm transparency levels.
indicators.target: Full disclosure of supply chain stages with verified traceability and compliance to social responsibility standards.

indicators.name: Worker Empowerment Programs
indicators.description: Evaluation of the implementation and effectiveness of programs aimed at empowering workers, including training, participation in decision-making, and rights awareness within the textile and clothing manufacturing process.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of documented worker empowerment initiatives through audits, review of training records, worker interviews, and assessment of compliance reports from recognized certification bodies.
indicators.target: All textile and clothing manufacturers should have active worker empowerment programs that include regular training sessions and documented worker participation mechanisms.

indicators.name: Take-back Programs
indicators.description: Evaluation of the presence and effectiveness of take-back or recycling programs implemented by the manufacturer or retailer to manage the product's end-of-life phase responsibly.
indicators.measurement: Verify the existence of documented take-back or recycling initiatives through manufacturer declarations, program participation records, and third-party audits; assess program accessibility and consumer participation rates.
indicators.target: Implementation of a take-back or recycling program covering 100% of sold textile products, ensuring responsible end-of-life management in compliance with ESPR textile ban requirements.

indicators.name: Mono-material Design
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the textile or clothing product is designed using a single material type to facilitate easier recycling and end-of-life processing.
indicators.measurement: Verify product composition through material analysis reports or manufacturer declarations confirming the use of only one type of fiber or material throughout the product; conduct physical inspections or lab testing to confirm absence of mixed materials.
indicators.target: Product is composed of 100% mono-material to ensure recyclability without separation.

indicators.name: Repair Services Availability
indicators.description: Evaluates whether repair services are offered to extend the product's lifespan and reduce textile waste at end of life.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of documented repair service options through manufacturer declarations, service provider listings, or customer support channels; confirm accessibility and scope of repair services offered.
indicators.target: Repair services must be available and accessible for all products within the textile/clothing category to promote product longevity.

indicators.name: Upcycling Programs
indicators.description: Evaluation of the implementation and effectiveness of upcycling programs aimed at extending the lifecycle of textile products by transforming waste materials into new, higher-value items.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of documented upcycling initiatives, review program scope and volume of materials upcycled annually, and assess third-party audit reports or manufacturer declarations on upcycling activities.
indicators.target: Establish and maintain active upcycling programs that divert at least 30% of textile waste from disposal through reuse or transformation into new products.

references: EU Strategy for Sustainable and Circular Textiles

indicators.name: Organic Farming Practices
indicators.description: Evaluation of agricultural production methods ensuring no use of synthetic pesticides or fertilizers, promoting environmentally sustainable and chemical-free farming.
indicators.measurement: Verification through certification documents confirming organic status, laboratory testing for pesticide residues, and review of farm input records to confirm absence of synthetic chemicals.
indicators.target: No use of synthetic pesticides or synthetic fertilizers throughout the production cycle.

indicators.name: Regenerative Agriculture
indicators.description: Evaluation of agricultural practices that restore soil health, enhance biodiversity, and improve ecosystem services through regenerative techniques.
indicators.measurement: Verification through on-site audits assessing soil organic matter levels, crop rotation diversity, cover cropping, reduced tillage, and carbon sequestration practices; review of farm management plans and sustainability reports.
indicators.target: Implementation of regenerative agriculture practices that increase soil organic carbon by at least 10% over baseline within 3 years and maintain biodiversity indicators above regional thresholds.

indicators.name: Biodiversity Conservation
indicators.description: Evaluation of agricultural production practices that maintain or enhance local biodiversity by preserving native species, habitats, and ecological functions within and around production sites.
indicators.measurement: Assessment through biodiversity audits, habitat mapping, species inventory surveys, and verification of conservation practices via third-party certification reports and on-site inspections.
indicators.target: Implementation of production methods that prevent biodiversity loss and promote habitat conservation, verified by compliance with recognized biodiversity standards and certifications.

indicators.name: Soil Health Management
indicators.description: Evaluation of practices aimed at maintaining or improving soil fertility, structure, and biodiversity to ensure sustainable crop production and ecosystem balance.
indicators.measurement: Assessment through soil quality testing (organic matter content, pH, nutrient levels), review of crop rotation and cover cropping practices, and verification of erosion control measures via farm audits and soil monitoring reports.
indicators.target: Maintain or increase soil organic matter by at least 0.5% annually, implement crop rotation or cover crops on 100% of arable land, and prevent soil erosion to below 5 tons per hectare per year.

indicators.name: Integrated Pest Management
indicators.description: Evaluation of the implementation of integrated pest management (IPM) practices that minimize chemical pesticide use by combining biological, cultural, physical, and chemical tools to control pests sustainably.
indicators.measurement: Verification through documented pest management plans, records of pesticide application frequency and quantities, use of biological control agents, field inspections, and compliance audits against IPM protocols.
indicators.target: Adoption of IPM practices that reduce chemical pesticide use by at least 50% compared to conventional methods, with documented evidence of alternative pest control measures applied.

indicators.name: Agroforestry Systems
indicators.description: Evaluation of the implementation and management of agroforestry systems (SAFs) that integrate trees with crops and/or livestock to enhance biodiversity, soil health, and sustainable production.
indicators.measurement: Verification through on-site inspections assessing the presence and diversity of tree species integrated with agricultural production, review of farm management plans, and documentation of agroforestry practices aligned with FAO Guidelines and ISO 14001 standards.
indicators.target: Establishment of diversified agroforestry systems covering at least 30% of the production area, maintaining tree-crop or tree-livestock integration consistent with sustainable agroecological principles.

indicators.name: Brazilian Bioeconomy Practices
indicators.description: Evaluation of agricultural production methods that integrate sustainable bioeconomy principles in Brazil, focusing on resource efficiency, biodiversity conservation, and socio-economic benefits.
indicators.measurement: Verification through on-site audits assessing adherence to bioeconomy principles, review of sustainability management plans, analysis of resource use efficiency metrics, and confirmation of compliance with recognized standards and certifications.
indicators.target: Full compliance with Brazilian bioeconomy principles as outlined in FAO Guidelines and IFOAM standards, demonstrated by certification under Organic, Fairtrade, Rainforest Alliance, or UTZ schemes applicable in Brazil.

indicators.name: Low Carbon Footprint
indicators.description: Evaluation of the product's greenhouse gas emissions throughout its lifecycle, focusing on minimizing carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gases released during production, processing, and distribution.
indicators.measurement: Quantify carbon emissions using life cycle assessment (LCA) tools aligned with ISO 14001 standards, verify carbon footprint reports from manufacturers, and cross-check with certifications that promote sustainable practices.
indicators.target: Achieve a carbon footprint reduction of at least 20% compared to conventional benchmarks or maintain emissions below 1.5 kg CO2e per kg of product.

indicators.name: Efficient Water Use
indicators.description: Evaluation of the product's water consumption efficiency during agricultural production, focusing on minimizing water waste and optimizing irrigation practices to reduce environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Assessment through water use audits, irrigation system efficiency tests, and verification of water management plans aligned with FAO Guidelines and ISO 14001 standards. Review of water consumption records and onsite inspections to confirm implementation of water-saving techniques.
indicators.target: Achieve at least 20% reduction in water use compared to conventional practices or comply with water efficiency benchmarks defined by FAO Guidelines.

indicators.name: Deforestation Impact
indicators.description: Evaluates the extent to which the product's production minimizes deforestation and preserves forest ecosystems, ensuring sustainable land use practices.
indicators.measurement: Assessment through supply chain traceability reports, satellite imagery analysis for land use changes, certification audits verifying no recent deforestation, and review of supplier environmental impact statements.
indicators.target: Zero deforestation impact, with no conversion of natural forests for agricultural production within the supply chain.

indicators.name: Natural Habitat Protection
indicators.description: Evaluation of measures taken to prevent deforestation and degradation of key Brazilian biomes such as the Amazon, Cerrado, and Mata Atlantica during agricultural production.
indicators.measurement: Verification through satellite imagery analysis, on-site inspections, and review of land use permits to ensure no conversion of natural habitats; assessment of compliance with environmental regulations and certification audit reports.
indicators.target: Zero deforestation or habitat conversion in the Amazon, Cerrado, and Mata Atlantica regions associated with product sourcing and production.

indicators.name: Greenhouse Gas Reduction
indicators.description: Evaluation of the reduction in greenhouse gas emissions associated with the production and supply chain of the food or agricultural product, focusing on practices that minimize carbon footprint and promote sustainable resource use.
indicators.measurement: Quantify greenhouse gas emissions using life cycle assessment (LCA) methodologies aligned with ISO 14001 standards, verify adoption of emission-reducing practices through certification audits, and review manufacturer declarations on carbon management strategies.
indicators.target: Achieve measurable reduction in greenhouse gas emissions compared to conventional benchmarks, aiming for at least a 20% decrease in CO2-equivalent emissions per unit of product.

indicators.name: Native Vegetation Protection
indicators.description: Assessment of whether the production process avoids any conversion or clearing of native vegetation to preserve biodiversity and ecosystem services.
indicators.measurement: Verification through satellite imagery analysis, land use change records, on-site inspections, and review of environmental impact assessments to confirm absence of native vegetation conversion.
indicators.target: Zero hectares of native vegetation converted for production purposes.

indicators.name: Fair Wages
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether farmers and workers involved in production receive wages that meet or exceed fair labor standards, ensuring economic equity and social justice.
indicators.measurement: Verification through wage records, payroll audits, worker interviews, and third-party certification audits assessing compliance with fair wage criteria.
indicators.target: All farmers and workers receive wages at or above the local living wage standard as defined by FAO Guidelines and relevant Brazilian labor laws.

indicators.name: Safe Working Conditions
indicators.description: Evaluation of workplace safety measures ensuring protection of workers from hazards, compliance with labor safety regulations, and implementation of risk management practices in food and agriculture production.
indicators.measurement: Verification through workplace safety audits, review of incident and accident records, assessment of compliance with FAO Guidelines and ISO 14001 safety protocols, and worker interviews to confirm training and use of protective equipment.
indicators.target: Zero workplace accidents related to unsafe conditions; full compliance with FAO Guidelines and ISO 14001 standards for occupational health and safety.

indicators.name: Local Community Support
indicators.description: Evaluation of the extent to which agricultural practices and product sourcing contribute to the economic and social development of local communities, including fair labor conditions and community engagement.
indicators.measurement: Verification through supplier audits, community impact assessments, review of fair trade certifications, and documentation of local employment rates and community development projects.
indicators.target: Full compliance with fair labor practices benefiting local communities, demonstrated by certification under recognized standards and active community development initiatives.

indicators.name: Child and Forced Labor
indicators.description: Evaluation of the absence of child labor and forced labor practices in the production and supply chain of food and agricultural products, ensuring compliance with ethical labor standards.
indicators.measurement: Verification through on-site labor audits, worker interviews, supply chain documentation review, and third-party certification assessments to confirm no involvement of child or forced labor.
indicators.target: Zero instances of child labor or forced labor detected in the entire supply chain.

indicators.name: Gender Equality
indicators.description: Assessment of equitable treatment and opportunities for all genders within the agricultural workforce, including fair wages, representation in decision-making, and prevention of discrimination or harassment.
indicators.measurement: Verification through workplace gender ratio statistics, wage audits comparing genders, review of company policies on gender equality and anti-discrimination, employee interviews, and third-party certification audits.
indicators.target: Achieve gender parity in employment and leadership roles, ensure equal pay for equal work, and maintain zero tolerance for gender-based discrimination or harassment.

indicators.name: Indigenous Community Support
indicators.description: Evaluation of the extent to which the product's supply chain actively supports indigenous communities through fair labor practices, cultural respect, and economic inclusion.
indicators.measurement: Verification through supplier audits, community engagement reports, and compliance with recognized certifications that mandate indigenous rights protections; review of documented partnerships or benefit-sharing agreements with indigenous groups.
indicators.target: Full compliance with indigenous community support criteria as defined by certifications and standards, including documented evidence of benefit-sharing or direct support initiatives.

indicators.name: Quilombola Community Support
indicators.description: Evaluation of the extent to which agricultural products support Quilombola communities through fair labor practices, community engagement, and respect for traditional land rights.
indicators.measurement: Verification through supplier audits, community impact assessments, review of labor contracts, and documentation of partnerships or benefit-sharing agreements with Quilombola communities.
indicators.target: Full compliance with fair labor practices and active support initiatives benefiting Quilombola communities, demonstrated by documented agreements and positive community feedback.

indicators.name: Supply Chain Transparency
indicators.description: Evaluation of the clarity and completeness of the product's supply chain information, ensuring all stages from production to distribution are documented and accessible.
indicators.measurement: Verification through documented supply chain records, traceability audits, and cross-checking with certification databases; use of blockchain or digital traceability tools where applicable.
indicators.target: 100% traceability of product supply chain stages with verifiable documentation.

indicators.name: Origin Labeling
indicators.description: Evaluation of the presence and accuracy of origin labeling on food and agricultural products to ensure traceability from source to consumer.
indicators.measurement: Verification through inspection of product packaging for clear origin labels, cross-checking with manufacturer declarations, and auditing supply chain documentation to confirm consistency and accuracy.
indicators.target: 100% of products must have accurate and verifiable origin labels indicating the source of raw materials or production location.

indicators.name: Certification Verification
indicators.description: Evaluation of the availability and validity of recognized certification documents that verify the traceability of the product's agricultural or food origin.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence and authenticity of certification documents such as Organic, Fairtrade, Rainforest Alliance, UTZ, and MSC through official certification bodies or databases; cross-check product labels and manufacturer declarations for certification claims.
indicators.target: 100% of products must have valid certification verification from recognized bodies.

indicators.name: Digital Traceability
indicators.description: Evaluation of the implementation of blockchain or digital tracking systems to ensure full traceability of food and agricultural products throughout the supply chain.
indicators.measurement: Verification through audit of blockchain records or digital tracking platforms demonstrating product origin, processing steps, and distribution; cross-checking with supply chain documentation and traceability reports.
indicators.target: 100% of product batches tracked using blockchain or equivalent digital systems ensuring end-to-end traceability.

indicators.name: SisOrg Registration
indicators.description: Evaluation of the product's traceability through its registration in the Brazilian SisOrg system, ensuring compliance with national organic certification requirements.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of a valid SisOrg registration number on product documentation or labels, cross-check with the official SisOrg database to confirm authenticity and current status.
indicators.target: Product must have an active and valid SisOrg registration number as per Brazilian organic certification standards.

indicators.name: Minimal Packaging
indicators.description: Evaluates the extent to which product packaging is minimized to reduce environmental impact by limiting material use and waste generation.
indicators.measurement: Assess packaging weight and volume relative to product size; verify use of recyclable or biodegradable materials; conduct visual inspections and review manufacturer packaging specifications.
indicators.target: Packaging should use the least amount of material necessary to ensure product protection and hygiene, aiming for a reduction of at least 20% compared to conventional packaging standards.

indicators.name: Recyclable or Compostable Packaging
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the product packaging is made from materials that are recyclable or compostable, reducing environmental impact and supporting circular economy principles.
indicators.measurement: Verify packaging material composition through manufacturer declarations and material safety data sheets; conduct lab tests if necessary to confirm recyclability or compostability; check for recycling or compostability labels according to Brazilian standards.
indicators.target: 100% of packaging materials should be recyclable or compostable.

indicators.name: No Single-Use Plastics
indicators.description: Evaluation of packaging materials to ensure that no single-use plastics are used in the product packaging, promoting sustainability and reducing plastic waste.
indicators.measurement: Verification through material composition analysis of packaging, review of supplier declarations, and physical inspection to confirm absence of single-use plastic components.
indicators.target: 0% single-use plastic content in all packaging materials.

indicators.name: Food Waste Reduction
indicators.description: Evaluation of packaging design and materials that minimize food spoilage and loss throughout the supply chain, thereby reducing overall food waste.
indicators.measurement: Assess packaging integrity, shelf-life extension properties, and portion control features through laboratory testing and supply chain audits; verify use of packaging materials that comply with FAO Guidelines and ISO 14001 standards for waste reduction.
indicators.target: Packaging solutions must demonstrably reduce food waste by at least 20% compared to conventional packaging within similar product categories.

indicators.name: Recycled Content
indicators.description: Evaluates the proportion of recycled materials incorporated in the construction product to promote resource efficiency and reduce environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Verify the percentage of recycled content through manufacturer declarations, third-party certifications, and product environmental declarations (EPDs). Conduct material composition analysis if necessary.
indicators.target: Recycled content greater than 30%

indicators.name: Sustainable Material Sourcing
indicators.description: Evaluation of the sourcing of raw materials to ensure they are obtained through sustainable practices that minimize environmental impact and promote resource renewal.
indicators.measurement: Verification through certification review (e.g., FSC, Cradle to Cradle), analysis of Environmental Product Declarations (EPD), and compliance with ISO 21930 and ISO 14001 standards; assessment of supplier sustainability reports and chain of custody documentation.
indicators.target: 100% of raw materials sourced must be certified under recognized sustainability certifications or demonstrate compliance with relevant environmental standards.

indicators.name: Low Embodied Carbon
indicators.description: Evaluation of the embodied carbon footprint of construction materials to ensure minimal greenhouse gas emissions during extraction, processing, and transportation.
indicators.measurement: Verify embodied carbon values through Environmental Product Declarations (EPD) compliant with ISO 21930 and cross-check with manufacturer data and life cycle assessment reports.
indicators.target: Materials must demonstrate embodied carbon values below industry benchmarks as defined by ISO 21930 and EU Green Building standards.

indicators.name: Regional Material Use
indicators.description: Evaluates the proportion of construction materials sourced from within a 500 km radius to reduce transportation-related environmental impacts.
indicators.measurement: Verify supplier and manufacturer declarations of material origin, cross-check transport distances using GPS or logistics data, and review product labels indicating regional sourcing.
indicators.target: At least 90% of materials by weight or volume sourced from within 500 km of the construction site.

indicators.name: Renewable Material Use
indicators.description: Evaluates the extent to which construction materials are sourced from renewable resources, prioritizing materials that can be replenished naturally within a short timeframe to reduce environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Verify the percentage of materials certified as renewable through recognized certifications and product declarations; conduct documentation review of supplier certifications and material composition reports.
indicators.target: At least 75% of materials used should be renewable as certified by recognized standards or certifications.

indicators.name: FSC-Certified Brazilian Wood
indicators.description: Evaluation of the sourcing of wood materials to ensure they are certified by the Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) and originate from Brazil, promoting sustainable forest management and legal compliance.
indicators.measurement: Verification through FSC chain of custody certificates specific to Brazilian wood suppliers, review of supplier declarations, and cross-checking with FSC online certificate database.
indicators.target: 100% of wood materials sourced must be FSC-certified and originate from Brazil.

indicators.name: Low VOC Emissions
indicators.description: Evaluates the level of volatile organic compounds (VOCs) emitted by construction materials to ensure indoor air quality and reduce environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Verify VOC emission levels through standardized testing methods such as ISO 16000 series or equivalent, review product EPDs, and check compliance with LEED and BREEAM VOC limits.
indicators.target: VOC emissions below 0.5 mg/m³ or compliant with LEED low-emitting materials criteria.

indicators.name: Energy-efficient Production
indicators.description: Evaluation of the energy consumption and efficiency during the manufacturing process of construction materials, focusing on minimizing environmental impact through reduced energy use and cleaner production methods.
indicators.measurement: Verification through energy consumption data from manufacturers, life cycle assessment reports, and compliance audits; assessment of energy management systems and production process optimization documented in certifications.
indicators.target: Production processes demonstrating significant energy efficiency improvements, ideally achieving energy consumption reductions aligned with ISO 21930 and ISO 14001 standards, or meeting criteria set by LEED or BREEAM certifications.

indicators.name: Water Consumption
indicators.description: Evaluates the total water consumption involved in the production and lifecycle of construction materials to ensure minimal usage and reduce environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Quantify water usage through Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) reports following ISO 21930 standards, verify water consumption data in Environmental Product Declarations (EPD), and cross-check with manufacturer water usage declarations.
indicators.target: Achieve water consumption levels below industry average benchmarks as defined by ISO 21930 and EU Green Building standards, aiming for minimal water use in production processes.

indicators.name: Waste Reduction
indicators.description: Evaluation of the reduction of waste generated during the production process of construction materials, focusing on minimizing material loss and optimizing resource efficiency.
indicators.measurement: Assessment through waste audit reports, production process documentation, and verification of waste management practices; measurement of waste-to-product ratio and implementation of waste minimization strategies.
indicators.target: Achieve at least a 20% reduction in production waste compared to industry baseline or previous production cycles.

indicators.name: Carbon Sequestration Potential
indicators.description: Evaluation of the material's ability to capture and store atmospheric carbon dioxide over its lifecycle, contributing to reduced net greenhouse gas emissions.
indicators.measurement: Quantify carbon sequestration using life cycle assessment (LCA) compliant with ISO 21930, supported by Environmental Product Declarations (EPD) that report biogenic carbon content and storage duration.
indicators.target: Materials should demonstrate a net positive carbon sequestration effect over their lifecycle, with verified carbon storage exceeding emissions associated with production and transportation.

indicators.name: Long Lifespan
indicators.description: Evaluation of the material's expected service life to ensure it exceeds 25 years, indicating durability and reduced replacement frequency.
indicators.measurement: Verification through manufacturer technical datasheets, accelerated aging tests, and documented case studies demonstrating material performance over time.
indicators.target: Material lifespan greater than 25 years

indicators.name: Weather and Wear Resistance
indicators.description: Evaluates the ability of construction materials to withstand environmental weather conditions and mechanical wear over time without significant degradation.
indicators.measurement: Assess material performance through standardized weathering tests (e.g., UV exposure, moisture resistance), abrasion resistance tests, and review of manufacturer durability data; verify compliance with ISO 21930 durability criteria and EU Green Building weather resistance requirements.
indicators.target: Materials must demonstrate resistance to weathering and wear with minimal performance loss after standardized testing, meeting or exceeding ISO 21930 durability thresholds and EU Green Building standards.

indicators.name: Low Maintenance
indicators.description: Evaluation of the construction material's requirement for maintenance over its lifecycle, focusing on minimizing frequency and extent of upkeep to ensure long-term durability.
indicators.measurement: Assess maintenance frequency and type through manufacturer maintenance manuals, field inspection reports, and lifecycle cost analysis comparing expected vs. actual maintenance interventions.
indicators.target: Materials should require minimal maintenance interventions, ideally less than one major maintenance event per 5 years of service life.

indicators.name: Structural Integrity
indicators.description: Evaluation of the material's ability to maintain structural performance and resist degradation over its expected service life.
indicators.measurement: Conduct accelerated aging tests, mechanical strength assessments, and review manufacturer durability declarations; verify compliance with ISO 21930 durability criteria and EU Green Building standards.
indicators.target: Material maintains at least 90% of initial structural strength over a minimum service life of 50 years.

indicators.name: Tropical Climate Resistance
indicators.description: Evaluates the material's ability to withstand high humidity, temperature fluctuations, and biological factors typical of tropical climates without degradation.
indicators.measurement: Assess material performance through accelerated aging tests simulating tropical conditions, review manufacturer test reports, and verify resistance to mold, rot, and UV exposure.
indicators.target: Material must demonstrate resistance to tropical climate factors with no significant loss of structural integrity or appearance after standardized testing.

indicators.name: Thermal Insulation Performance
indicators.description: Evaluation of the material's ability to provide high thermal insulation, reducing heat transfer and improving energy efficiency in buildings.
indicators.measurement: Verify the material's thermal conductivity (λ-value) using standardized laboratory testing according to ISO 21930; assess U-value compliance in building applications; review manufacturer technical data sheets and third-party test reports.
indicators.target: Thermal conductivity (λ) less than or equal to 0.04 W/m·K to ensure high thermal insulation performance.

indicators.name: Energy Efficiency
indicators.description: Evaluates the energy consumption and performance of construction materials during the use phase to ensure reduced operational energy demand.
indicators.measurement: Verify through life cycle assessment (LCA) reports following ISO 21930, review Environmental Product Declarations (EPD) for energy use data, and assess compliance with EU Green Building energy performance criteria.
indicators.target: Materials must demonstrate reduced operational energy consumption compared to conventional alternatives, supported by certified EPDs and compliance with LEED or BREEAM energy efficiency credits.

indicators.name: Building Energy Efficiency
indicators.description: Evaluation of the product's contribution to reducing the overall energy consumption of buildings through improved thermal performance and energy-saving properties.
indicators.measurement: Assess product compliance with energy efficiency criteria via third-party certifications, review of Environmental Product Declarations (EPD) aligned with ISO 21930, and verification of manufacturer energy performance data. Conduct thermal performance testing and simulation according to EU Green Building standards.
indicators.target: Products should demonstrate measurable improvements in building energy efficiency, contributing to at least a 10% reduction in energy consumption compared to baseline materials.

indicators.name: Passive Design Compatibility
indicators.description: Evaluates the compatibility of construction materials with passive design principles aimed at reducing energy consumption through natural ventilation, insulation, and solar gain management.
indicators.measurement: Verify material specifications for thermal insulation values (R-value or U-value), solar reflectance index (SRI), and vapor permeability; assess compliance with passive design criteria through simulation tools or manufacturer data sheets.
indicators.target: Materials must meet or exceed thermal performance thresholds suitable for passive design in the Brazilian climate, such as U-value ≤ 0.35 W/m²K and SRI ≥ 29.

indicators.name: Recyclability and Reusability
indicators.description: Evaluates whether construction materials can be recycled or reused at the end of their life cycle to minimize waste and environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Verify through product declarations, recycling facility acceptance criteria, and manufacturer documentation confirming recyclability or reusability; conduct material composition analysis if necessary.
indicators.target: Materials must be either recyclable or reusable at a rate of at least 90% by weight at end of life.

indicators.name: Non-toxic Disposal
indicators.description: Evaluates whether construction materials can be disposed of without releasing toxic substances into the environment at the end of their life cycle.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of certifications and declarations ensuring non-toxic composition and disposal, such as Environmental Product Declarations (EPD) and Cradle to Cradle certification; review compliance with ISO 21930 and ISO 14001 standards; conduct chemical analysis or review manufacturer safety data sheets to confirm absence of hazardous substances.
indicators.target: Materials must be certified or demonstrated to be free from toxic substances that could harm the environment or human health upon disposal, enabling safe, non-toxic end-of-life management.

indicators.name: Deconstruction-Friendly Design
indicators.description: Evaluates the design of construction materials and components to facilitate easy disassembly, reuse, and recycling at the end of their lifecycle, minimizing waste and environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Assessment of product design documentation and construction plans for modularity, use of reversible connections, and absence of permanent adhesives; verification through on-site inspection and manufacturer declarations regarding deconstruction features.
indicators.target: Materials and components must be designed to allow at least 80% of their mass to be recoverable for reuse or recycling through non-destructive disassembly methods.

indicators.name: Circular Economy Integration
indicators.description: Evaluation of the extent to which construction materials are designed and managed to support reuse, recycling, and reduction of waste at the end of their life cycle, promoting circular economy principles.
indicators.measurement: Assess documentation and certifications verifying material recyclability, reuse potential, and waste reduction strategies, including cradle-to-cradle certification and environmental product declarations; review compliance with ISO 21930 and ISO 14001 standards and alignment with EU Green Building circular economy criteria.
indicators.target: Materials should demonstrate at least 75% end-of-life recyclability or reuse potential, supported by recognized certifications and documented circular economy strategies.

indicators.name: Sustainably Sourced Wood
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the wood used in furniture is sourced from sustainably managed forests, ensuring responsible forestry practices and reduced environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Verify wood sourcing through certification labels on product or supplier documentation, cross-check with FSC and PEFC certification databases, and review manufacturer declarations regarding wood origin.
indicators.target: 100% of wood materials used in furniture must be certified by FSC or PEFC.

indicators.name: Recycled/Recyclable Materials
indicators.description: Evaluation of the proportion and presence of recycled or recyclable materials used in furniture products to reduce environmental impact and support circular economy principles.
indicators.measurement: Verify material composition through manufacturer declarations, analyze product labels for recycled content percentages, and confirm recyclability via material datasheets or third-party testing reports.
indicators.target: Furniture products should contain a minimum of 30% recycled materials or be fully recyclable at end-of-life.

indicators.name: Formaldehyde-Free Materials
indicators.description: Evaluation of furniture materials to ensure they do not contain harmful chemicals, specifically verifying the absence of formaldehyde emissions or content.
indicators.measurement: Verify through laboratory testing of material samples for formaldehyde emissions using standardized methods such as ASTM E1333 or EN 717-1; review manufacturer declarations and product safety data sheets for formaldehyde-free certification.
indicators.target: Materials must be free of formaldehyde or emit formaldehyde levels below the detection limit defined by applicable standards, effectively formaldehyde-free.

indicators.name: Natural or Low-Impact Finishes
indicators.description: Evaluation of the use of natural or environmentally low-impact finishes on furniture materials to minimize harmful emissions and environmental footprint.
indicators.measurement: Verify product documentation and labels for the presence of natural or low-impact finishes through certification claims, chemical composition analysis, and compliance with recognized environmental standards.
indicators.target: Furniture finishes must be natural or demonstrate low environmental impact, verified by compliance with at least one recognized certification or standard.

indicators.name: Renewable Materials
indicators.description: Evaluation of the proportion and use of renewable raw materials in furniture production to ensure sustainability and resource regeneration.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence and percentage of renewable materials through supplier declarations, product technical sheets, and certification labels. Conduct audits to confirm compliance with renewable sourcing criteria.
indicators.target: At least 70% of the materials used in the furniture must be renewable, verified by recognized certifications or supplier documentation.

indicators.name: Brazilian Certified Wood
indicators.description: Evaluation of the use of wood sourced from Brazilian forests that are certified for sustainable management, ensuring legality and environmental responsibility.
indicators.measurement: Verify product documentation and supply chain records to confirm wood originates from Brazilian forests certified by recognized schemes; conduct audits or request third-party certification reports.
indicators.target: 100% of wood used in the furniture product must be certified as sustainably sourced from Brazilian forests.

indicators.name: High-Quality Construction
indicators.description: Evaluation of the furniture's structural integrity and material quality to ensure long-lasting durability under normal use conditions.
indicators.measurement: Inspect construction techniques, material density, and joint strength through standardized mechanical testing and visual inspection; verify compliance with durability standards.
indicators.target: Furniture must demonstrate resistance to wear and mechanical stress consistent with industry best practices for high-quality construction, ensuring a minimum lifespan of 10 years under normal use.

indicators.name: Timeless Design
indicators.description: Evaluation of the furniture's design longevity, focusing on aesthetics and functionality that remain relevant and appealing over extended periods, reducing the need for replacement.
indicators.measurement: Assess design through expert review panels and consumer surveys for style longevity; verify product lifecycle documentation and warranty periods indicating design relevance beyond 10 years.
indicators.target: Furniture design should maintain aesthetic and functional relevance for at least 10 years to minimize replacement frequency.

indicators.name: Repairable Components
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the furniture product is designed with components that can be easily repaired or replaced to extend its lifespan and reduce waste.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of modular or replaceable parts through product documentation, inspect repair manuals or instructions, and confirm availability of spare parts from the manufacturer or authorized service centers.
indicators.target: All major components of the furniture should be repairable or replaceable without requiring full product replacement.

indicators.name: Warranty Duration
indicators.description: Evaluates the minimum warranty period provided for the furniture product, indicating its expected durability and manufacturer confidence.
indicators.measurement: Verify the warranty period stated in the product documentation or manufacturer declaration, ensuring it exceeds 5 years.
indicators.target: Warranty period greater than 5 years

indicators.name: Modular Design
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the furniture is designed with modular components that allow easy repair, replacement, or upgrading of parts to extend product lifespan and reduce waste.
indicators.measurement: Verify product design documentation and physical inspection to confirm presence of modular components; check manufacturer declarations for modularity features; assess ease of disassembly and part replacement through user manuals or testing.
indicators.target: Furniture must have modular components enabling repair or replacement of at least 50% of parts without specialized tools.

indicators.name: Energy-efficient manufacturing
indicators.description: Evaluation of the manufacturing process to ensure energy consumption is minimized through efficient technologies and practices, reducing environmental impact during furniture production.
indicators.measurement: Verify energy consumption records and efficiency measures implemented during production; conduct audits of manufacturing facilities to assess energy use per unit produced; review implementation of energy management systems.
indicators.target: Manufacturing processes should demonstrate reduced energy consumption aligned with ESPR 2025-2030 targets and compliance with ISO 14001 energy management requirements.

indicators.name: Minimal Waste Production
indicators.description: Evaluation of the manufacturing process to ensure that waste generation is minimized through efficient material use and recycling practices during furniture production.
indicators.measurement: Assess waste logs and production records to quantify waste generated per unit produced; verify implementation of waste reduction strategies and recycling programs through on-site audits and review of environmental management systems.
indicators.target: Achieve a reduction in production waste by at least 20% compared to baseline measurements or maintain waste generation below 5% of total raw materials used.

indicators.name: Local Production
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the furniture is produced locally or regionally to reduce environmental impact associated with transportation and support local economies.
indicators.measurement: Verify the manufacturing location through supplier declarations, production site audits, and shipping documentation to confirm production within a defined local or regional radius (e.g., within the same state or neighboring states).
indicators.target: Furniture production occurs within a local or regional radius defined as within the same state or neighboring states in Brazil.

indicators.name: Fair Labor Practices
indicators.description: Evaluation of the adherence to fair labor practices during furniture production, ensuring ethical treatment, safe working conditions, and compliance with labor laws.
indicators.measurement: Verification through audits of labor conditions, review of supplier labor policies, worker interviews, and compliance checks against recognized labor standards.
indicators.target: 100% compliance with fair labor standards and no reported violations in production facilities.

indicators.name: Low VOC Emissions
indicators.description: Evaluation of the furniture product's volatile organic compound (VOC) emissions during and after production to ensure indoor air quality and reduce environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Measure VOC emissions using standardized air chamber testing methods such as ASTM D5116 or ISO 16000 series; verify compliance with emission limits through third-party laboratory analysis and review manufacturer VOC emission reports.
indicators.target: VOC emissions must comply with Green Guard certification limits or equivalent, ensuring emissions are below 0.5 mg/m³ for total VOCs in indoor air.

indicators.name: Easy Disassembly
indicators.description: Evaluates the furniture's design to allow easy disassembly to facilitate recycling and material recovery at the end of its life cycle.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of modular components, use of standardized fasteners, and availability of disassembly instructions; conduct physical disassembly tests to measure time and effort required.
indicators.target: Furniture should be designed for disassembly without damage, enabling at least 90% of components to be separated for recycling within 30 minutes by a trained technician.

indicators.name: Take-back Programs
indicators.description: Evaluation of the presence and effectiveness of take-back programs that allow consumers to return furniture products at the end of their life cycle for recycling, reuse, or proper disposal.
indicators.measurement: Verify the existence of documented take-back schemes through manufacturer declarations, check participation in recognized take-back initiatives, and assess program accessibility and coverage for Brazilian consumers.
indicators.target: The product must be part of a take-back program that ensures at least 90% of returned furniture is recycled or reused by 2030, aligned with ESPR 2025-2030 goals.

indicators.name: Recyclable or Biodegradable Materials
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the furniture product is made from materials that are either recyclable or biodegradable, ensuring environmentally responsible disposal at the end of its life cycle.
indicators.measurement: Verify material composition through manufacturer declarations and product technical sheets; confirm recyclability or biodegradability via third-party certifications or laboratory analysis; check for compliance with recognized ecolabels and standards.
indicators.target: 100% of materials used in the furniture product must be recyclable or biodegradable.

indicators.name: Refurbishment Options
indicators.description: Evaluation of the availability and feasibility of refurbishment options for furniture products to extend their useful life and reduce waste at end-of-life.
indicators.measurement: Verify presence of refurbishment programs or services offered by the manufacturer or third parties, assess product design features enabling refurbishment (e.g., modularity, ease of disassembly), and review documentation or declarations confirming refurbishment capability.
indicators.target: Furniture products should have clearly defined refurbishment options that enable at least 50% of components to be reused or restored, aligning with ESPR 2025-2030 goals.

indicators.name: Minimal Packaging
indicators.description: Evaluation of the packaging used for furniture products to ensure it is minimized to reduce waste and environmental impact while maintaining product protection.
indicators.measurement: Quantify the total packaging weight relative to product weight (packaging-to-product ratio), verify use of recyclable or biodegradable materials, and assess packaging design for reduction in volume and material use through supplier documentation and physical inspection.
indicators.target: Packaging weight should not exceed 10% of the product weight and use primarily recyclable or certified sustainable materials.

indicators.name: Recyclable Packaging
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the packaging materials used for furniture products are recyclable, ensuring reduced environmental impact and alignment with circular economy principles.
indicators.measurement: Verify packaging material composition through manufacturer declarations and material safety data sheets; conduct visual inspections for recycling symbols; confirm recyclability via recognized recycling guidelines and third-party certification reports.
indicators.target: 100% of packaging materials used must be recyclable according to recognized recycling standards.

indicators.name: Efficient Transport Design
