indicators.description: Evaluation of packaging design optimized for transport efficiency, focusing on minimizing volume and weight to reduce environmental impact during logistics.
indicators.measurement: Assess packaging dimensions and weight relative to product size; verify use of modular or stackable packaging; conduct transport load simulations or review manufacturer transport optimization reports.
indicators.target: Packaging design must minimize unused space and weight to reduce transport emissions, aiming for at least 20% volume reduction compared to standard packaging.

indicators.name: Flat-Pack Design
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the furniture packaging utilizes a flat-pack design to optimize space efficiency, reduce transportation volume, and minimize environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Verify packaging dimensions and configuration through product specifications and physical inspection to confirm flat-pack format; review manufacturer documentation and packaging design schematics.
indicators.target: Furniture products must be designed and packaged in a flat-pack format to maximize space efficiency and reduce transport emissions.

indicators.name: Natural and Organic Content
indicators.description: Evaluates the proportion of natural and organic ingredients present in the cosmetic or personal care product, ensuring it exceeds 70% of the total formulation.
indicators.measurement: Verify ingredient lists and supplier declarations to calculate the percentage of natural and organic components according to ISO 16128 guidelines; cross-check with product certifications and label claims.
indicators.target: >70% natural and organic ingredients

indicators.name: No Harmful Chemicals
indicators.description: Evaluation of cosmetic and personal care products to ensure they do not contain harmful chemicals such as parabens and phthalates, in compliance with relevant regulations and safety standards.
indicators.measurement: Verify ingredient lists through product labels and manufacturer declarations; conduct chemical analysis if necessary; cross-check compliance with EU Cosmetics Regulation, ISO 16128, and ANVISA standards.
indicators.target: 0% presence of harmful chemicals including parabens and phthalates in product formulations.

indicators.name: Biodegradable Formulations
indicators.description: Evaluation of cosmetic formulations to ensure that ingredients are biodegradable according to recognized standards, minimizing environmental impact after use.
indicators.measurement: Verification through ingredient biodegradability testing reports aligned with ISO 16128 guidelines, assessment of compliance with EU Cosmetics Regulation biodegradability criteria, and review of manufacturer declarations and product labels indicating biodegradability.
indicators.target: Formulations must contain ingredients that meet or exceed biodegradability thresholds defined by ISO 16128 and EU Cosmetics Regulation, ensuring full biodegradability within a specified timeframe (e.g., 28 days).

indicators.name: Microplastics Free
indicators.description: Evaluation of cosmetic and personal care products to ensure they do not contain intentionally added microplastic particles as ingredients, in compliance with regulatory and sustainability standards.
indicators.measurement: Verify ingredient lists and product formulations for presence of microplastics using chemical analysis methods such as Fourier-transform infrared spectroscopy (FTIR) or Raman spectroscopy; review manufacturer declarations and compliance with relevant regulations.
indicators.target: 0% intentionally added microplastic particles in product ingredients

indicators.name: Sustainably Sourced Ingredients
indicators.description: Evaluation of the origin of ingredients to ensure they are sourced sustainably, minimizing environmental impact and promoting ethical supply chains in cosmetic products.
indicators.measurement: Verification through supplier documentation, certification audits, and ingredient traceability reports confirming compliance with recognized sustainability standards and regulations.
indicators.target: 100% of ingredients sustainably sourced according to recognized certifications and regulatory standards.

indicators.name: Brazilian Biodiversity Ingredients
indicators.description: Evaluation of the presence and proportion of ingredients derived from Brazilian biodiversity, such as buriti and cupuacu, in cosmetic and personal care products.
indicators.measurement: Verify ingredient lists and supplier declarations to confirm inclusion of Brazilian biodiversity ingredients; conduct traceability audits and check compliance with ANVISA regulations; use certifications like Ecocert and COSMOS that validate natural origin and sourcing.
indicators.target: Product contains at least one ingredient sourced from Brazilian biodiversity (e.g., buriti, cupuacu) with traceability and compliance to Brazilian standards.

indicators.name: Cruelty-Free Testing
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the cosmetic or personal care product has been developed and manufactured without any animal testing at any stage.
indicators.measurement: Verification through certification documents confirming no animal testing, review of manufacturer declarations, and compliance checks against regulatory standards prohibiting animal testing such as EU Cosmetics Regulation and ANVISA guidelines.
indicators.target: Zero animal testing conducted on the product and its ingredients throughout development and production.

indicators.name: Vegan Formulation Compliance
indicators.description: Evaluates whether cosmetic and personal care products are formulated without any animal-derived ingredients, ensuring adherence to vegan standards.
indicators.measurement: Verify product ingredient lists for absence of animal-derived substances; confirm certification by recognized vegan standards; review manufacturer declarations and product labels for vegan claims.
indicators.target: Formulations must be fully vegan, containing no animal-derived ingredients as per recognized vegan certification criteria.

indicators.name: No Animal-Derived Ingredients
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the cosmetic or personal care product contains any ingredients derived from animals, ensuring compliance with vegan and cruelty-free standards.
indicators.measurement: Review of ingredient lists for animal-derived substances, verification of manufacturer declarations, and cross-checking with recognized certifications indicating absence of animal-derived ingredients.
indicators.target: 0% animal-derived ingredients in the product formulation

indicators.name: Certified Animal Welfare
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the cosmetic or personal care product is certified by recognized organizations ensuring no animal testing and adherence to animal welfare standards.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of certifications from recognized organizations on product packaging or official documentation, cross-check with certification databases, and confirm compliance with relevant standards such as EU Cosmetics Regulation and ANVISA requirements.
indicators.target: Product must hold at least one certification from recognized organizations ensuring animal welfare, such as Leaping Bunny or Vegan Society.

indicators.name: Recyclable or Refillable Packaging
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the product packaging is designed to be recyclable or refillable, reducing environmental impact through material recovery or reuse.
indicators.measurement: Verify packaging material composition through manufacturer declarations and product labels; confirm recyclability via compliance with EU Cosmetics Regulation and ISO 16128 standards; assess refillability by checking product design specifications and availability of refill options; cross-reference with certifications such as COSMOS and Ecocert.
indicators.target: Packaging must be either fully recyclable or designed for refill to minimize waste and support circular economy principles.

indicators.name: Minimal Packaging
indicators.description: Evaluation of the packaging design to ensure it uses the least amount of material necessary to protect the product, reducing waste and environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Assess packaging weight relative to product volume, verify use of recyclable or biodegradable materials, and review manufacturer declarations on packaging reduction strategies. Conduct visual inspections and compare against industry benchmarks for minimal packaging.
indicators.target: Packaging weight should be minimized without compromising product safety and integrity, aiming for a reduction of at least 20% compared to conventional packaging standards.

indicators.name: Post-Consumer Recycled Content
indicators.description: Evaluation of the percentage of post-consumer recycled (PCR) material used in the packaging of cosmetic and personal care products to reduce environmental impact and promote circularity.
indicators.measurement: Verify the percentage of PCR content through manufacturer declarations, third-party laboratory analysis of packaging materials, and review of product labels indicating recycled content. Cross-check compliance with relevant standards and regulations.
indicators.target: Packaging contains at least 30% post-consumer recycled content by weight.

indicators.name: Biodegradable Packaging
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the product packaging is made from materials that biodegrade under natural conditions, reducing environmental impact and waste accumulation.
indicators.measurement: Verify packaging material composition through supplier documentation and third-party laboratory biodegradability tests; confirm compliance with recognized biodegradability standards and regulations such as EU Cosmetics Regulation and ANVISA guidelines.
indicators.target: Packaging must be certified biodegradable or compostable according to recognized standards, ensuring complete degradation within a defined timeframe under natural conditions.

indicators.name: Zero-Waste Packaging
indicators.description: Evaluation of packaging systems designed to eliminate waste by enabling reuse, refill, or complete recyclability, minimizing environmental impact throughout the product lifecycle.
indicators.measurement: Verify packaging materials and design through product labels and manufacturer declarations; assess compliance with zero-waste principles by checking for refillability, recyclability, or compostability; cross-reference with certifications and regulatory compliance documents.
indicators.target: Packaging must be designed to achieve zero waste by being fully reusable, refillable, recyclable, or compostable, with no residual waste generated after use.

indicators.name: Energy-efficient manufacturing
indicators.description: Evaluation of manufacturing processes to ensure they minimize energy consumption through optimized equipment, process design, and energy management systems.
indicators.measurement: Verification through energy consumption records, energy audits, implementation of ISO 50001 energy management standards, and assessment of manufacturing equipment efficiency ratings.
indicators.target: Manufacturing facilities should demonstrate a reduction in energy consumption per unit of product by at least 15% compared to industry benchmarks or previous year data.

indicators.name: Water Conservation
indicators.description: Evaluation of the product's manufacturing process to minimize water usage and implement water-saving practices throughout production.
indicators.measurement: Assess water consumption records during production, verify implementation of water recycling systems, and review water efficiency audits or certifications.
indicators.target: Reduce water consumption per unit of product by at least 20% compared to industry average or baseline measurements.

indicators.name: Fair Trade Ingredients
indicators.description: Evaluation of the use of ingredients sourced under fair trade conditions to ensure ethical procurement and support for producers. This includes verifying compliance with recognized fair trade standards in the supply chain.
indicators.measurement: Verify ingredient sourcing documentation and certifications indicating fair trade compliance, review supplier declarations, and cross-check with recognized fair trade certification bodies. Conduct audits or request certificates for key raw materials.
indicators.target: 100% of key raw ingredients sourced from certified fair trade suppliers or equivalent verified fair trade practices.

indicators.name: Local Sourcing
indicators.description: Evaluation of the extent to which raw materials and ingredients used in cosmetic and personal care products are sourced locally to reduce environmental impact and support regional economies.
indicators.measurement: Verification through supplier declarations, purchase records indicating geographic origin of raw materials, and assessment of supply chain documentation to confirm local sourcing within the country or region.
indicators.target: Maximize the percentage of raw materials sourced locally where possible, aiming for at least 70% local sourcing to align with sustainability goals.

indicators.name: Support for Brazilian Communities
indicators.description: Evaluation of the extent to which the cosmetic product's production process actively supports Brazilian local communities through sourcing, fair trade, or community development initiatives.
indicators.measurement: Verify supplier and manufacturer documentation for evidence of partnerships with Brazilian communities, review fair trade certifications, assess supply chain traceability reports, and confirm community development contributions through audits or declarations.
indicators.target: Product sourcing and production should demonstrate verifiable support for Brazilian communities, including fair trade practices or community development programs, with at least 80% of relevant raw materials sourced from such initiatives.

indicators.name: Ingredient Disclosure
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the product provides a full and clear disclosure of all ingredients used, including their concentrations and INCI names, ensuring consumer awareness and regulatory compliance.
indicators.measurement: Verify the ingredient list on product packaging and official product documentation against the full formulation; cross-check compliance with EU Cosmetics Regulation and ANVISA requirements; confirm presence of all ingredients without omissions or vague terms.
indicators.target: 100% of ingredients fully disclosed with accurate INCI names and concentrations as per regulatory standards.

indicators.name: Supply Chain Transparency
indicators.description: Evaluation of the extent to which the cosmetic product's supply chain is openly disclosed, including sourcing, ingredient origins, and manufacturing processes to ensure traceability and compliance with regulations.
indicators.measurement: Verify supply chain disclosure through documentation review, ingredient traceability audits, certification verification, and cross-checking manufacturer declarations against regulatory standards.
indicators.target: Full disclosure of ingredient origins and supply chain steps compliant with EU Cosmetics Regulation and ANVISA requirements.

indicators.name: Third-party Certifications
indicators.description: Evaluation of the presence and validity of recognized third-party certifications on cosmetic and personal care products to ensure transparency about product claims and compliance with sustainability and safety standards.
indicators.measurement: Verify product packaging and official documentation for valid certifications such as COSMOS, Ecocert, Leaping Bunny, Vegan Society, and USDA Organic; cross-check certification status with certifying bodies' databases; confirm compliance with relevant standards including EU Cosmetics Regulation, ISO 16128, and ANVISA requirements.
indicators.target: Product must hold at least one valid third-party certification from the recognized list to demonstrate transparency and compliance.

indicators.name: Sustainability Claims Clarity
indicators.description: Evaluation of the clarity and accuracy of sustainability claims made by the product, ensuring they are transparent, verifiable, and compliant with relevant regulations.
indicators.measurement: Verify product labels and marketing materials for explicit sustainability claims; cross-check claims against certifications such as COSMOS, Ecocert, Leaping Bunny, Vegan Society, and USDA Organic; confirm compliance with EU Cosmetics Regulation, ISO 16128, and ANVISA standards; review manufacturer declarations for detailed sustainability information.
indicators.target: All sustainability claims must be clear, specific, and supported by recognized certifications or regulatory compliance.

indicators.name: Non-toxic Materials
indicators.description: Evaluation of toy materials to ensure they are free from harmful chemicals such as phthalates and BPA, which can pose health risks to children.
indicators.measurement: Verify compliance through chemical analysis reports for phthalate and BPA content, review manufacturer declarations, and confirm adherence to safety standards EN71 and ASTM F963.
indicators.target: Materials must be phthalate-free and BPA-free, meeting or exceeding limits defined by EN71 and ASTM F963 standards.

indicators.name: FSC Certified Wood
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the wood used in the toy is sustainably sourced and certified according to FSC standards, ensuring responsible forest management.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of FSC certification labels on product packaging or documentation; review manufacturer declarations and supply chain certifications confirming FSC compliance.
indicators.target: 100% of wood materials used in the toy must be FSC certified.

indicators.name: Recycled or Bio-based Plastics
indicators.description: Evaluation of the use of recycled plastics or bio-based plastics in the toy's material composition to reduce environmental impact and promote sustainability.
indicators.measurement: Verify material composition through manufacturer declarations, analyze material certificates, and conduct laboratory testing for polymer origin and recycled content percentage.
indicators.target: Use of 100% recycled plastics or bio-based plastics in the toy's plastic components.

indicators.name: Natural Material Use
indicators.description: Evaluates the preference and presence of natural materials in toy products to ensure reduced environmental impact and enhanced safety.
indicators.measurement: Verify material composition through product labels, manufacturer declarations, and certification documentation confirming the use of natural fibers or wood. Conduct laboratory analysis if necessary to identify synthetic content.
indicators.target: Majority (>75%) of materials used in the toy are natural (e.g., wood, cotton, natural rubber).

indicators.name: Chemical Safety
indicators.description: Evaluation of the absence of harmful chemicals in toy materials to ensure safety for children and compliance with health regulations.
indicators.measurement: Conduct chemical analysis and testing according to EN71, ASTM F963, and ISO 8124 standards; verify compliance through certification labels and manufacturer safety data sheets.
indicators.target: Materials must contain no harmful chemicals as defined by EN71 and ASTM F963 limits.

indicators.name: Compliance with Safety Standards
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the toy meets recognized safety standards to ensure it is safe for use by children, focusing on mechanical, chemical, and physical safety requirements.
indicators.measurement: Verify product certification and test reports confirming compliance with EN71, ASTM F963, and INMETRO safety standards through laboratory testing and review of manufacturer declarations.
indicators.target: Full compliance with EN71, ASTM F963, and INMETRO safety standards.
data_sources: EN71 and ASTM F963 standard documentation

indicators.name: No Small Parts
indicators.description: Evaluates whether toys intended for young children contain small parts that could pose choking hazards. The assessment focuses on ensuring all components are large enough to prevent ingestion or airway obstruction.
indicators.measurement: Verify toy components against the small parts cylinder test as specified in EN71 and ASTM F963 standards; physically inspect toys for detachable parts smaller than 31.7 mm in diameter; review manufacturer declarations and product labels for age recommendations and safety warnings.
indicators.target: Toys for children under 3 years must contain no parts smaller than 31.7 mm in diameter to eliminate choking hazards.

indicators.name: Durable Construction
indicators.description: Evaluation of the toy's structural integrity to ensure it withstands typical use without breaking or posing safety hazards. This includes resistance to impact, stress, and wear over time.
indicators.measurement: Perform mechanical stress tests such as drop tests, tension, and compression assessments according to EN71 and ASTM F963 standards; inspect for loose parts or sharp edges post-testing.
indicators.target: Toy must pass all mechanical durability tests without breakage or hazardous deformation, complying fully with EN71 and ASTM F963 durability requirements.

indicators.name: Non-Toxic Finishes
indicators.description: Evaluation of the use of paints and finishes on toys to ensure they do not contain toxic substances harmful to children. This includes verifying the absence of heavy metals, harmful solvents, and other hazardous chemicals in surface coatings.
indicators.measurement: Conduct chemical analysis of paint and finish samples using spectroscopy or chromatography methods to detect toxic substances; review manufacturer safety data sheets and compliance test reports; verify conformity with relevant toy safety standards.
indicators.target: Paints and finishes must be free from toxic substances and comply with limits established by EN71, ASTM F963, and ISO 8124 standards.

indicators.name: Age-Appropriate Design
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the toy's design, materials, and features are suitable and safe for the intended age group, minimizing risks such as choking, toxicity, or injury.
indicators.measurement: Verify compliance with age recommendations on product labels, conduct physical and chemical safety tests according to EN71, ASTM F963, and ISO 8124 standards, and review manufacturer age classification and warnings.
indicators.target: Toys must be clearly labeled with appropriate age ranges and fully comply with EN71, ASTM F963, and ISO 8124 safety requirements for those age groups.

indicators.name: Long-lasting Quality
indicators.description: Evaluates the toy's ability to maintain structural integrity and functionality over extended use without significant wear or damage.
indicators.measurement: Conduct mechanical stress tests and wear simulations according to EN71 and ASTM F963 standards; inspect materials for resistance to degradation; verify manufacturer durability claims through product testing reports.
indicators.target: The toy should pass all durability tests defined in EN71 and ASTM F963 without failure or significant wear after simulated extended use.

indicators.name: Timeless Design
indicators.description: Evaluation of the toy's design to ensure it remains appealing and functional over extended periods, reducing the need for replacement and minimizing waste.
indicators.measurement: Assess design features for classic aesthetics and multifunctionality through expert review and consumer feedback surveys; verify product lifespan claims via manufacturer documentation and durability testing according to EN71 and ASTM F963 standards.
indicators.target: Design should maintain consumer appeal and functionality for at least 5 years under normal use conditions.

indicators.name: Repairable Components
indicators.description: Evaluation of the toy's design and construction to ensure that individual components can be repaired or replaced, extending the product's usable life and reducing waste.
indicators.measurement: Inspect the toy for modular parts that can be disassembled and reassembled using standard tools; verify availability of spare parts from the manufacturer; review repair instructions or manuals provided with the product.
indicators.target: At least 80% of the toy's components should be repairable or replaceable without specialized equipment.

indicators.name: Multi-generational Use
indicators.description: Evaluates the toy's potential to remain functional and safe for use across multiple generations, indicating long-term durability and sustained play value.
indicators.measurement: Assess material robustness through mechanical stress tests per EN71 and ASTM F963 standards; verify design for repairability and modularity via manufacturer documentation; review product lifespan claims and user feedback on durability.
indicators.target: Toy maintains structural integrity and safety compliance after repeated use cycles simulating at least 10 years of typical play, supporting multi-generational use.

indicators.name: Learning Promotion
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the toy effectively supports cognitive, motor, and social development by promoting learning and skill acquisition in children.
indicators.measurement: Assess product features against developmental milestones; review manufacturer educational claims and instructions; verify compliance with EN71 and ASTM F963 standards related to educational content and safety; conduct user testing or expert evaluation on learning outcomes.
indicators.target: Toy must demonstrably support at least one key area of child development (cognitive, motor, or social) and include clear educational objectives or instructions.

indicators.name: Creativity Encouragement
indicators.description: Evaluates the extent to which the toy promotes creative thinking and imaginative play in children, fostering skills such as problem-solving and innovation.
indicators.measurement: Assess product design features that enable open-ended play and creativity through expert review and user testing; verify manufacturer claims via product manuals and marketing materials; conduct surveys with educators or parents on observed creativity stimulation.
indicators.target: Toy must provide multiple open-ended play options that encourage creativity and imaginative use without strict rules limiting expression.

indicators.name: Open-ended Play
indicators.description: Evaluates the toy's ability to support open-ended play that encourages creativity, imagination, and problem-solving without predefined outcomes or limitations.
indicators.measurement: Assess product design and instructions to verify absence of fixed play patterns; review manufacturer documentation for claims on open-ended play; conduct user testing to observe play variability and creativity; check compliance with EN71 and ASTM F963 for safety during diverse play scenarios.
indicators.target: Toy must facilitate multiple play scenarios without fixed outcomes, promoting creativity and imagination in children.

indicators.name: STEM/STEAM Focus
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the toy promotes learning and skills development in Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, and Mathematics (STEM/STEAM) through its design and content.
indicators.measurement: Verify product descriptions and instructional materials for explicit STEM/STEAM learning objectives; assess alignment with recognized educational frameworks; review manufacturer declarations and third-party educational endorsements.
indicators.target: Toy must explicitly support at least one STEM/STEAM discipline with clear learning outcomes.

indicators.name: Minimal Packaging
indicators.description: Evaluation of the packaging used for toys and games to ensure it is minimized in volume and materials, reducing waste and environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Measure the packaging volume relative to product size and weight; verify packaging materials for recyclability and absence of excess layers; review manufacturer declarations and packaging design specifications.
indicators.target: Packaging volume should be minimized to the least amount necessary to protect the product during transport and sale, avoiding any unnecessary layers or materials.
data_sources: FSC certification for sustainable packaging materials
EN71 standard for toy safety packaging requirements

indicators.name: Recyclable Packaging
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the toy packaging materials are recyclable, ensuring they can be processed through standard recycling streams to minimize environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Verify packaging material composition through manufacturer declarations and recycling codes; conduct material analysis if necessary; confirm recyclability according to local Brazilian recycling standards and compliance with EN71 and ISO 8124 packaging requirements.
indicators.target: 100% of packaging materials used must be recyclable according to recognized recycling standards.

indicators.name: No Plastic Windows
indicators.description: This indicator evaluates whether the toy packaging contains any plastic windows, which are discouraged due to environmental concerns. The assessment focuses on the absence of plastic film inserts in the packaging design.
indicators.measurement: Inspect packaging visually and physically to confirm the absence of transparent plastic film windows. Verify manufacturer declarations and product labels for packaging material composition. Conduct material analysis if necessary.
indicators.target: Packaging must contain zero plastic windows; no plastic film inserts allowed.

indicators.name: Reusable Packaging
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the toy or game packaging is designed for multiple uses to reduce waste and environmental impact. This includes packaging that can be repurposed or refilled rather than disposed of after a single use.
indicators.measurement: Verify packaging design through product documentation and physical inspection to confirm reusability features such as durability, resealability, or intended secondary use. Check manufacturer declarations and packaging labels for reuse instructions or symbols.
indicators.target: Packaging must be designed to allow at least 3 reuse cycles without significant degradation in function or appearance.

indicators.name: Regulatory Compliance
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the medical device meets applicable regulatory requirements to ensure safety and efficacy in the Brazilian and international markets.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of valid certifications such as ANVISA registration for Brazil, FDA approval for the US market, and CE marking for the European market. Cross-check product documentation against MDR, IVDR, and ISO 13485 standards compliance.
indicators.target: Device must hold valid ANVISA registration and at least one internationally recognized certification (FDA approval or CE mark) demonstrating compliance with relevant medical device regulations.

indicators.name: Clinical Efficacy
indicators.description: Evaluation of the medical equipment's proven clinical efficacy based on validated clinical data demonstrating safety and effectiveness for intended use.
indicators.measurement: Verify presence of clinical trial reports or peer-reviewed studies confirming efficacy; check regulatory approvals indicating clinical evaluation such as FDA Approval, CE Mark, and ANVISA certification; review manufacturer declarations and clinical evaluation reports compliant with MDR and IVDR requirements.
indicators.target: Clinical efficacy must be demonstrated through validated clinical data and regulatory approval confirming safety and effectiveness for the intended medical purpose.

indicators.name: Patient Safety Priority
indicators.description: Evaluation of the extent to which the medical equipment prioritizes patient safety by complying with relevant safety and efficacy standards and regulations.
indicators.measurement: Verification through review of certification documents (CE Mark, FDA Approval, ANVISA), compliance with ISO 13485 quality management system, and conformity with MDR and IVDR regulatory requirements. Additionally, assessment of manufacturer declarations and product labeling for safety features.
indicators.target: Medical equipment must fully comply with applicable safety standards and hold at least one recognized certification (CE Mark, FDA Approval, or ANVISA) ensuring patient safety is prioritized.
data_sources: MDR and IVDR regulatory compliance reports

indicators.name: Biocompatibility Testing
indicators.description: Evaluation of the medical equipment to ensure it does not produce adverse biological reactions when in contact with the human body. This includes cytotoxicity, sensitization, and irritation tests to confirm safety for patient use.
indicators.measurement: Verification through documented biocompatibility test reports compliant with ISO 10993 standards, review of manufacturer declarations, and assessment of clinical evaluation reports confirming absence of harmful biological responses.
indicators.target: Medical equipment must have passed all required biocompatibility tests demonstrating no cytotoxicity, sensitization, or irritation effects.

indicators.name: Sterilization Compatibility
indicators.description: Evaluates the product's ability to maintain integrity and functionality after undergoing standard sterilization processes used in medical settings.
indicators.measurement: Verify compatibility through manufacturer validation reports, sterilization cycle testing results, and post-sterilization performance assessments according to MDR and ISO 13485 protocols.
indicators.target: Product must demonstrate no degradation in performance or safety after exposure to recommended sterilization methods as validated by standardized testing.
data_sources: Product labeling and instructions for use

indicators.name: Operational Lifespan
indicators.description: Evaluation of the medical equipment's ability to maintain functionality and performance over an extended period under normal usage conditions.
indicators.measurement: Review of manufacturer-provided lifespan data, accelerated aging tests, maintenance records, and failure rate analysis to verify long-term operational stability.
indicators.target: Equipment should demonstrate an operational lifespan consistent with manufacturer claims and industry standards, typically exceeding 5 years of reliable use.

indicators.name: Reusable Design
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the medical equipment is designed for reuse where appropriate, ensuring durability and safety over multiple uses.
indicators.measurement: Verify product specifications and manufacturer declarations for reusability; inspect labeling for reuse instructions; confirm compliance with MDR and IVDR requirements for reusable devices; assess presence of durability testing data.
indicators.target: Medical equipment should be reusable where appropriate, with clear instructions and safety measures for multiple uses.

indicators.name: Robust Construction
indicators.description: Evaluation of the medical equipment's structural integrity and resistance to wear under normal usage conditions to ensure long-term durability and patient safety.
indicators.measurement: Conduct mechanical stress tests, impact resistance assessments, and material fatigue analysis according to ISO 13485 protocols; review manufacturer durability data and perform on-site inspections.
indicators.target: Equipment must demonstrate resistance to mechanical stress without failure for a minimum of 5 years of typical clinical use.

indicators.name: Maintenance and Calibration Support
indicators.description: Evaluation of the availability and quality of maintenance and calibration services provided for the medical equipment to ensure sustained performance and compliance over its lifecycle.
indicators.measurement: Verify existence of documented maintenance schedules, calibration procedures, and service support agreements; check calibration certificates and maintenance logs; confirm availability of authorized service providers in Brazil.
indicators.target: Equipment must have documented maintenance and calibration support with valid calibration certificates and service availability throughout the product lifecycle.

indicators.name: Spare Parts Availability
indicators.description: Evaluation of the availability and accessibility of spare parts necessary for maintenance and repair of the medical equipment to ensure prolonged operational durability.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of documented spare parts lists, supplier availability within Brazil, average delivery times, and manufacturer commitments to spare parts supply for a minimum of 5 years post-sale.
indicators.target: Spare parts must be available for at least 5 years after product sale with delivery times under 30 days within Brazil.

indicators.name: Biocompatible Materials
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the medical equipment materials are biocompatible, ensuring they do not cause adverse biological reactions when in contact with the human body.
indicators.measurement: Verify material biocompatibility through documented compliance with recognized standards such as ISO 10993 series, review of manufacturer biocompatibility test reports, and confirmation of certifications indicating safe use in medical devices.
indicators.target: Materials must meet biocompatibility requirements as defined by ISO 10993 standards and be approved for medical use without causing cytotoxicity, sensitization, or irritation.

indicators.name: Single-Use Plastic Reduction
indicators.description: Evaluation of the extent to which single-use plastics are minimized in the medical equipment materials, focusing on reducing environmental impact and waste generation.
indicators.measurement: Quantify the percentage of single-use plastic components in the product through material composition analysis and review of manufacturer declarations; verify reduction efforts via product labels and sustainability reports.
indicators.target: Minimize single-use plastic content to less than 10% of total material weight or volume in the product packaging and components.

indicators.name: Recyclable Components
indicators.description: Evaluation of the proportion and safety of recyclable components used in medical equipment materials to ensure environmental sustainability without compromising patient safety.
indicators.measurement: Verify material composition through manufacturer declarations and product labels; assess recyclability using standardized recycling codes; confirm safety compliance via certification audits and risk assessments.
indicators.target: Use recyclable components wherever safe and feasible, ensuring no compromise to medical safety standards.

indicators.name: Non-toxic Materials
indicators.description: Evaluation of the medical equipment materials to ensure they are free from toxic substances that could harm patients or users during normal use.
indicators.measurement: Verify material composition through manufacturer declarations and chemical analysis reports; confirm compliance with relevant toxicological standards; review certification documentation confirming non-toxicity.
indicators.target: Materials must be certified as non-toxic and comply with MDR and IVDR requirements for biocompatibility and safety.

indicators.name: Sustainable Sourcing
indicators.description: Evaluation of the sourcing practices for materials used in medical equipment to ensure they are obtained sustainably, minimizing environmental impact and promoting responsible supply chains.
indicators.measurement: Verify supplier certifications and declarations confirming sustainable sourcing; review documentation for compliance with environmental management standards; audit supply chain for traceability and responsible material procurement.
indicators.target: All materials used in the product are sourced from suppliers with verified sustainable practices, demonstrated by compliance with relevant certifications and standards.

indicators.name: Energy-efficient operation
indicators.description: Evaluation of the medical equipment's ability to operate using minimal energy consumption without compromising performance, ensuring reduced environmental impact and operational costs.
indicators.measurement: Measure the device's power consumption during typical operation using calibrated energy meters; verify manufacturer energy efficiency claims and compare against industry benchmarks; review energy-saving modes and automatic shutoff features.
indicators.target: Equipment should demonstrate energy consumption at or below industry best practices for its category, with active energy-saving features enabled during operation.

indicators.name: Low Standby Power
indicators.description: Evaluates the electrical power consumption of medical equipment when in standby mode to ensure minimal energy use during non-operational periods.
indicators.measurement: Measure the power draw using a calibrated power meter while the device is in standby mode; verify that standby power consumption is below defined thresholds according to manufacturer specifications or regulatory limits.
indicators.target: Standby power consumption should be less than or equal to 1 watt to minimize energy waste.

indicators.name: Renewable Energy Compatibility
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the medical equipment is designed to operate efficiently when powered by renewable energy sources, ensuring compatibility with variable power inputs and sustainable energy systems.
indicators.measurement: Verify manufacturer documentation and technical specifications for compatibility with renewable energy sources; conduct operational tests using renewable power inputs; review product labels and manufacturer declarations confirming renewable energy compatibility.
indicators.target: Equipment must demonstrate full operational functionality and efficiency when powered by renewable energy sources without performance degradation.

indicators.name: Power Management Features
indicators.description: Evaluation of the presence and effectiveness of power management features in medical equipment that reduce energy consumption during idle or standby modes.
indicators.measurement: Verify device specifications and test equipment to confirm automatic power-down or low-power standby modes; review manufacturer documentation and conduct energy consumption tests during different operational states.
indicators.target: Medical equipment should include automatic power management features that reduce energy use by at least 30% during idle periods compared to full operational mode.

indicators.name: Safe Disposal Protocols
indicators.description: Evaluation of the presence and implementation of protocols ensuring the safe disposal of medical equipment at end-of-life to minimize environmental and health risks.
indicators.measurement: Review of documented disposal procedures, verification of compliance with MDR and IVDR regulations, audit of disposal records, and confirmation of adherence to ISO 13485 quality management requirements.
indicators.target: 100% of medical equipment must have documented safe disposal protocols compliant with MDR, IVDR, and ISO 13485 standards.

indicators.name: Recycling Programs
indicators.description: Evaluation of the presence and effectiveness of recycling programs for medical equipment at the end of their lifecycle, ensuring proper material recovery and waste reduction.
indicators.measurement: Verify documentation of recycling programs, review manufacturer declarations on end-of-life management, and confirm compliance through audits or certifications related to environmental management and product lifecycle.
indicators.target: Implementation of a documented recycling program covering at least 90% of the product components to ensure responsible end-of-life material recovery.

indicators.name: Take-back schemes
indicators.description: Evaluation of the presence and effectiveness of take-back schemes that allow the return and proper disposal or recycling of medical equipment at the end of its life cycle.
indicators.measurement: Verify the existence of documented take-back programs through manufacturer declarations, review of product labeling indicating take-back options, and assessment of compliance with MDR and IVDR requirements related to end-of-life management.
indicators.target: Establishment of a formal take-back scheme covering 100% of the product range, ensuring safe and environmentally compliant disposal or recycling of returned equipment.

indicators.name: Refurbishment Options
indicators.description: Evaluation of the availability and implementation of refurbishment options for medical equipment to extend product lifecycle and reduce waste at end of life.
indicators.measurement: Verify presence of documented refurbishment programs, assess manufacturer refurbishment protocols, and confirm compliance through product labels and refurbishment certificates.
indicators.target: Medical equipment should have defined refurbishment options that comply with MDR and IVDR requirements and maintain ISO 13485 quality standards to ensure safe reuse.

indicators.name: Waste Segregation
indicators.description: Evaluation of the proper segregation of medical equipment waste at end-of-life to ensure compliance with environmental and health safety standards.
indicators.measurement: Verify documented waste segregation procedures, inspect waste handling records, and audit compliance with local disposal regulations through site visits and waste tracking systems.
indicators.target: 100% of medical equipment waste correctly segregated according to regulatory and environmental standards.

indicators.name: Recycled Content Percentage
indicators.description: Evaluates the proportion of recycled materials used in the product's composition to ensure environmental sustainability by reducing virgin material consumption.
indicators.measurement: Verify the percentage of recycled content through manufacturer declarations, product technical datasheets, and third-party certification reports. Cross-check with product labels and certifications indicating recycled material use.
indicators.target: Recycled content greater than 50%

indicators.name: FSC-certified Paper
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether paper products used in office supplies are certified by the Forest Stewardship Council (FSC), ensuring responsible sourcing and sustainable forest management.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of FSC certification labels on product packaging or documentation, cross-check manufacturer declarations, and confirm certification validity through the FSC database.
indicators.target: 100% of paper products used must be FSC-certified.

indicators.name: Non-toxic inks and adhesives
indicators.description: Evaluation of the chemical safety of inks and adhesives used in office supplies, ensuring they do not contain harmful toxic substances that can impact human health or the environment.
indicators.measurement: Verify product technical datasheets and safety data sheets (SDS) for chemical composition; conduct laboratory testing for toxic substances; check compliance with recognized eco-labels and certifications indicating non-toxicity.
indicators.target: All inks and adhesives used in the product must be free from toxic substances as defined by EPA Guidelines and meet or exceed the chemical safety requirements of ISO 14001 standards.
data_sources: Manufacturer declarations and Safety Data Sheets (SDS)

indicators.name: Biodegradable Materials
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the office supplies are made from materials that can decompose naturally by biological processes, reducing environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Verify product composition through manufacturer declarations and material safety data sheets; confirm biodegradability via third-party certifications and compliance with recognized standards.
indicators.target: 100% of materials used in the product should be biodegradable under standard composting conditions.

indicators.name: Renewable Material Use
indicators.description: Evaluation of the proportion and sourcing of renewable materials used in office supplies to ensure environmental sustainability and resource renewability.
indicators.measurement: Verify product composition through manufacturer declarations and material safety data sheets; confirm certification compliance via FSC, Blue Angel, EU Ecolabel, Nordic Swan, or ABNT labels; conduct audits aligned with ISO 14001 and EPA Guidelines to assess renewable resource sourcing.
indicators.target: At least 70% of materials by weight in the product should be sourced from renewable resources certified by recognized ecolabels or standards.

indicators.name: Reusable Products
indicators.description: Evaluates whether office supplies are designed for multiple uses to reduce waste and extend product life.
indicators.measurement: Verify product specifications and manufacturer declarations for reusability features; check for product labels indicating reusable design; assess compliance with relevant certifications.
indicators.target: Products must be reusable, designed for multiple use cycles rather than single-use disposables.

indicators.name: Refillable Options
indicators.description: Evaluates whether office supplies are designed to be refillable, reducing waste and extending product lifespan. This indicator assesses the availability and compatibility of refill components for the product.
indicators.measurement: Verify product specifications and manufacturer documentation to confirm the presence of refillable features; inspect physical product design for refill ports or replaceable parts; review product labels and declarations for refill compatibility.
indicators.target: Products must offer refillable options that allow reuse of the main product body without compromising functionality or durability.

indicators.name: Long-lasting Quality
indicators.description: Evaluation of the product's ability to maintain functionality and structural integrity over extended use periods under typical office conditions.
indicators.measurement: Conduct accelerated aging tests and usage simulations to assess wear resistance; verify manufacturer durability claims through lab reports; inspect product for material robustness and resistance to common office wear and tear.
indicators.target: Product should demonstrate a minimum lifespan of 3 years under normal office use without significant degradation in performance or appearance.

indicators.name: Multi-use Design
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the office supply product is designed for multiple uses to extend its functional lifespan and reduce waste.
indicators.measurement: Verify product specifications and design features through manufacturer documentation and product testing to confirm capability for repeated use without significant degradation. Conduct user trials or review durability test reports.
indicators.target: Product must support at least 3 distinct uses or cycles without loss of functionality or structural integrity.

indicators.name: Minimal Packaging
indicators.description: Evaluates the extent to which the product's packaging is reduced to the minimum necessary to protect and contain the product, minimizing waste and environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Assess packaging weight relative to product weight, verify use of recyclable or biodegradable materials, and check for absence of unnecessary layers or components through physical inspection and manufacturer documentation.
indicators.target: Packaging weight should not exceed 10% of the product weight and use only essential materials to ensure product protection.

indicators.name: Recyclable Packaging
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the product packaging is made from materials that can be recycled through common municipal or industrial recycling systems, reducing environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Verify packaging materials through manufacturer declarations and material safety data sheets; conduct material composition analysis if needed; confirm recyclability via local recycling guidelines and certification labels on packaging.
indicators.target: 100% of packaging materials must be recyclable according to local Brazilian recycling standards.

indicators.name: Bulk Purchasing Options
indicators.description: Evaluates the availability and use of bulk packaging options to reduce packaging waste and environmental impact in office supplies.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of bulk purchase options through product catalogs, supplier declarations, and packaging specifications; assess the reduction in packaging material per unit compared to standard packaging.
indicators.target: Products should offer bulk packaging options that reduce packaging material per unit by at least 30% compared to individual packaging.

indicators.name: Plastic-Free Packaging
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the product packaging is completely free from plastic materials to minimize environmental impact and improve recyclability.
indicators.measurement: Verify packaging materials through supplier documentation and physical inspection to confirm absence of any plastic components; cross-check with manufacturer declarations and third-party certifications.
indicators.target: Packaging contains 0% plastic materials.

indicators.name: Energy-efficient Manufacturing
indicators.description: Evaluation of the manufacturing processes to ensure they minimize energy consumption and optimize energy use efficiency during production of office supplies.
indicators.measurement: Review of energy consumption records during manufacturing, verification of energy management systems implementation, and assessment of compliance with ISO 14001 and EPA energy guidelines through audits and manufacturer declarations.
indicators.target: Manufacturing processes must demonstrate measurable reductions in energy use compared to industry benchmarks, ideally achieving certification under recognized energy efficiency standards.

indicators.name: Low Water Consumption
indicators.description: Evaluates the water usage during the production process of office supplies, focusing on minimizing water consumption to reduce environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Verify water consumption records from manufacturers, assess compliance with water efficiency standards, and review third-party audit reports or certifications indicating reduced water use.
indicators.target: Production water consumption should be minimized according to best industry practices, ideally achieving at least a 20% reduction compared to conventional processes or meeting thresholds defined by relevant certifications.

indicators.name: chemical use reduction
indicators.description: Evaluation of the extent to which chemical substances are minimized during the production of office supplies to reduce environmental and health impacts.
indicators.measurement: Verify compliance through documented chemical inventories, reduction plans, and third-party audit reports; assess certifications indicating restricted or reduced chemical use; review manufacturer declarations on chemical management practices.
indicators.target: Chemical use in production processes is minimized or eliminated in accordance with recognized environmental standards and certifications.

indicators.name: Local Production
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether office supplies are produced locally to reduce transportation emissions and support regional economies.
indicators.measurement: Verify the manufacturing location through supplier declarations, product labels indicating origin, and audit reports confirming production within the local or regional area.
indicators.target: Products should be manufactured within the same country or a maximum radius of 500 km from the point of sale to ensure local production.

indicators.name: Biodegradable Ingredients
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the cleaning product's ingredients are biodegradable according to recognized environmental standards, ensuring reduced environmental impact after use.
indicators.measurement: Verify ingredient biodegradability through certification compliance (e.g., EU Ecolabel, Nordic Swan) and review of product formulation against EU Detergents Regulation biodegradability criteria; confirm via manufacturer declarations and laboratory biodegradability tests.
indicators.target: All ingredients should meet recognized biodegradability standards as defined by the EU Detergents Regulation and relevant certifications.

indicators.name: Plant-Based Formulations
indicators.description: Evaluation of cleaning products based on the proportion and use of plant-derived ingredients in their formulations to ensure reduced environmental impact and enhanced biodegradability.
indicators.measurement: Verify ingredient lists and formulation data to confirm the presence and percentage of plant-based components; cross-check with certification compliance reports and product technical datasheets.
indicators.target: Formulations must contain a majority (>50%) of plant-based ingredients by weight or volume.

indicators.name: Harmful Chemicals Exclusion
indicators.description: Evaluation of cleaning product formulations to ensure absence of harmful chemicals that pose risks to human health and the environment, in compliance with regulatory and sustainability standards.
indicators.measurement: Verify ingredient lists against restricted substances lists defined by EU Detergents Regulation; conduct laboratory chemical analysis for presence of banned or hazardous substances; review product certifications confirming compliance with eco-label criteria.
indicators.target: No presence of chemicals classified as harmful under EU Detergents Regulation and recognized hazardous substance lists; full compliance with eco-label ingredient restrictions.

indicators.name: Aquatic Toxicity
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the product ingredients are non-toxic to aquatic life, ensuring they do not cause harm to freshwater and marine ecosystems upon release.
indicators.measurement: Assess ingredient toxicity using standardized ecotoxicological tests such as OECD 201, 202, and 203 for aquatic organisms; review compliance with EU Detergents Regulation limits on hazardous substances; verify absence of bioaccumulative and persistent toxicants through chemical analysis and safety data sheets.
indicators.target: Ingredients must demonstrate no acute or chronic toxicity to aquatic organisms at concentrations expected in the environment, complying with EU Detergents Regulation thresholds for biodegradability and toxicity.

indicators.name: Phosphate-Free
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the cleaning product formulation excludes phosphates to minimize environmental eutrophication risks.
indicators.measurement: Verify ingredient lists and product formulations for absence of phosphates through laboratory chemical analysis or review of manufacturer declarations and safety data sheets.
indicators.target: Product contains 0% phosphates (phosphate-free).

indicators.name: Brazilian Biodegradable Surfactants
indicators.description: Evaluation of the presence and biodegradability of surfactants sourced from Brazil in cleaning products, ensuring they meet environmental safety standards.
indicators.measurement: Verify surfactant origin through supplier documentation and chemical analysis; assess biodegradability via standardized tests compliant with EU Detergents Regulation; confirm compliance with ISO 14001 environmental management practices.
indicators.target: All surfactants used in the product must be biodegradable and sourced from Brazilian suppliers.

indicators.name: Recyclable Packaging
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the packaging materials used for cleaning products are recyclable according to recognized standards and local recycling capabilities.
indicators.measurement: Verify packaging material composition through manufacturer declarations and product labels; confirm recyclability via compliance with EU Detergents Regulation and ISO 14001 guidelines; cross-check with certifications such as EU Ecolabel and Nordic Swan that require recyclable packaging.
indicators.target: 100% of packaging materials must be recyclable under local Brazilian recycling systems and comply with relevant standards.

indicators.name: Concentrated Formulas
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether cleaning product packaging contains concentrated formulas that reduce volume and packaging material use, thereby minimizing environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Verify product formulation concentration through manufacturer declarations and product labels; assess packaging volume relative to product volume; confirm compliance with EU Detergents Regulation concentration requirements.
indicators.target: Product formulations must be concentrated to reduce packaging volume by at least 30% compared to standard dilution products.

indicators.name: Refill Options Availability
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the cleaning product offers refill options to reduce packaging waste and promote reuse. This indicator assesses the presence and accessibility of refill formats for the product.
indicators.measurement: Verify product packaging and labeling for refill availability; review manufacturer documentation and product catalogs; conduct market surveys to confirm refill options offered to consumers.
indicators.target: Product must provide at least one refill option accessible to consumers to minimize single-use packaging.

indicators.name: Reduced Plastic Use
indicators.description: Evaluation of the extent to which plastic materials are minimized in the packaging of cleaning products, focusing on reducing environmental impact through material selection and design.
indicators.measurement: Quantify the percentage of plastic content in packaging by weight; verify use of alternative materials such as recycled paper or biodegradable plastics through material analysis and supplier documentation; assess compliance with packaging reduction targets via product labels and manufacturer declarations.
indicators.target: Achieve at least a 30% reduction in plastic use in packaging compared to conventional products or use of recycled/biodegradable plastic materials where plastic is necessary.

indicators.name: Post-consumer recycled content
indicators.description: Evaluation of the percentage of post-consumer recycled (PCR) material used in the packaging of cleaning products to reduce environmental impact and promote circular economy.
indicators.measurement: Verify the percentage of PCR content through manufacturer declarations, third-party certification reports, and physical analysis of packaging materials; cross-check with product labels and compliance documentation.
indicators.target: Packaging contains at least 30% post-consumer recycled content.

indicators.name: Low Temperature Efficiency
indicators.description: Evaluates the cleaning product's ability to effectively clean at lower washing temperatures, reducing energy consumption and environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Test cleaning performance at temperatures below 30°C using standardized soil removal tests according to EU Detergents Regulation protocols and compare results to performance at standard temperatures.
indicators.target: Achieves equal or superior cleaning effectiveness at temperatures below 30°C compared to standard washing temperatures (40-60°C).

indicators.name: Efficient Use
indicators.description: Evaluates the product's ability to achieve desired cleaning results using minimal quantity, reducing waste and environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Assess cleaning performance through standardized tests measuring cleaning efficacy per unit dose; verify recommended dosage instructions and user compliance; analyze concentration and biodegradability of active ingredients.
indicators.target: Product achieves effective cleaning at or below recommended dosage with no compromise in performance.

indicators.name: Multi-purpose Use
indicators.description: Evaluates the product's capability to perform effectively across multiple cleaning applications, reducing the need for multiple specialized products.
indicators.measurement: Verify product labeling and technical datasheets for claims of multi-surface or multi-application effectiveness; conduct standardized cleaning performance tests on various surfaces according to ISO 14001 guidelines; review compliance with EU Detergents Regulation for product composition and efficacy.
indicators.target: Product demonstrates effective cleaning performance on at least three different surface types or applications as certified or declared by the manufacturer.

indicators.name: Low Water Consumption
indicators.description: Evaluation of the product's efficiency in minimizing water usage during cleaning processes, ensuring effective cleaning with reduced water consumption.
indicators.measurement: Quantify the volume of water required per cleaning cycle using standardized testing methods aligned with ISO 14001 and EU Detergents Regulation; verify manufacturer declarations and product labels for water consumption data.
indicators.target: Product should demonstrate a reduction in water usage compared to conventional products, ideally consuming less than 5 liters of water per standard cleaning operation.

indicators.name: Eco-label Certification
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the cleaning product holds recognized eco-label certifications that demonstrate compliance with environmental and sustainability criteria.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of valid eco-label certifications on product packaging or official documentation, cross-checking certification databases and manufacturer declarations to confirm authenticity.
indicators.target: Product must have at least one valid eco-label certification from recognized schemes.

indicators.name: Cruelty-Free Certification
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the cleaning product has been certified as cruelty-free, ensuring no animal testing was conducted during its development or production.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of recognized cruelty-free certifications on product packaging or official documentation, cross-check with certification bodies' databases such as Leaping Bunny, and review manufacturer declarations regarding animal testing policies.
indicators.target: Product must hold at least one recognized cruelty-free certification, such as Leaping Bunny, confirming no animal testing was performed.

indicators.name: Vegan Formulations
indicators.description: Evaluation of cleaning products to ensure formulations contain no animal-derived ingredients and are not tested on animals, aligning with vegan standards.
indicators.measurement: Verify product certifications and labels confirming vegan status, review ingredient lists for animal-derived components, and check for cruelty-free certifications indicating no animal testing.
indicators.target: Product formulations must be free of animal-derived ingredients and certified vegan or cruelty-free.

indicators.name: Hypoallergenic Certification
indicators.description: Evaluation of cleaning products for hypoallergenic properties to ensure they minimize allergic reactions and skin sensitivities in users.
indicators.measurement: Verify product compliance through certification labels indicating hypoallergenic status, review ingredient lists for known allergens, and assess manufacturer declarations or dermatological testing reports.
indicators.target: Product must be certified or labeled as hypoallergenic by recognized authorities or demonstrate absence of common allergens in formulation.

indicators.name: Electric or Hybrid Preference
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the vehicle is electric or hybrid, prioritizing lower emissions technologies to reduce environmental impact in automotive products.
indicators.measurement: Verify vehicle powertrain type through manufacturer specifications, certification labels, and product documentation confirming electric or hybrid status.
indicators.target: Vehicle must be electric or hybrid to meet the preferred emissions criterion.

indicators.name: Low CO2 Emissions
indicators.description: Evaluation of the vehicle's carbon dioxide emissions per kilometer to ensure compliance with stringent environmental standards aimed at reducing greenhouse gas impact.
indicators.measurement: Measure CO2 emissions using standardized laboratory testing procedures compliant with EU CO2 Standards and Proconve protocols, including chassis dynamometer tests and on-road emissions monitoring.
indicators.target: CO2 emissions below 95 grams per kilometer

indicators.name: Emission Standard Compliance
indicators.description: Evaluation of vehicle compliance with emission standards to ensure reduced pollutant output, specifically meeting Euro 6 or Proconve L7 (Brazil) requirements.
indicators.measurement: Verify vehicle certification documents and emissions test reports confirming adherence to Euro 6 or Proconve L7 standards; conduct emissions testing using standardized dynamometer procedures where applicable.
indicators.target: Vehicles must comply with Euro 6 emission limits or Proconve L7 standards applicable in Brazil.

indicators.name: Alternative Fuel Usage
indicators.description: Evaluation of the vehicle's capability to operate using alternative fuels such as ethanol and biodiesel, which contribute to reduced greenhouse gas emissions compared to conventional fossil fuels.
indicators.measurement: Verify fuel compatibility through manufacturer specifications and certification documents; assess emissions performance via compliance with Proconve (Brazil) standards and EU CO2 emission limits; perform fuel type verification through fuel system analysis and onboard diagnostics.
indicators.target: Vehicles must be compatible with ethanol and/or biodiesel fuels and comply with Proconve emission limits relevant to alternative fuel use, achieving at least a 10% reduction in CO2 emissions compared to conventional fuels.

indicators.name: Zero Emission Capability
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the vehicle is capable of operating without emitting any tailpipe pollutants, indicating full zero-emission functionality such as electric or hydrogen fuel cell technology.
indicators.measurement: Verify vehicle specifications and certifications confirming zero tailpipe emissions through manufacturer declarations, emissions testing reports, and compliance with zero-emission vehicle standards.
indicators.target: Vehicle must produce zero tailpipe emissions under all operating conditions.

indicators.name: Flex-Fuel Emissions
indicators.description: Evaluation of vehicle emissions performance when using flex-fuel technology in Brazil, focusing on compliance with local and international emission standards.
indicators.measurement: Verify emissions through standardized testing under Proconve (Brazil) protocols using both ethanol and gasoline fuels; cross-check manufacturer emissions data and certification compliance.
indicators.target: Meet or exceed Proconve emission limits for flex-fuel vehicles, ensuring emissions are within regulated thresholds for both ethanol and gasoline operation modes.

indicators.name: Fuel Efficiency
indicators.description: Evaluation of the vehicle's fuel consumption rate to determine its efficiency in converting fuel into distance traveled, minimizing fuel use and emissions.
indicators.measurement: Measure fuel consumption in liters per 100 kilometers (L/100km) using standardized driving cycles such as WLTP or local Proconve test procedures; verify manufacturer fuel economy data and emissions test reports.
indicators.target: Achieve fuel consumption rates at or below the limits established by Proconve (Brazil) phase applicable to the vehicle category and comply with EU CO2 emission standards where relevant.

indicators.name: Lightweight Design
indicators.description: Evaluation of the vehicle's structural design focusing on reducing overall weight to improve fuel efficiency and reduce emissions without compromising safety.
indicators.measurement: Verify vehicle curb weight through manufacturer specifications and compare against industry benchmarks; assess use of lightweight materials via technical datasheets and material certifications; perform weight reduction analysis relative to previous models.
indicators.target: Achieve a vehicle curb weight reduction of at least 10% compared to previous generation models or meet manufacturer targets aligned with EU CO2 standards and Proconve limits.

indicators.name: Aerodynamic Optimization
indicators.description: Evaluation of the vehicle's design features aimed at reducing aerodynamic drag to improve fuel efficiency and reduce emissions.
indicators.measurement: Assess drag coefficient (Cd) values through wind tunnel testing or computational fluid dynamics (CFD) simulations; verify design elements such as streamlined body shape, underbody panels, and active aerodynamic components.
indicators.target: Achieve a drag coefficient (Cd) below 0.30 to meet or exceed EU CO2 Standards and Proconve (Brazil) efficiency requirements.

indicators.name: Energy Recovery Systems
indicators.description: Evaluation of the presence and effectiveness of energy recovery systems in automotive vehicles that capture and reuse energy during braking or deceleration to improve overall fuel efficiency and reduce emissions.
indicators.measurement: Verify the integration of energy recovery technologies such as regenerative braking through manufacturer technical documentation and test results; measure energy recaptured during standardized driving cycles; assess compliance with relevant emission and efficiency standards.
indicators.target: Vehicles should incorporate energy recovery systems that demonstrably reduce CO2 emissions in line with EU CO2 Standards and Proconve (Brazil) requirements, achieving at least a 10% improvement in fuel efficiency compared to baseline models without such systems.

indicators.name: Efficient Powertrains
indicators.description: Evaluation of vehicle powertrain efficiency focusing on fuel consumption and emissions performance to ensure reduced environmental impact and compliance with regulatory standards.
indicators.measurement: Verify compliance with EU CO2 emission standards and Proconve (Brazil) limits through laboratory fuel consumption tests and emissions measurements; review manufacturer declarations and certification reports.
indicators.target: Powertrains must meet or exceed EU CO2 emission standards and Proconve (Brazil) emission limits for the vehicle category.

indicators.name: Ethanol Fuel Compatibility
indicators.description: Evaluation of a vehicle's compatibility and performance when using ethanol fuel blends common in Brazil, ensuring engine efficiency and emissions compliance under local fuel standards.
indicators.measurement: Verify manufacturer specifications and test reports confirming engine compatibility with ethanol blends (E25 to E100), conduct fuel system material resistance tests, and assess emissions and fuel consumption under Proconve (Brazil) protocols.
indicators.target: Vehicle must demonstrate full operational compatibility with ethanol blends up to E100 without performance degradation or increased emissions beyond Proconve limits.

indicators.name: Recycled Material Content
indicators.description: Evaluation of the proportion of recycled materials used in automotive components to reduce environmental impact and resource depletion.
indicators.measurement: Quantify the percentage of recycled content in materials through supplier declarations, material certifications, and laboratory analysis of component samples.
indicators.target: Achieve a minimum of 30% recycled material content in automotive parts where technically feasible.

indicators.name: Recyclable Components
indicators.description: Evaluation of the proportion and identification of vehicle components that are recyclable at end-of-life to reduce environmental impact and support circular economy principles.
indicators.measurement: Assessment through material composition analysis, verification of recyclability certifications, and documentation review of component materials; use of lifecycle assessment tools aligned with ISO 14040 to quantify recyclable content percentage.
indicators.target: At least 85% of vehicle components by weight should be recyclable according to recognized standards and certifications.

indicators.name: Reduced Rare Materials
indicators.description: Evaluation of the reduction in the use of rare and critical raw materials in automotive components to minimize environmental impact and supply risks.
indicators.measurement: Quantify the weight or percentage of rare materials used in the vehicle's components through material composition analysis and supplier declarations; verify compliance with reduction targets via lifecycle assessment reports.
indicators.target: Achieve a measurable reduction in rare material content compared to previous vehicle models or industry benchmarks, aiming for continuous decrease aligned with ESPR future and Proconve (Brazil) guidelines.

indicators.name: Sustainable Interiors
indicators.description: Evaluation of the use of environmentally friendly and recycled materials in vehicle interiors to reduce environmental impact and enhance sustainability throughout the product lifecycle.
indicators.measurement: Verify the percentage of recycled or renewable materials used in interior components through supplier declarations and material certifications; assess compliance with ISO 14001 environmental management standards; review manufacturer documentation on material sourcing and recyclability.
indicators.target: At least 30% of interior materials should be recycled or renewable, with full compliance to ISO 14001 environmental management standards.

indicators.name: Bio-based Materials
indicators.description: Evaluation of the proportion and use of bio-based materials in automotive components to reduce reliance on fossil-based resources and enhance sustainability.
indicators.measurement: Quantify the percentage of bio-based materials used in vehicle parts through material composition analysis and supplier declarations; verify compliance with recognized certifications and standards.
indicators.target: Incorporate a minimum of 20% bio-based materials by weight in automotive components where feasible, aligned with emerging ESPR future requirements.

indicators.name: Vehicle Lifespan
indicators.description: Evaluation of the expected operational lifespan of the vehicle, focusing on its ability to remain functional and safe over an extended period under normal usage conditions.
indicators.measurement: Assessment through manufacturer lifespan declarations, durability testing reports, and analysis of component wear rates; verification of compliance with Proconve durability requirements and Inovar-Auto program criteria.
