indicators.target: Vehicle designed to maintain operational functionality and safety for a minimum of 15 years or 250,000 kilometers under normal usage.

indicators.name: Corrosion Resistance
indicators.description: Evaluation of the vehicle's ability to resist corrosion over time under various environmental conditions, ensuring structural integrity and longevity.
indicators.measurement: Conduct standardized salt spray tests (e.g., ASTM B117), inspect protective coatings, and review manufacturer corrosion warranty periods and material specifications.
indicators.target: Vehicle components must withstand at least 1000 hours of salt spray exposure without significant corrosion or degradation.

indicators.name: Quality Construction
indicators.description: Evaluation of the vehicle's build quality focusing on materials, assembly precision, and resistance to wear and tear to ensure long-term durability.
indicators.measurement: Assessment through material composition analysis, structural integrity tests, and inspection of assembly processes; verification of durability test results and manufacturer quality control documentation.
indicators.target: Vehicle construction meets or exceeds industry standards for durability with no significant defects or premature wear within the first 5 years of use.

indicators.name: Warranty Duration
indicators.description: Evaluates the durability of the automotive product based on the length of the warranty period provided by the manufacturer, indicating expected reliability and lifespan.
indicators.measurement: Verify the warranty documentation provided with the vehicle, ensuring the warranty period is clearly stated and exceeds 5 years; cross-check with manufacturer declarations and official product labels.
indicators.target: Warranty period greater than 5 years

indicators.name: Maintenance Support
indicators.description: Evaluation of the availability and quality of maintenance support services provided for the vehicle, ensuring long-term durability through accessible repairs, parts availability, and technical assistance.
indicators.measurement: Verify manufacturer-provided maintenance plans, availability of spare parts within the Brazilian market, authorized service centers network density, and customer support responsiveness through service records and user feedback.
indicators.target: Comprehensive maintenance support with authorized service centers in all major Brazilian regions, guaranteed availability of critical spare parts for at least 10 years, and clear manufacturer maintenance documentation.

indicators.name: Recyclability Rate
indicators.description: Evaluation of the vehicle's material recyclability at the end of its life cycle, focusing on the percentage of components that can be effectively recycled.
indicators.measurement: Calculate the proportion of recyclable materials in the vehicle using material composition analysis and recycling facility reports, ensuring recyclability exceeds 85%.
indicators.target: Recyclability greater than 85%

indicators.name: Battery Recycling
indicators.description: Evaluation of the processes and effectiveness of recycling electric vehicle (EV) batteries at the end of their life cycle to minimize environmental impact and recover valuable materials.
indicators.measurement: Verification through documentation of battery recycling procedures, recycling rates, and compliance audits; assessment of recycling facility certifications and manufacturer declarations on battery end-of-life management.
indicators.target: Achieve a minimum of 90% recycling rate of EV batteries in compliance with applicable standards and regulations.

indicators.name: Take-back Schemes
indicators.description: Evaluation of the existence and effectiveness of manufacturer or distributor take-back schemes for end-of-life vehicles to ensure proper recycling and disposal.
indicators.measurement: Verify presence of documented take-back programs, check compliance records, review manufacturer declarations, and assess participation rates in take-back schemes through audits and customer feedback.
indicators.target: Implementation of a take-back scheme covering 100% of end-of-life vehicles produced, ensuring environmentally sound recycling and disposal.

indicators.name: Remanufacturing Programs
indicators.description: Evaluation of the presence and effectiveness of remanufacturing programs aimed at extending vehicle component life and reducing waste at end-of-life. This includes assessing processes for collecting, refurbishing, and reusing automotive parts.
indicators.measurement: Verify existence of documented remanufacturing procedures, review records of remanufactured parts volume versus total parts produced, and assess compliance through audits and manufacturer declarations.
indicators.target: Implementation of a remanufacturing program covering at least 30% of eligible automotive components by volume to reduce end-of-life waste.

digital_products_software.name: Digital Products & Software

indicators.name: Optimized Energy Code
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the software code is optimized to minimize energy consumption during execution, reducing the environmental impact of digital products.
indicators.measurement: Analyze code efficiency using profiling tools to measure CPU and memory usage, conduct energy consumption tests under typical workloads, and review adherence to Green Software Principles and EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres guidelines.
indicators.target: Software code must demonstrate measurable reductions in energy consumption compared to baseline implementations, aiming for at least 20% lower energy use through optimization techniques.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Efficient Algorithms
indicators.description: Evaluation of software algorithms based on their computational efficiency and resource optimization to minimize energy consumption during execution.
indicators.measurement: Analyze algorithm complexity (time and space), profile energy consumption using software energy profiling tools (e.g., Intel Power Gadget, Green Software Foundation tools), and review code for optimization techniques that reduce CPU/GPU cycles and memory usage.
indicators.target: Algorithms should demonstrate minimized computational complexity and reduced energy consumption compared to baseline implementations, aiming for at least 20% improvement in energy efficiency.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Green Hosting
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the software product is hosted on data centers powered by renewable energy sources, ensuring reduced carbon footprint and improved energy efficiency.
indicators.measurement: Verify hosting provider's energy sources through renewable energy certificates, audit reports, and third-party verification; check for compliance with green hosting standards and certifications.
indicators.target: Hosting services must be powered 100% by renewable energy from certified data centers.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: carbon-aware computing
indicators.description: Evaluates the implementation of computing practices that minimize carbon emissions by optimizing workload scheduling and resource usage based on carbon intensity data.
indicators.measurement: Verify use of carbon intensity APIs or tools to schedule computing tasks during low carbon emission periods; assess integration of carbon-aware algorithms in software; review energy consumption logs correlated with carbon intensity data.
indicators.target: Software systems should dynamically adjust computing workloads to align with periods of low carbon intensity, achieving measurable reductions in carbon emissions compared to baseline usage.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Edge Computing Usage
indicators.description: Evaluates the implementation of edge computing to minimize data transfer between devices and central servers, thereby reducing energy consumption associated with data transmission.
indicators.measurement: Verify the architecture design documents and network logs to confirm data processing occurs at edge nodes; measure reduction in data transfer volume compared to centralized processing; use network monitoring tools to quantify data traffic and energy consumption related to data transfer.
indicators.target: Implement edge computing solutions that reduce data transfer volume by at least 30% compared to centralized processing models.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Efficient AI Models
indicators.description: Evaluates the design and implementation of AI models to ensure they avoid over-parameterization, thereby optimizing energy consumption during training and inference.
indicators.measurement: Analyze model architecture and parameter count; use profiling tools to measure energy consumption during typical workloads; verify adherence to best practices in model optimization such as pruning and quantization.
indicators.target: AI models should minimize parameter count without compromising performance, avoiding over-parameterization to reduce energy use.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Renewable Energy Data Centers
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the data centers used by the software product are powered entirely or predominantly by renewable energy sources to minimize carbon footprint.
indicators.measurement: Verify energy sourcing reports and utility bills to confirm renewable energy usage percentage; audit certifications and compliance with renewable energy standards; use third-party verification tools or reports from data center operators.
indicators.target: 100% of energy consumed by data centers is sourced from renewable energy.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Power Usage Effectiveness
indicators.description: Evaluates the energy efficiency of data center infrastructure by measuring the ratio of total facility energy to IT equipment energy consumption, indicating how effectively power is used.
indicators.measurement: Calculate PUE by dividing total energy consumed by the data center facility by the energy consumed by IT equipment, using energy meters and monitoring systems; verify that PUE is below 1.2.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Server Utilization
indicators.description: Evaluates the percentage of server capacity actively used to ensure efficient infrastructure operation and reduce energy waste.
indicators.measurement: Monitor server workload metrics using data center management tools or software performance monitors to calculate average server utilization over a defined period.
indicators.target: Maintain server utilization above 70%.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Cooling Efficiency
indicators.description: Evaluation of the optimization of cooling systems in data center infrastructure to reduce energy consumption and environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Assess cooling system performance using Power Usage Effectiveness (PUE) metrics, verify implementation of free cooling or liquid cooling technologies, and review adherence to Green Software Principles and EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres.
indicators.target: Achieve a PUE of 1.2 or lower through optimized cooling strategies.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Carbon Offset Programs
indicators.description: Evaluation of the implementation and effectiveness of carbon offset programs aimed at compensating the digital product's infrastructure-related carbon emissions.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of active carbon offset initiatives through certification records, review of offset project documentation, and confirmation of carbon credits retired corresponding to the product's infrastructure emissions.
indicators.target: Full compensation of infrastructure-related carbon emissions through verified carbon offset programs annually.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Lightweight Applications
indicators.description: Evaluation of software applications based on their resource efficiency and minimal system requirements to reduce energy consumption during use.
indicators.measurement: Analyze application resource usage metrics such as CPU, memory, and network consumption under typical workloads using profiling tools; verify adherence to Green Software Principles and benchmark against industry standards for lightweight software.
indicators.target: Applications should demonstrate at least a 30% reduction in resource consumption compared to baseline software of similar functionality.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Minimal Data Storage
indicators.description: Evaluates the software's design to minimize data storage requirements, reducing energy consumption and environmental impact associated with data retention and processing.
indicators.measurement: Assess data storage architecture through code review and system audits to verify efficient data retention policies, data compression techniques, and deletion of unnecessary data. Use monitoring tools to measure actual storage usage and compare against baseline requirements.
indicators.target: Data storage should be optimized to the minimum necessary for functionality, with no redundant or obsolete data retained beyond defined retention periods.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Efficient Data Compression
indicators.description: Evaluates the implementation and effectiveness of data compression techniques to minimize data size and reduce energy consumption during storage and transmission.
indicators.measurement: Assess compression algorithms used by analyzing compression ratios, benchmarking data transfer sizes before and after compression, and verifying adherence to Green Software Principles and EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres guidelines.
indicators.target: Achieve data compression ratios that reduce data size by at least 50% without significant loss of quality, optimizing energy efficiency in data handling.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: bandwidth consumption reduction
indicators.description: Evaluates the software's efficiency in minimizing data transfer to reduce bandwidth usage, thereby lowering energy consumption and environmental impact during operation.
indicators.measurement: Measure average data transfer per user session using network monitoring tools; analyze bandwidth usage logs; verify implementation of data compression and caching techniques according to Green Software Principles.
indicators.target: Achieve at least a 20% reduction in bandwidth consumption compared to baseline software versions without optimization.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: dark mode energy saving
indicators.description: Evaluates the implementation of dark mode options in software to reduce OLED display energy consumption by minimizing pixel illumination.
indicators.measurement: Verify presence of dark mode feature in software settings; measure energy consumption difference on OLED devices using power profiling tools when dark mode is enabled versus disabled.
indicators.target: Software must provide a dark mode option that demonstrably reduces OLED display energy consumption compared to standard light mode.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Long-term Support
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the software product provides continuous support and updates over an extended period to ensure sustained functionality and security.
indicators.measurement: Verify the duration and frequency of software updates and support commitments through product documentation, update logs, and manufacturer declarations; assess compliance with Green Software Principles and EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres.
indicators.target: Software must provide support and updates for a minimum of 5 years post-release with regular security and functionality patches.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Backward Compatibility
indicators.description: Evaluates the software's ability to maintain compatibility with previous versions and legacy systems to extend product lifespan and reduce the need for frequent upgrades.
indicators.measurement: Verify through testing reports demonstrating successful operation on at least the last two major previous versions of the software and compatibility with legacy hardware or operating systems; review developer documentation and update logs for backward compatibility commitments.
indicators.target: Software must support backward compatibility with at least the two most recent major versions and legacy systems to minimize forced upgrades.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: No Planned Obsolescence
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the software product is designed and maintained to avoid intentional shortening of its useful life through forced updates or incompatibility, ensuring long-term usability and support.
indicators.measurement: Review product lifecycle policies, update and support timelines, and analyze software version compatibility; verify absence of forced obsolescence mechanisms through code audits and manufacturer declarations.
indicators.target: Software products must have no planned obsolescence, demonstrated by support and compatibility for a minimum of 5 years without forced discontinuation.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Open Standards Compliance
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the software product adheres to open standards to ensure interoperability, future-proofing, and ease of integration over time.
indicators.measurement: Verify compliance by reviewing product documentation for adherence to recognized open standards, checking for certifications or declarations from the manufacturer, and assessing alignment with Green Software Principles and EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres.
indicators.target: Software must fully implement and support relevant open standards to guarantee long-term compatibility and maintainability.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Interoperability
indicators.description: Evaluates the software's ability to operate across different systems and platforms without compatibility issues, ensuring long-term usability and integration.
indicators.measurement: Verify compliance with interoperability standards through testing on multiple platforms, review of API documentation, and assessment of adherence to Green Software Principles and EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres interoperability criteria.
indicators.target: Software must support open standards and demonstrate seamless operation across at least 3 major operating systems or platforms.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Carbon Footprint Disclosure
indicators.description: Evaluation of the software product's transparency in disclosing its carbon footprint, including the methodology and scope of emissions reported.
indicators.measurement: Verify the availability of a detailed carbon footprint report that follows recognized standards, check for third-party verification or certification, and assess if the disclosure includes scope 1, 2, and relevant scope 3 emissions associated with the software lifecycle.
indicators.target: Full disclosure of carbon footprint with third-party verification aligned to recognized standards.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Energy Consumption Metrics
indicators.description: Evaluation of the software's energy consumption by measuring the amount of energy used during operation and its efficiency in resource utilization.
indicators.measurement: Measure energy usage through software profiling tools and monitoring systems during typical workloads; verify reported metrics against industry benchmarks and certifications.
indicators.target: Provide detailed energy consumption data per operation or transaction, aiming for continuous reduction aligned with Green Software Principles and EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Sustainability Reporting
indicators.description: Evaluation of the software product's transparency in disclosing its environmental impact and sustainability practices through formal reporting mechanisms.
indicators.measurement: Verify the existence and accessibility of sustainability reports or disclosures aligned with recognized frameworks; check for certification by relevant bodies; assess adherence to Green Software Principles and EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres.
indicators.target: The product should have publicly available sustainability reports or certifications demonstrating compliance with at least one recognized standard or certification such as Green Software Foundation, ISO 14001, or Carbon Neutral Certification.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres Compliance

indicators.name: Green Software Certification
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the software product has obtained recognized green software certifications that demonstrate adherence to environmental sustainability and energy efficiency principles.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of valid certifications such as Green Software Foundation certification, ISO 14001, or Carbon Neutral Certification on the product or company documentation; cross-check compliance with Green Software Principles and EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres.
indicators.target: Software products should hold at least one recognized green certification (e.g., Green Software Foundation, ISO 14001, or Carbon Neutral Certification) to ensure transparency in sustainability claims.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

cloud_services.name: Cloud Services & Data Centers

indicators.name: Renewable Energy Usage
indicators.description: Evaluates the proportion of energy consumed by the cloud service that is sourced from renewable energy. This ensures the service operates with minimal environmental impact by relying entirely on sustainable energy sources.
indicators.measurement: Verify energy procurement records and utility bills to confirm renewable energy sourcing, conduct audits of energy suppliers, and review certifications or declarations confirming 100% renewable energy usage. Use energy tracking tools and third-party verification reports.
indicators.target: 100% of the energy consumed by the cloud service must come from renewable sources.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Renewable PPAs
indicators.description: Evaluation of the use of Power Purchase Agreements (PPAs) to procure renewable energy for cloud service operations, ensuring a shift towards sustainable energy sources.
indicators.measurement: Verify contracts or agreements demonstrating procurement of renewable energy via PPAs; review energy bills and supplier declarations; audit energy sourcing reports; confirm alignment with recognized standards.
indicators.target: 100% of electricity consumption sourced through renewable energy PPAs.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: On-site Renewable Generation
indicators.description: Evaluates the extent to which cloud service providers generate renewable energy on-site to power their data centers, reducing reliance on external non-renewable energy sources.
indicators.measurement: Verify installation and operational capacity of on-site renewable energy systems through energy generation reports, meter readings, and third-party audits; assess percentage of total energy consumption met by on-site renewables.
indicators.target: Achieve at least 50% of total energy consumption supplied by on-site renewable generation.

indicators.name: Carbon-Free Energy Supply
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the cloud service provider uses energy sources that are carbon-free continuously, ensuring zero carbon emissions 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.
indicators.measurement: Verify energy procurement contracts and real-time energy consumption data to confirm 100% carbon-free energy usage continuously; audit energy source certificates and monitor grid mix reports or on-site renewable generation logs.
indicators.target: 100% carbon-free energy supply 24/7
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Renewable Energy Certificates
indicators.description: Evaluation of the use and verification of Renewable Energy Certificates (RECs) to ensure cloud service providers source their electricity from renewable energy.
indicators.measurement: Verify procurement and retirement of RECs through official registries or certificates; audit energy bills and supplier contracts to confirm renewable energy sourcing.
indicators.target: 100% of electricity consumption covered by valid and retired Renewable Energy Certificates.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Power Usage Effectiveness
indicators.description: Evaluates the energy efficiency of data centers by measuring the ratio of total facility energy to IT equipment energy consumption, indicating how effectively power is used.
indicators.measurement: Calculate PUE by dividing total data center energy consumption by the energy consumed by IT equipment, using energy meters and monitoring systems over a representative period.
indicators.target: PUE < 1.2
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Water Usage Effectiveness
indicators.description: Evaluates the efficiency of water usage in cloud service data centers by measuring the ratio of total water consumed to the IT equipment energy consumption.
indicators.measurement: Calculate WUE by dividing the total annual water usage (in liters) by the total IT energy consumption (in kWh) over the same period, using water meters and energy monitoring systems; verify data through audits and reports.
indicators.target: WUE < 1.0

indicators.name: server utilization
indicators.description: Evaluates the extent to which servers in data centers are actively used to maximize resource efficiency and reduce energy waste.
indicators.measurement: Measure average server utilization rates using monitoring tools and software over a defined period; verify through data center management reports and energy consumption logs.
indicators.target: Achieve and maintain server utilization rates above 70% to ensure high efficiency.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Efficient Cooling Systems
indicators.description: Evaluation of the implementation and performance of cooling systems designed to minimize energy consumption in data centers, ensuring optimal thermal management with reduced environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Assess cooling system efficiency through power usage effectiveness (PUE) metrics, review of cooling technology specifications, on-site energy consumption monitoring, and verification of compliance with recognized standards such as the EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres.
indicators.target: Achieve a PUE value of 1.4 or lower, demonstrating efficient cooling operations that reduce energy waste.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Free Cooling Utilization
indicators.description: Evaluation of the implementation and effectiveness of free cooling systems in data centers to reduce reliance on mechanical cooling and improve energy efficiency.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence and operational status of free cooling systems through site inspections and review of cooling system logs; assess cooling energy consumption data before and after free cooling implementation; confirm design compliance with Green Grid and EU Code of Conduct guidelines.
indicators.target: Maximize use of free cooling where climatic conditions allow, aiming for at least 50% of annual cooling demand met by free cooling methods.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Energy-efficient servers
indicators.description: Evaluation of servers based on their energy efficiency to reduce power consumption and environmental impact in data centers.
indicators.measurement: Verify server energy efficiency through power usage effectiveness (PUE) metrics, energy consumption reports, and compliance with recognized energy efficiency standards such as the EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres and Green Grid guidelines.
indicators.target: Servers should meet or exceed energy efficiency criteria outlined in the EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres, aiming for a PUE of 1.4 or lower.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Extended Hardware Lifespan
indicators.description: Evaluation of the duration and durability of hardware components used in cloud services to ensure prolonged operational life and reduced electronic waste.
indicators.measurement: Assess hardware replacement cycles and maintenance records; verify use of durable components through manufacturer specifications; audit refurbishment and reuse practices; measure mean time between failures (MTBF).
indicators.target: Hardware lifespan extended by at least 30% beyond industry average or minimum 5 years of active service life.

indicators.name: E-Waste Management
indicators.description: Evaluation of the implementation of responsible e-waste management practices for hardware used in cloud services, ensuring proper disposal, recycling, and reduction of electronic waste impact.
indicators.measurement: Verify documented e-waste management policies, audit records of hardware disposal and recycling processes, and assess compliance with recognized standards and certifications through on-site inspections and third-party reports.
indicators.target: 100% of hardware e-waste is managed according to responsible disposal and recycling procedures aligned with recognized standards.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Hardware Recycling Programs
indicators.description: Evaluation of the existence and effectiveness of hardware recycling programs implemented by cloud service providers to ensure responsible end-of-life management of IT equipment.
indicators.measurement: Verify documented recycling policies, audit records of hardware disposal, and third-party recycling certifications; assess compliance with recognized standards and participation in take-back or certified recycling schemes.
indicators.target: 100% of decommissioned hardware is recycled or disposed of through certified recycling programs in compliance with applicable environmental standards.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Circular Economy Practices
indicators.description: Evaluation of the implementation of circular economy principles in hardware management, including reuse, refurbishment, recycling, and reduction of electronic waste in cloud service infrastructure.
indicators.measurement: Verify presence of documented circular economy policies, track percentage of hardware components reused or refurbished, assess recycling rates of end-of-life equipment, and review procurement criteria favoring circular economy-compliant products.
indicators.target: Achieve at least 70% reuse or refurbishment rate of hardware components and 90% recycling rate of end-of-life equipment within the cloud service infrastructure.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Water-efficient cooling
indicators.description: Evaluation of the cooling systems used in cloud data centers focusing on minimizing water consumption through efficient technologies and practices.
indicators.measurement: Verify the implementation of cooling technologies that reduce water usage such as adiabatic cooling or closed-loop systems; measure water consumption per kW of IT load; review water usage reports and audits.
indicators.target: Achieve at least a 30% reduction in water usage for cooling compared to conventional water-cooled systems, aligning with benchmarks from the EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Rainwater Harvesting
indicators.description: Evaluation of the implementation and efficiency of rainwater harvesting systems to reduce potable water consumption in cloud service data centers.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of rainwater harvesting infrastructure through site inspections and review of water usage logs to quantify the volume of rainwater collected and utilized for non-potable applications.
indicators.target: Achieve at least 30% reduction in potable water use through rainwater harvesting integration.

indicators.name: Water Recycling Systems
indicators.description: Evaluation of the implementation and efficiency of water recycling systems within cloud service data centers to reduce freshwater consumption and promote sustainable water management.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence and operational status of water recycling systems through on-site inspections and review of water usage logs; assess water recycling rates and compare against baseline freshwater consumption; validate through third-party audit reports or certification documentation.
indicators.target: Data centers must have functional water recycling systems that recycle at least 50% of the water used in cooling and other processes.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres
On-site water usage and recycling system audit reports

indicators.name: Water-Abundant Location
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the data center or cloud service facility is located in a region classified as water-abundant, minimizing water stress and supporting sustainable water use.
indicators.measurement: Verify the geographic location of the facility against recognized water scarcity maps or indices such as the Aqueduct Water Risk Atlas; confirm compliance with regional water availability standards and cross-check with sustainability certifications indicating water management practices.
indicators.target: Facility must be situated in a region classified as water-abundant according to recognized water scarcity indices to ensure sustainable water usage.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Sustainability Reporting
indicators.description: Evaluation of the availability and comprehensiveness of public sustainability reports published by the cloud service provider, detailing environmental impacts and sustainability initiatives.
indicators.measurement: Verify the existence of publicly accessible sustainability reports updated at least annually on the provider's website or official communication channels; assess report coverage against recognized frameworks such as the EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres and Green Grid guidelines.
indicators.target: Provider publishes a comprehensive sustainability report annually, aligned with recognized standards and covering key environmental metrics.

indicators.name: Carbon Footprint Disclosure
indicators.description: Evaluation of the extent to which a cloud service provider publicly discloses its carbon footprint, including greenhouse gas emissions associated with its data centers and operations.
indicators.measurement: Verify the availability and accessibility of detailed carbon footprint reports, including scope 1, 2, and relevant scope 3 emissions, published on the provider's website or sustainability reports; cross-check with third-party audits or certifications aligned with recognized standards.
indicators.target: Full disclosure of carbon footprint data updated annually, covering at least scope 1 and 2 emissions, with scope 3 emissions reported where feasible.

indicators.name: Real-time Energy Dashboards
indicators.description: Evaluation of the availability and accuracy of real-time energy consumption dashboards that provide continuous monitoring of data center energy use to enhance transparency and enable energy management.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of an accessible dashboard displaying real-time energy consumption data, assess data update frequency (minimum every 15 minutes), and confirm integration with energy meters or sensors for accuracy.
indicators.target: Provide a real-time energy dashboard with updates at least every 15 minutes, accessible to stakeholders for monitoring energy consumption.
data_sources: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Third-Party Audits
indicators.description: Evaluation of the cloud service provider's transparency through independent third-party audits verifying environmental and operational compliance.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence and validity of third-party audit reports, certifications, and compliance statements from recognized bodies; review audit frequency and scope related to environmental management and energy efficiency.
indicators.target: Maintain up-to-date third-party audits with no major non-conformities, conducted at least annually.

references: EU Code of Conduct for Data Centres

indicators.name: Recycled Content Percentage
indicators.description: Evaluates the proportion of recycled material used in the packaging, ensuring that more than 70% of the packaging content is derived from recycled sources.
indicators.measurement: Verify recycled content percentage through material composition analysis, supplier declarations, and certification reports confirming recycled material use in packaging components.

indicators.name: Recyclable Materials
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the packaging materials used are recyclable according to recognized standards and regulations, ensuring they can be effectively processed in recycling systems.
indicators.measurement: Verify material composition through manufacturer declarations and product labels; confirm recyclability by cross-referencing with EU Packaging Directive and ISO 18601 criteria; check certification compliance such as FSC, Cradle to Cradle, OK Compost, EU Ecolabel, and ABNT; conduct material recovery facility compatibility tests if applicable.
indicators.target: 100% of packaging materials should be recyclable according to applicable standards and certifications.

indicators.name: Biodegradable or Compostable
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether packaging materials are biodegradable or compostable, ensuring they break down under natural conditions without leaving harmful residues.
indicators.measurement: Verify certification labels such as OK Compost or ABNT for compostability, check compliance with ISO 18601 biodegradability criteria, and confirm manufacturer declarations or test reports demonstrating biodegradability or compostability according to recognized standards.
indicators.target: Packaging materials must be certified as biodegradable or compostable by recognized standards or certifications applicable in the Brazilian market.

indicators.name: Renewable Materials
indicators.description: Evaluation of the proportion and use of renewable materials in packaging to ensure sustainability and reduced environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Verify the percentage of renewable materials used in packaging through supplier declarations, material composition analysis, and certification verification (e.g., FSC, Cradle to Cradle). Conduct audits to confirm compliance with renewable material criteria as defined by relevant standards.
indicators.target: Packaging should contain at least 50% renewable materials by weight, complying with criteria set by the EU Packaging Directive and National Solid Waste Policy (Brazil).

indicators.name: Minimal Plastic Use
indicators.description: Evaluates the extent to which plastic materials are minimized in product packaging to reduce environmental impact and promote sustainability.
indicators.measurement: Quantify the percentage of plastic by weight in the total packaging material using material composition analysis and verify through manufacturer declarations and third-party lab reports.
indicators.target: Plastic content in packaging should not exceed 10% by weight to align with minimal use principles.

indicators.name: Brazilian Recycled Content
indicators.description: Evaluation of the proportion and certification of recycled materials sourced from Brazil used in packaging components, ensuring compliance with national and international sustainability standards.
indicators.measurement: Verify the percentage of recycled content through supplier declarations and material analysis reports; cross-check certifications such as ABNT and FSC; confirm compliance with the National Solid Waste Policy (Brazil) and ISO 18601 requirements.
indicators.target: Packaging must contain a minimum of 30% recycled materials sourced from Brazil, verified through recognized certifications and documentation.

indicators.name: Minimal Packaging
indicators.description: Evaluation of the packaging design to ensure the use of the least amount of material necessary to protect and contain the product, minimizing waste and environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Quantify packaging weight relative to product weight, assess packaging volume efficiency, and verify absence of unnecessary layers or components through physical inspection and manufacturer documentation.
indicators.target: Packaging weight should be minimized without compromising product protection, ideally not exceeding 10% of the product weight, in compliance with EU Packaging Directive and National Solid Waste Policy (Brazil).

indicators.name: Right-sized packaging
indicators.description: Evaluation of packaging dimensions and volume to ensure minimal excess space, reducing material use and waste. The packaging should closely fit the product to optimize resource efficiency and transportation.
indicators.measurement: Compare product dimensions with packaging dimensions to calculate void space percentage; verify packaging design documentation and conduct physical measurements. Assess compliance with sizing guidelines per ISO 18601 and National Solid Waste Policy (Brazil).
indicators.target: Packaging void space should not exceed 10% of the total package volume to minimize material use and waste.

indicators.name: Mono-material design
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the packaging is designed using a single type of material to facilitate recycling and reduce complexity in waste management.
indicators.measurement: Verify the packaging composition through material analysis or manufacturer declarations to confirm that only one material type is used throughout the packaging structure.
indicators.target: Packaging must be composed of a single material type without multi-layer or composite materials to ensure recyclability.

indicators.name: Component Separability
indicators.description: Evaluates the ease with which packaging components can be separated for recycling or disposal, minimizing contamination and facilitating material recovery.
indicators.measurement: Assess packaging by disassembling components manually to verify if materials can be separated without damage or specialized tools; review manufacturer declarations on component separability; perform visual inspection for clear separation points or labels indicating separability.
indicators.target: All packaging components should be easily separable by hand without the need for specialized tools to ensure effective recycling and compliance with waste management policies.

indicators.name: Reusable Design
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the packaging is designed for multiple uses to reduce waste and extend product lifecycle, promoting sustainability.
indicators.measurement: Verify packaging design features that enable reuse through physical inspection and manufacturer documentation; assess compliance with reuse criteria defined in ISO 18601 and National Solid Waste Policy (Brazil); confirm presence of reuse claims on product labels or declarations.
indicators.target: Packaging must be designed to allow at least one reuse cycle without significant loss of functionality or safety.

indicators.name: Energy-efficient manufacturing
indicators.description: Evaluates the energy consumption and efficiency of the packaging manufacturing process to ensure minimal environmental impact through optimized energy use.
indicators.measurement: Assess energy consumption data from manufacturing facilities, verify implementation of energy-saving technologies, and review energy audits or certifications indicating efficiency improvements.
indicators.target: Manufacturing processes must demonstrate reduced energy consumption compared to industry benchmarks or comply with energy efficiency requirements defined in ISO 18601 and the EU Packaging Directive.

indicators.name: Low Water Consumption
indicators.description: Evaluates the amount of water used during the production process of packaging materials to minimize environmental impact and promote sustainable resource use.
indicators.measurement: Quantify water usage in liters per kilogram of packaging produced through water flow meters and production records; verify water efficiency improvements via manufacturer declarations and third-party audits.
indicators.target: Minimize water consumption to below industry average benchmarks or achieve certification standards that demonstrate reduced water use in production processes.

indicators.name: Emission Reduction
indicators.description: Evaluates the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions during the production of packaging materials, focusing on minimizing carbon footprint and environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Verify carbon footprint reports or life cycle assessments (LCA) of packaging production; check compliance with emission limits set by the EU Packaging Directive and National Solid Waste Policy (Brazil); review certifications indicating sustainable production practices.
indicators.target: Achieve measurable reduction in production emissions compared to baseline values, aiming for compliance with or exceeding thresholds established by ISO 18601 and National Solid Waste Policy (Brazil).

indicators.name: Local Production
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the packaging is produced locally to reduce environmental impacts associated with transportation and support regional economies.
indicators.measurement: Verify the production location through manufacturer declarations, supply chain documentation, and product labels indicating origin within the target market region (e.g., Brazil or EU). Cross-check with certifications or compliance reports referencing local production requirements.
indicators.target: Packaging production occurs within the same country or region as the point of sale, minimizing transportation distances and associated emissions.

indicators.name: Recyclability
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the packaging material is widely recyclable through existing municipal or regional recycling systems, ensuring it can be effectively collected and processed at end of life.
indicators.measurement: Verify recyclability by cross-referencing packaging material composition with local recycling guidelines, checking for recognized recycling symbols, and confirming certification compliance through product documentation and manufacturer declarations.
indicators.target: Packaging must be accepted by at least 80% of municipal recycling programs in the target market and certified by recognized ecolabels or certifications indicating recyclability.

indicators.name: Recycling Instructions Clarity
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the packaging includes clear, legible, and easily understandable recycling instructions to facilitate proper end-of-life disposal by consumers.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence and clarity of recycling instructions on packaging through visual inspection; assess compliance with EU Packaging Directive and ISO 18601 guidelines; confirm instructions align with local recycling practices including Brazil's National Solid Waste Policy.
indicators.target: Packaging must display clear recycling instructions that comply with relevant standards and are understandable by the target consumer base.

indicators.name: Compostable Certification
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the packaging material is certified as compostable according to recognized standards, ensuring it can be safely biodegraded in industrial or home composting conditions.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of valid compostable certifications such as OK Compost or ABNT on packaging labels or manufacturer documentation; cross-check compliance with relevant standards like ISO 18601 and the EU Packaging Directive.
indicators.target: Packaging must possess at least one recognized compostable certification (e.g., OK Compost or ABNT) confirming compliance with compostability standards suitable for industrial or home composting.

indicators.name: Take-back Programs
indicators.description: Evaluation of the presence and effectiveness of take-back programs that enable consumers to return packaging for reuse, recycling, or proper disposal, ensuring responsible end-of-life management.
indicators.measurement: Verify existence of documented take-back programs through manufacturer declarations and product labels; assess program coverage and consumer accessibility; check compliance with relevant standards and national regulations.
indicators.target: Packaging must be part of an established take-back program that ensures at least 90% consumer accessibility and facilitates recycling or reuse in compliance with national and international standards.

indicators.name: Renewable Energy Use
indicators.description: Evaluation of the proportion and sourcing of energy derived from renewable sources in the utility's energy mix, ensuring compliance with recognized renewable energy standards and directives.
indicators.measurement: Verify the percentage of energy supplied that originates from renewable sources through certification documents, energy supplier declarations, and compliance reports aligned with recognized standards such as ISO 50001 and I-REC (Brazil).
indicators.target: 100% of energy sourced from renewable energy as defined by the EU Renewable Energy Directive and certified by recognized bodies.
data_sources: EU Renewable Energy Directive Compliance Reports

indicators.name: Low Carbon Intensity
indicators.description: Evaluates the carbon intensity of the energy source used by the utility, focusing on minimizing greenhouse gas emissions associated with energy production.
indicators.measurement: Verify carbon intensity through lifecycle assessment reports, emissions data, and certification compliance; use recognized carbon accounting methodologies aligned with ISO 50001 and EU Renewable Energy Directive standards.
indicators.target: Energy sources must demonstrate low carbon intensity consistent with EU Renewable Energy Directive thresholds for renewable energy and comply with ISO 50001 energy management requirements.

indicators.name: Fossil Fuel Exclusion
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the energy supplied is free from fossil fuel sources, ensuring compliance with renewable energy standards and reducing carbon emissions.
indicators.measurement: Verify energy source composition through supplier declarations, certification audits, and compliance reports; cross-check with certification bodies and track energy origin certificates specific to Brazil.
indicators.target: Energy supplied contains 0% fossil fuels.

indicators.name: Certified Green Energy
indicators.description: Evaluation of the energy source based on certification status to ensure the energy supplied is derived from verified renewable or green sources.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of valid certifications such as Green-e, EKOenergy, ISO 50001, or I-REC (Brazil) on energy supply documentation or contracts. Cross-check with certification registries and audit reports to confirm compliance with recognized green energy standards.
indicators.target: Energy supply must be certified by at least one recognized green energy certification such as Green-e, EKOenergy, ISO 50001, or I-REC (Brazil).
data_sources: EU Renewable Energy Directive Compliance Documentation

indicators.name: Local Energy Generation
indicators.description: Evaluates the extent to which energy is generated locally to reduce transmission losses and support regional sustainability goals.
indicators.measurement: Verify the proportion of energy produced onsite or within the local grid area through utility reports, energy audits, and local generation certificates; cross-check with manufacturer declarations and grid operator data.
indicators.target: 100% of energy consumed is generated locally or within the defined regional boundary.

indicators.name: Hydroelectric Energy Use
indicators.description: Evaluation of the product's energy source focusing on hydroelectric power within the Brazilian context, assessing the share and certification of hydroelectric energy used.
indicators.measurement: Verify the proportion of hydroelectric energy supplied or consumed through utility bills, energy supplier declarations, and certification documents; confirm certifications such as I-REC (Brazil) and compliance with ISO 50001 energy management standards.
indicators.target: 100% of the energy source should be hydroelectric, certified by recognized standards applicable in Brazil.

indicators.name: Solar and Wind Expansion
indicators.description: Evaluation of the extent to which energy utilities are increasing their generation capacity from solar and wind sources to support renewable energy transition.
indicators.measurement: Assess the percentage increase in installed capacity or energy production from solar and wind sources over a defined period using utility reports, verified renewable energy certificates, and compliance with relevant standards.
indicators.target: Demonstrate measurable year-over-year growth in solar and wind energy capacity or generation, aligned with EU Renewable Energy Directive targets for renewable expansion.

indicators.name: High Conversion Efficiency
indicators.description: Evaluates the energy conversion efficiency of utilities to ensure minimal energy loss during production and distribution processes.
indicators.measurement: Measure the ratio of useful energy output to total energy input using standardized testing protocols and energy audits in accordance with ISO 50001 guidelines.
indicators.target: Achieve a conversion efficiency of at least 85% or higher as defined by industry benchmarks and ISO 50001 standards.

indicators.name: Transmission Losses
indicators.description: Evaluation of the energy transmission system to ensure minimal losses during electricity delivery from generation to end-users, focusing on reducing energy dissipation in the grid.
indicators.measurement: Calculate transmission loss percentage by comparing energy input at generation points with energy delivered at distribution endpoints using smart grid monitoring tools and utility reports; verify through energy audits and grid efficiency assessments.
indicators.target: Transmission losses should be minimized, ideally below 6% as per industry best practices aligned with EU Renewable Energy Directive recommendations.

indicators.name: Smart Grid Integration
indicators.description: Evaluation of the utility's capability to integrate and operate within smart grid systems to optimize energy distribution and consumption efficiency.
indicators.measurement: Verify the implementation of smart grid technologies through system audits, review of operational data showing real-time energy management, and assessment of interoperability with smart meters and demand response systems.
indicators.target: Full integration with smart grid infrastructure enabling dynamic energy management and improved efficiency in energy distribution.

indicators.name: Demand Response Programs
indicators.description: Evaluation of the implementation and effectiveness of demand response programs that adjust electricity consumption during peak periods to enhance energy efficiency and grid stability.
indicators.measurement: Verify participation in demand response initiatives through utility reports, assess load reduction during peak events via smart meter data, and review program enrollment and response rates.
indicators.target: Active participation in demand response programs with measurable load reductions during peak demand periods as defined by utility standards.

indicators.name: Low Emissions
indicators.description: Evaluation of the energy utility's greenhouse gas and pollutant emissions to ensure minimal environmental impact. This includes assessing the carbon footprint and other harmful emissions associated with energy production and distribution.
indicators.measurement: Verify emissions data through certified reports, emission monitoring systems, and compliance audits. Check for certification under recognized standards and labels indicating low emission levels, and review energy source mix focusing on renewable content.
indicators.target: Energy utilities should demonstrate emissions below industry average levels, prioritizing renewable energy sources and achieving certification under recognized low-emission standards.

indicators.name: Minimal Land Use
indicators.description: Evaluates the extent to which energy utilities minimize land occupation and disturbance during infrastructure development and operation to reduce environmental footprint.
indicators.measurement: Assess land area occupied per unit of energy produced using site surveys and GIS mapping; verify land use optimization strategies and impact assessments documented by the utility provider.
indicators.target: Land use footprint per MWh produced should be minimized and justified with environmental impact assessments demonstrating minimal disturbance.

indicators.name: wildlife protection
indicators.description: Evaluation of measures implemented by energy utilities to minimize negative impacts on local wildlife and their habitats during energy production and distribution.
indicators.measurement: Assessment through environmental impact assessments (EIA), monitoring reports on wildlife disturbances, compliance audits with wildlife protection regulations, and verification of mitigation measures implemented on-site.
indicators.target: Zero significant adverse impacts on local wildlife populations and habitats, with documented mitigation strategies in place.

indicators.name: Water Conservation
indicators.description: Evaluation of the utility's efforts to minimize water usage and implement water-saving technologies in energy production and distribution processes.
indicators.measurement: Assess water consumption records, review implementation of water-efficient technologies, conduct audits on water use reduction initiatives, and verify compliance with water conservation policies.
indicators.target: Achieve measurable reduction in water consumption year-over-year and implement water-saving measures aligned with best practices.

indicators.name: biodiversity preservation
indicators.description: Evaluation of measures implemented to protect and preserve local biodiversity during energy production and utility operations, minimizing habitat disruption and promoting ecosystem health.
indicators.measurement: Assessment through biodiversity impact studies, monitoring of species diversity and habitat conditions pre- and post-project implementation, and verification of compliance with biodiversity protection plans.
indicators.target: No net loss of biodiversity; implementation of mitigation measures to preserve or restore habitats affected by operations.

indicators.name: Energy Source Disclosure
indicators.description: Evaluation of the clarity and completeness of information provided regarding the energy sources used by the utility, ensuring consumers can identify the origin and type of energy supplied.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence and accessibility of detailed energy source information in utility disclosures, including breakdown by energy type and origin, through official reports, product labels, and public statements; cross-check with certification documentation.
indicators.target: Full disclosure of energy sources with clear identification of renewable and non-renewable components as per EU Renewable Energy Directive requirements.

indicators.name: carbon intensity reporting
indicators.description: Evaluation of the utility's disclosure and accuracy in reporting the carbon intensity of their energy production, reflecting the amount of CO2 emissions per unit of energy generated.
indicators.measurement: Verify published carbon intensity reports against recognized standards, check alignment with ISO 50001 energy management system data, and confirm reporting transparency through third-party audits or certifications.
indicators.target: Complete and accurate carbon intensity reporting aligned with ISO 50001 and EU Renewable Energy Directive requirements, with publicly accessible data updated at least annually.

indicators.name: Sustainability Certifications
indicators.description: Evaluation of the presence and validity of recognized sustainability certifications that demonstrate compliance with energy efficiency and renewable energy standards.
indicators.measurement: Verify certification documents such as Green-e, EKOenergy, ISO 50001, and I-REC (Brazil) for authenticity and current validity; cross-check compliance with EU Renewable Energy Directive and ISO 50001 standards.
indicators.target: Product or service must hold at least one valid sustainability certification from the recognized list, demonstrating adherence to relevant energy efficiency or renewable energy standards.

indicators.name: Third-Party Verification
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the energy utility's claims regarding renewable energy sourcing and energy management are independently verified by accredited third parties to ensure transparency and credibility.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of valid certifications or verifications from recognized third-party organizations such as Green-e, EKOenergy, ISO 50001, or I-REC (Brazil). Check audit reports, certification documents, and compliance with EU Renewable Energy Directive and ISO 50001 standards.
indicators.target: Energy utilities must have at least one valid third-party certification or verification confirming renewable energy sourcing or energy management practices.
data_sources: EU Renewable Energy Directive Compliance Documentation

indicators.name: ESG Integration
indicators.description: Evaluation of the extent to which environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors are systematically incorporated into investment decision-making processes.
indicators.measurement: Review of investment policy documents for explicit ESG integration clauses; analysis of portfolio holdings for ESG-compliant assets; verification of adherence to recognized ESG frameworks and disclosures; assessment of risk management procedures addressing ESG factors.
indicators.target: Full integration of ESG criteria into all investment decisions, with documented processes aligned to recognized standards.

indicators.name: Fossil Fuel Exclusion
indicators.description: Evaluation of the investment policy's exclusion criteria to ensure no direct or indirect investments are made in fossil fuel companies or projects. This assesses the alignment of the investment portfolio with sustainability goals by avoiding fossil fuel exposure.
indicators.measurement: Review of investment portfolios and policies to verify exclusion of fossil fuel assets, using portfolio analysis tools and third-party verification reports. Cross-check compliance with exclusion lists and screening criteria defined by recognized standards.
indicators.target: 100% exclusion of fossil fuel investments from the portfolio.

indicators.name: Green Bonds & Sustainable Finance
indicators.description: Evaluation of the institution's commitment to integrating green bonds and sustainable finance principles into its investment policy, ensuring alignment with recognized environmental and social standards.
indicators.measurement: Review investment portfolio to identify the proportion of green bonds and sustainable finance instruments; verify alignment with EU Taxonomy criteria and disclosures following TCFD and SFDR frameworks; assess adoption of Principles for Responsible Banking commitments related to sustainable finance.
indicators.target: At least 30% of the investment portfolio allocated to green bonds and sustainable finance instruments aligned with EU Taxonomy and SFDR criteria.

indicators.name: Impact Investing
indicators.description: Evaluation of the financial service provider's commitment to impact investing, focusing on investments that generate positive social and environmental outcomes alongside financial returns.
indicators.measurement: Review of investment portfolios and policies to verify allocation towards impact investments, analysis of impact reporting and metrics, and assessment of alignment with recognized impact frameworks and taxonomies.
indicators.target: At least 30% of the investment portfolio allocated to impact investments aligned with recognized social and environmental objectives.

indicators.name: Climate Risk Assessment
indicators.description: Evaluation of the processes and methodologies used by financial institutions to identify, assess, and manage climate-related risks within their investment portfolios.
indicators.measurement: Review of documented climate risk assessment frameworks, analysis of scenario testing results, verification of integration of climate risks into investment decision-making, and assessment of disclosures aligned with recognized standards.
indicators.target: Comprehensive climate risk assessment integrated into investment policies, with scenario analysis covering at least 2 climate scenarios and full disclosure aligned with TCFD recommendations.

indicators.name: Amazon Preservation Financing
indicators.description: Evaluation of the financial institution's policies and practices to finance projects that contribute to the preservation and sustainable management of the Amazon rainforest.
indicators.measurement: Review of investment portfolios and project financing records to identify allocations specifically directed towards Amazon preservation initiatives; assessment of alignment with recognized sustainability frameworks and verification through third-party audits.
indicators.target: 100% of new investment projects related to forestry or land use in the Amazon region must demonstrate positive environmental impact and compliance with preservation criteria.

indicators.name: Carbon-Neutral Operations
indicators.description: Evaluation of the financial service provider's operational activities to ensure net-zero carbon emissions through reduction, offsetting, or renewable energy use.
indicators.measurement: Verify carbon footprint assessments, review carbon offset purchases or renewable energy certificates, and confirm implementation of emission reduction initiatives through third-party audits or sustainability reports.
indicators.target: Achieve net-zero carbon emissions in all operational activities annually.

indicators.name: Green Buildings
indicators.description: Evaluation of the implementation and management of environmentally sustainable building practices within financial service operations, focusing on energy efficiency, resource conservation, and reduced environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Verification through certification status of buildings under recognized green building standards, assessment of energy and water consumption data, and review of sustainability reports detailing building management practices.
indicators.target: Operations should be conducted in buildings certified under recognized green building standards or demonstrate continuous improvement in environmental performance metrics aligned with EU Taxonomy criteria.

indicators.name: Paperless Processes
indicators.description: Evaluation of the extent to which financial services operations have transitioned to digital workflows to minimize or eliminate paper usage, thereby reducing environmental impact and improving operational efficiency.
indicators.measurement: Review of internal process documentation and digital workflow implementation; audit of paper consumption records comparing baseline and current usage; verification of digital transaction volumes versus paper-based transactions; employee and client surveys on paperless adoption.
indicators.target: Achieve 100% digital processing of client transactions and internal operations to eliminate paper use.

indicators.name: Renewable Energy Use
indicators.description: Evaluation of the proportion of renewable energy utilized in the operations of financial services institutions to reduce carbon footprint and align with sustainability commitments.
indicators.measurement: Assess the percentage of total energy consumption sourced from renewable energy through energy bills, supplier contracts, and on-site generation records; verify through third-party audits and certification compliance reports.
indicators.target: Achieve at least 50% renewable energy use in total operational energy consumption within 3 years, progressing towards 100% renewable energy alignment.

indicators.name: Sustainable Procurement
indicators.description: Evaluation of the integration of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) criteria into procurement processes to ensure responsible sourcing and minimize negative impacts throughout the supply chain.
indicators.measurement: Review procurement policies and supplier contracts for inclusion of ESG criteria; verify supplier certifications and sustainability reports; assess alignment with EU Taxonomy and SFDR requirements; conduct audits or supplier assessments focusing on sustainability practices.
indicators.target: 100% of procurement contracts include ESG criteria aligned with EU Taxonomy and SFDR standards.

indicators.name: Sustainability Reporting
indicators.description: Evaluation of the extent and quality of sustainability disclosures made by financial service providers, focusing on transparency in environmental, social, and governance (ESG) impacts and risks.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence and comprehensiveness of sustainability reports aligned with recognized frameworks such as TCFD and EU Taxonomy; assess adherence to disclosure requirements under SFDR; review certification status under B Corp, ISO 14001, and Principles for Responsible Banking.
indicators.target: Full disclosure of sustainability performance aligned with TCFD recommendations and compliance with EU Taxonomy and SFDR requirements.

indicators.name: TCFD Disclosure
indicators.description: Evaluation of the extent to which financial services disclose climate-related financial risks and opportunities in alignment with the Task Force on Climate-related Financial Disclosures (TCFD) recommendations.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence and completeness of TCFD-aligned disclosures in annual reports or sustainability reports, including governance, strategy, risk management, and metrics/targets related to climate risks.
indicators.target: Full alignment with TCFD recommendations, demonstrating comprehensive disclosure across all four core elements.

indicators.name: Portfolio Carbon Footprint
indicators.description: Evaluation of the total greenhouse gas emissions associated with the investment portfolio, measuring the carbon intensity of financed assets to assess climate-related risks and impacts.
indicators.measurement: Calculate the portfolio carbon footprint using standardized methodologies such as the PCAF (Partnership for Carbon Accounting Financials) protocol, analyzing financed emissions data reported by investee companies or estimated via sector-specific emission factors; verify disclosures in sustainability reports and alignment with TCFD recommendations.
indicators.target: Achieve transparent disclosure of portfolio carbon footprint with year-over-year reduction targets aligned with the Paris Agreement goals, aiming for a measurable decrease in financed emissions intensity.

indicators.name: Impact Measurement
indicators.description: Evaluation of the financial service provider's ability to measure and disclose the environmental and social impacts of their activities and investments.
indicators.measurement: Verify the existence and quality of impact measurement frameworks, including regular reporting aligned with recognized standards such as TCFD recommendations and SFDR disclosures; assess the use of quantitative metrics and qualitative assessments in impact reports.
indicators.target: Comprehensive impact measurement and disclosure aligned with TCFD and SFDR standards, with annual reporting and third-party verification where applicable.

indicators.name: Green Financial Products
indicators.description: Evaluation of financial products that contribute to environmental sustainability by aligning with recognized green finance principles and regulatory frameworks. This includes assessing product design, impact, and disclosures related to environmental risks and benefits.
indicators.measurement: Verify product alignment with EU Taxonomy criteria for environmentally sustainable activities, assess disclosures following TCFD recommendations, and confirm adherence to SFDR requirements for sustainability-related disclosures. Review certifications such as B Corp, ISO 14001, and Principles for Responsible Banking to validate green claims.
indicators.target: Financial products should fully comply with EU Taxonomy criteria for green activities, provide transparent TCFD-aligned climate-related financial disclosures, and meet SFDR sustainability disclosure obligations.

indicators.name: Sustainable Investment Options
indicators.description: Evaluation of financial products based on their alignment with sustainability criteria, focusing on investment options that incorporate environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors.
indicators.measurement: Verify the inclusion of sustainable investment options through product documentation, ESG scoring methodologies, and compliance with recognized sustainability frameworks such as TCFD disclosures and SFDR classifications.
indicators.target: All offered investment products should demonstrate alignment with EU Taxonomy criteria or equivalent sustainability standards, ensuring at least 75% of assets under management comply with recognized sustainable investment principles.

indicators.name: Climate-Aligned Lending
indicators.description: Evaluation of financial products based on their alignment with climate goals, assessing the extent to which lending practices support low-carbon and sustainable economic activities.
indicators.measurement: Review of lending portfolios against EU Taxonomy criteria for climate alignment, assessment of disclosures following TCFD recommendations, and verification of adherence to Principles for Responsible Banking commitments on climate risk integration.
indicators.target: 100% of lending portfolios aligned with EU Taxonomy climate objectives and full disclosure of climate-related risks as per TCFD guidelines.

indicators.name: ESG Ratings Integration
indicators.description: Evaluation of the extent to which financial products incorporate ESG ratings into their assessment and decision-making processes to ensure alignment with sustainability criteria.
indicators.measurement: Verify the inclusion of ESG ratings in product evaluation frameworks through review of internal assessment documents, third-party ESG rating reports, and disclosures aligned with TCFD and SFDR recommendations.
indicators.target: All financial products should integrate recognized ESG ratings in their evaluation process to comply with EU Taxonomy and SFDR standards.

indicators.name: Energy Efficiency
indicators.description: Evaluation of the establishment's implementation of energy-efficient practices and technologies to reduce energy consumption and environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Assess energy consumption records, verify installation of energy-efficient equipment (e.g., LED lighting, HVAC systems), and review energy management policies and audits.
indicators.target: Achieve a measurable reduction in energy consumption through adoption of energy-efficient technologies and practices, aligned with ISO 21401 and GSTC criteria recommendations.

indicators.name: Water Conservation
indicators.description: Evaluation of the implementation of water-saving measures and efficient water management practices within travel and tourism operations to minimize water consumption and reduce environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Verify water consumption records, presence of water-efficient fixtures (e.g., low-flow taps, dual-flush toilets), use of water recycling systems, and documented water management policies through audits and on-site inspections.
indicators.target: Achieve at least 20% reduction in water consumption compared to baseline usage or comply with water efficiency benchmarks as defined by ISO 21401 and GSTC Criteria.

indicators.name: Waste Reduction
indicators.description: Evaluation of the implementation of strategies and practices aimed at minimizing waste generation within travel and tourism operations, including reduction, reuse, and recycling initiatives.
indicators.measurement: Verify waste management plans, audit waste logs and recycling rates, inspect on-site waste segregation systems, and review procurement policies favoring minimal packaging and reusable materials.
indicators.target: Achieve at least a 30% reduction in total waste generated annually compared to baseline measurements, with documented procedures for waste segregation and recycling in place.

indicators.name: Renewable Energy Use
indicators.description: Evaluation of the extent to which the tourism or travel facility utilizes renewable energy sources to reduce environmental impact and promote sustainability.
indicators.measurement: Verify energy consumption records and invoices to determine the percentage of total energy derived from renewable sources; conduct on-site inspections for installed renewable energy systems; review energy supplier certifications and renewable energy certificates (RECs).
indicators.target: At least 50% of total energy consumption should come from renewable sources, aligned with ISO 21401 and GSTC criteria recommendations.

indicators.name: carbon offset programs
indicators.description: Evaluation of the implementation and effectiveness of carbon offset programs aimed at compensating greenhouse gas emissions generated by travel and tourism activities.
indicators.measurement: Verify documentation of carbon offset purchases or investments, assess the credibility and certification of offset projects, and confirm alignment with recognized standards such as ISO 21401 and GSTC Criteria.
indicators.target: 100% of carbon emissions generated by the operation are offset through verified carbon offset programs.

indicators.name: Brazilian Ecosystem Protection
