indicators.description: Evaluation of measures implemented to protect and preserve Brazilian ecosystems within tourism operations, ensuring minimal environmental impact and promotion of biodiversity conservation.
indicators.measurement: Review of environmental management plans, on-site inspections for habitat preservation, monitoring reports on local biodiversity, and verification of compliance with ecosystem protection protocols through third-party audits.
indicators.target: Full compliance with ecosystem protection measures aligned with ISO 21401 and GSTC Criteria, demonstrating active preservation and restoration efforts in Brazilian ecosystems.

indicators.name: Local Employment
indicators.description: Evaluation of the extent to which tourism businesses employ local community members, supporting local economic development and social inclusion.
indicators.measurement: Review of employment records and payroll data to verify the percentage of staff hired from the local community; conduct interviews or surveys with employees to confirm local residency; assess recruitment policies prioritizing local hiring.
indicators.target: At least 70% of staff employed are residents of the local community.

indicators.name: Fair Wages
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether local employees and community workers receive wages that meet or exceed fair labor standards, ensuring economic fairness and social sustainability within the tourism sector.
indicators.measurement: Review payroll records and employment contracts to verify wage levels; conduct interviews or surveys with local employees; compare wages against local minimum wage laws and living wage benchmarks; audit compliance reports from certification bodies.
indicators.target: All local employees receive wages at or above the living wage standard applicable in the region, complying with or exceeding local minimum wage laws.

indicators.name: Community Engagement
indicators.description: Evaluation of the extent to which the tourism operation actively involves and collaborates with the local community to support social, cultural, and economic well-being.
indicators.measurement: Review of documented community consultation processes, records of local employment and procurement, evidence of partnerships with local organizations, and feedback from community stakeholders through surveys or interviews.
indicators.target: Establish and maintain ongoing engagement mechanisms with local community representatives, ensuring at least 50% of procurement and employment is sourced locally where feasible.

indicators.name: Cultural Preservation
indicators.description: Evaluation of the efforts made by tourism operators to preserve and promote local cultural heritage, traditions, and practices in their activities and services.
indicators.measurement: Review of documented cultural preservation policies, assessment of partnerships with local cultural groups, verification of cultural awareness training for staff, and evaluation of guest engagement programs promoting local culture.
indicators.target: Implementation of documented cultural preservation initiatives integrated into operations with active collaboration with local communities and evidence of ongoing cultural promotion activities.

indicators.name: Local Sourcing
indicators.description: Evaluation of the extent to which tourism businesses source goods and services from local suppliers to support the local economy and reduce environmental impacts associated with transportation.
indicators.measurement: Review procurement records and supplier lists to verify the percentage of goods and services sourced from local suppliers within a defined radius; conduct supplier interviews and check invoices for locality verification.
indicators.target: At least 60% of goods and services should be sourced locally within a 100 km radius.

indicators.name: Indigenous Tourism Support
indicators.description: Evaluation of the extent to which tourism operators actively support and promote indigenous tourism initiatives, ensuring cultural respect and economic benefits for indigenous communities.
indicators.measurement: Review of partnerships or collaborations with indigenous groups, assessment of marketing materials promoting indigenous tourism, verification of community benefit-sharing agreements, and audits of cultural sensitivity training for staff.
indicators.target: Establish formal partnerships with at least one indigenous community and demonstrate economic or social benefits through documented agreements or projects.

indicators.name: Wildlife Protection
indicators.description: Evaluation of measures implemented to protect local wildlife and their habitats from negative impacts caused by tourism activities.
indicators.measurement: Review of documented wildlife protection policies, on-site inspections for habitat conservation, monitoring reports of wildlife disturbance incidents, and verification of staff training on wildlife protection protocols.
indicators.target: Zero incidents of wildlife harm or habitat degradation attributable to tourism operations annually.

indicators.name: Habitat Conservation
indicators.description: Evaluation of measures implemented to protect and conserve natural habitats within and around tourism facilities, ensuring minimal disruption to local biodiversity.
indicators.measurement: Review of habitat management plans, on-site inspections for habitat preservation, monitoring reports of local flora and fauna, and verification of compliance with conservation policies.
indicators.target: Implementation of effective habitat conservation strategies that maintain or improve local biodiversity status, with no net loss of natural habitats.

indicators.name: Responsible Wildlife Tourism
indicators.description: Evaluation of tourism practices that ensure wildlife is observed and interacted with in a manner that minimizes disturbance and supports conservation efforts. This includes adherence to ethical guidelines and local regulations to protect biodiversity.
indicators.measurement: Verify compliance through documented wildlife interaction protocols, guest education materials, and monitoring reports of wildlife disturbance incidents. Conduct audits to ensure adherence to ethical wildlife tourism standards and review certifications obtained.
indicators.target: 100% compliance with responsible wildlife interaction protocols that prevent disturbance and support conservation, with no recorded incidents of wildlife harm or habitat disruption.

indicators.name: Animal Exploitation Prohibition
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the tourism product or service avoids any form of animal exploitation, ensuring ethical treatment and protection of wildlife.
indicators.measurement: Review of operational policies, on-site inspections for animal use or displays, verification of supplier and partner compliance through documented declarations, and audit reports confirming absence of animal exploitation activities.
indicators.target: Zero instances of animal exploitation in all tourism activities and services offered.

indicators.name: Amazon Pantanal Conservation
indicators.description: Evaluation of tourism operations' efforts to conserve biodiversity specifically within the Amazon and Pantanal regions, focusing on habitat protection and sustainable practices that minimize ecological impact.
indicators.measurement: Assessment through documented conservation programs, partnerships with local environmental organizations, implementation of sustainable land use practices, and monitoring reports demonstrating biodiversity preservation in Amazon and Pantanal areas.
indicators.target: Demonstrated active conservation initiatives in Amazon and Pantanal regions with measurable positive impacts on biodiversity, aligned with ISO 21401 and GSTC Criteria standards.

indicators.name: Sustainable Food Sourcing
indicators.description: Evaluation of the procurement practices to ensure food products are sourced sustainably, minimizing environmental impact and supporting local producers. This includes preference for certified, organic, or locally produced food items that comply with recognized sustainability standards.
indicators.measurement: Review procurement records and supplier certifications to verify the percentage of food sourced from sustainable suppliers; conduct audits of supplier sustainability claims; assess menus for inclusion of local and certified organic products; verify compliance with sustainability criteria through third-party certifications.
indicators.target: At least 70% of food products sourced from suppliers certified by recognized sustainability standards or local organic producers.

indicators.name: Eco-friendly Amenities
indicators.description: Evaluation of the availability and use of environmentally sustainable amenities in travel and tourism operations, focusing on reducing environmental impact through resource-efficient products and services.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of amenities that meet eco-friendly criteria through on-site inspections, review of procurement records, and certification compliance audits. Assess the use of products with low environmental impact, such as biodegradable toiletries, energy-efficient appliances, and water-saving fixtures.
indicators.target: All amenities provided should comply with recognized eco-friendly standards or certifications, aiming for 100% of amenities to be environmentally sustainable.

indicators.name: green transportation options
indicators.description: Evaluation of the availability and promotion of environmentally friendly transportation options for guests and staff, aiming to reduce carbon emissions associated with travel to and from the facility.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of sustainable transport options such as electric vehicle charging stations, bicycle rentals, shuttle services using low-emission vehicles, and partnerships with green transport providers. Review transportation policies and guest information materials promoting these options.
indicators.target: At least two distinct green transportation options available and actively promoted to guests and staff to minimize carbon footprint.

indicators.name: Paperless Operations
indicators.description: Evaluation of the implementation of digital processes to minimize or eliminate the use of paper in operational activities within travel and tourism services.
indicators.measurement: Verify the percentage of operational documents and communications conducted electronically through audits of digital record systems, review of paper consumption logs, and employee interviews regarding paper use reduction practices.
indicators.target: 100% of operational documentation and communication conducted electronically to achieve a fully paperless operation.

indicators.name: Sustainability Certifications
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the travel or tourism service provider holds recognized sustainability certifications that demonstrate adherence to environmental and social responsibility standards.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence and validity of certifications such as Green Key, EarthCheck, Travelife, Green Globe, or ISO 21401 through official certification bodies or registries; review documentation and claims made by the provider.
indicators.target: The service provider should hold at least one valid sustainability certification recognized by international or Brazilian standards, preferably ISO 21401 or certifications aligned with GSTC Criteria.

indicators.name: carbon footprint disclosure
indicators.description: Evaluation of the extent to which a travel or tourism service publicly discloses its carbon footprint, including methodology and scope of emissions accounted for.
indicators.measurement: Verify if the service provider publishes a detailed carbon footprint report, including scope 1, 2, and relevant scope 3 emissions, using recognized calculation methodologies; check for third-party verification or certification.
indicators.target: Full disclosure of carbon footprint data with third-party verification according to ISO 21401 and GSTC Criteria standards.

indicators.name: Guest Education Programs
indicators.description: Evaluation of the presence and effectiveness of educational programs aimed at informing guests about sustainable practices and environmental responsibility during their stay.
indicators.measurement: Verify the existence of structured guest education initiatives through program documentation, guest feedback surveys, and staff training records; assess content relevance and frequency of delivery.
indicators.target: Implementation of at least one comprehensive guest education program that covers key sustainability topics and is delivered to 100% of guests during their stay.

indicators.name: Sustainable Protein Sources
indicators.description: Evaluation of the inclusion of sustainable protein sources such as insect protein and upcycled ingredients in pet care products to reduce environmental impact and promote resource efficiency.
indicators.measurement: Verify ingredient lists and supplier declarations for presence of insect protein or upcycled ingredients; cross-check certifications like USDA Organic and B Corp; review compliance with AAFCO standards for ingredient safety; conduct supplier audits to confirm sustainability claims.
indicators.target: Product contains at least 20% sustainable protein sources (insect protein, upcycled ingredients) by weight in the formulation.

indicators.name: Organic Ingredients
indicators.description: Evaluation of the proportion and presence of organic ingredients used in pet care products, ensuring they meet recognized organic standards to reduce chemical exposure and environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Verify ingredient lists for organic certification claims; cross-check with USDA Organic certification and manufacturer declarations; conduct random lab testing for organic content; review compliance with AAFCO standards for pet food products.
indicators.target: At least 95% of ingredients by weight must be certified organic.

indicators.name: No Harmful Chemicals
indicators.description: Evaluation of pet care products to ensure they contain no harmful chemicals or additives that could pose health risks to pets or the environment.
indicators.measurement: Verify ingredient lists against recognized harmful chemical databases; conduct laboratory testing for prohibited substances; review manufacturer declarations and safety data sheets; check compliance with AAFCO pet food standards and ISO 14001 environmental management criteria.
indicators.target: Product ingredients must contain zero harmful chemicals or additives as defined by AAFCO and relevant Brazilian regulations.

indicators.name: Biodegradable Toy Materials
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether toys and accessories are made from materials that are biodegradable, reducing environmental impact and waste accumulation.
indicators.measurement: Verify material composition through manufacturer declarations and product labels; conduct or review biodegradability testing reports according to recognized standards; confirm use of certified biodegradable materials in product documentation.
indicators.target: 100% of toys and accessories composed of biodegradable materials.

indicators.name: Recycled Ocean-Bound Plastics
indicators.description: Evaluation of the use of recycled materials specifically ocean-bound plastics in pet care products such as collars, assessing the proportion and authenticity of recycled content.
indicators.measurement: Verify product composition through manufacturer declarations and third-party lab testing for recycled content; check for traceability documentation confirming ocean-bound plastic sourcing; review product labels and certifications indicating recycled material use.
indicators.target: 100% of plastic components in collars made from certified recycled ocean-bound plastics.

indicators.name: Natural Fibers Use
indicators.description: Evaluation of the use of natural fibers in pet beds and toys to ensure materials are sustainable and safe for pets. This includes verifying the fiber content and origin to promote environmental and animal welfare benefits.
indicators.measurement: Verify product material composition through manufacturer declarations and product labels; confirm certification of natural fibers via USDA Organic or FSC for wood toys; conduct random laboratory fiber content testing if necessary.
indicators.target: 100% of fibers used in pet beds and toys should be natural fibers sourced from certified sustainable origins.

indicators.name: Recyclable Packaging
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the product packaging is made from materials that can be collected and processed through recycling systems, reducing environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Verify packaging material composition through manufacturer declarations and labeling; confirm recyclability via local recycling guidelines and certifications; conduct material analysis if necessary.
indicators.target: 100% of packaging materials must be recyclable according to Brazilian recycling standards.

indicators.name: Minimal Packaging
indicators.description: Evaluation of the product's packaging to ensure it uses the least amount of material necessary to protect the product, reducing waste and environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Quantify packaging weight relative to product weight, verify use of recyclable or biodegradable materials, and assess packaging design for reduction in excess material through visual inspection and supplier documentation.
indicators.target: Packaging weight should not exceed 10% of the product weight and use materials certified as sustainable or recyclable.
data_sources: Product labels indicating recyclable or minimal packaging

indicators.name: Refillable Packaging
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the product packaging offers refillable options to reduce waste and environmental impact by enabling reuse of containers.
indicators.measurement: Verify product packaging specifications and manufacturer declarations to confirm the availability of refillable options; inspect product labels and packaging design for refill compatibility; review certifications that encourage sustainable packaging practices.
indicators.target: Product packaging must provide a refillable option that allows consumers to reuse containers at least twice, reducing single-use packaging waste.

indicators.name: Compostable Packaging
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the pet care product packaging is made from materials that are compostable, reducing environmental impact by enabling biodegradation in composting conditions.
indicators.measurement: Verify packaging material specifications through manufacturer declarations and third-party certifications; conduct or review compostability tests according to recognized standards; inspect product labels for compostable claims.
indicators.target: 100% of packaging materials are certified compostable or demonstrably compostable under industrial or home composting conditions.
data_sources: FSC certification (if packaging includes wood-based components)
Third-party compostability certifications recognized in Brazil

indicators.name: Bulk Purchasing Options
indicators.description: Evaluates the availability and promotion of bulk purchasing options to reduce packaging waste in pet care products. This includes assessing packaging sizes and options that allow consumers to buy larger quantities with less packaging material per unit.
indicators.measurement: Verify product listings and packaging information for bulk size options, check manufacturer declarations for bulk packaging availability, and review retailer offerings. Assess packaging weight per unit volume to confirm reduction in packaging material. Conduct spot checks on product labels and packaging to confirm bulk options.
indicators.target: Offer at least one bulk purchasing option that reduces packaging material per unit compared to standard sizes.

indicators.name: Ethical sourcing
indicators.description: Evaluation of the sourcing practices to ensure materials and ingredients are obtained responsibly, respecting labor rights and environmental standards throughout the supply chain.
indicators.measurement: Verify supplier certifications and audit reports; check for compliance with recognized ethical sourcing certifications; review manufacturer declarations and supply chain traceability documentation.
indicators.target: All raw materials and ingredients must be sourced from suppliers certified by recognized ethical standards or demonstrate equivalent verified ethical sourcing practices.

indicators.name: Low Carbon Footprint
indicators.description: Evaluation of the greenhouse gas emissions associated with the production processes of pet care products, focusing on minimizing carbon footprint throughout the supply chain.
indicators.measurement: Calculate the carbon footprint using life cycle assessment (LCA) tools or carbon accounting software; verify implementation of environmental management systems like ISO 14001; review manufacturer declarations and product carbon labels if available.
indicators.target: Demonstrate a measurable reduction in carbon emissions compared to industry averages or maintain carbon footprint below defined thresholds as per ISO 14001 guidelines.

indicators.name: Water-efficient production
indicators.description: Evaluates the efficiency of water usage during the production process of pet care products, aiming to minimize water consumption and reduce environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Assess water consumption records and water use efficiency metrics provided by the manufacturer; verify implementation of water-saving technologies and processes through audits; review compliance with ISO 14001 environmental management standards focusing on water use.
indicators.target: Production processes should demonstrate a measurable reduction in water use compared to industry averages or baseline data, with continuous improvement documented through environmental management systems.
data_sources: AAFCO (for pet food water use standards)

indicators.name: Fair Labor Practices
indicators.description: Evaluation of the adherence to fair labor standards during the production of pet care products, ensuring ethical treatment, fair wages, and safe working conditions for all workers involved.
indicators.measurement: Verification through audit reports, supplier declarations, and certification compliance checks focusing on labor conditions, wage fairness, and worker safety policies.
indicators.target: 100% compliance with recognized fair labor standards and certifications ensuring no exploitation or unsafe working conditions.
data_sources: ISO 14001 (for environmental management linked to labor conditions)

indicators.name: Local Production Preference
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the pet care product is produced locally to reduce transportation emissions and support local economies. This includes verifying the origin of raw materials and manufacturing location within Brazil or nearby regions.
indicators.measurement: Verify production location through manufacturer declarations, supply chain documentation, and product labeling. Cross-check with certifications and standards indicating local sourcing or production. Use audits or third-party verification when available.
indicators.target: Product manufacturing and primary raw materials sourced within Brazil or immediate neighboring countries.
data_sources: AAFCO (for pet food ingredient sourcing standards)
B Corp certification (for social and environmental performance)

indicators.name: Cruelty-Free Testing
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the product has been developed and tested without causing harm or suffering to animals, ensuring ethical treatment throughout the product lifecycle.
indicators.measurement: Verify presence of cruelty-free certifications such as Leaping Bunny; review manufacturer declarations and testing protocols to confirm absence of animal testing; cross-check with product labels and third-party audits.
indicators.target: Product must have no animal testing conducted at any stage, verified by recognized cruelty-free certification or equivalent documentation.

indicators.name: Humane Ingredient Sourcing
indicators.description: Evaluation of sourcing practices to ensure ingredients are obtained without causing harm or distress to animals, prioritizing ethical and humane treatment throughout the supply chain.
indicators.measurement: Verification through supplier audits, certification checks, and review of sourcing policies ensuring compliance with recognized humane standards; analysis of ingredient origin documentation and third-party certification validity.
indicators.target: 100% of animal-derived ingredients sourced from suppliers certified for humane practices or verified through credible third-party audits.

indicators.name: No Animal Testing
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the product has been developed and manufactured without conducting any animal testing at any stage. This ensures adherence to cruelty-free practices in product development.
indicators.measurement: Verify absence of animal testing through certification verification (e.g., Leaping Bunny), review of manufacturer declarations, and assessment of product labels indicating cruelty-free status.
indicators.target: Zero animal testing conducted at any stage of product development and manufacturing.

indicators.name: Ethical Meat Sourcing
indicators.description: Evaluates whether meat ingredients used in pet care products are sourced ethically, ensuring adherence to animal welfare standards and minimizing animal suffering during production.
indicators.measurement: Verify supplier certifications related to ethical meat sourcing, review ingredient sourcing documentation, and confirm compliance with recognized animal welfare standards through audits or third-party certifications.
indicators.target: All meat ingredients used in the product must be sourced from suppliers certified for ethical animal welfare practices.

indicators.name: Biodegradability
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the pet care product is biodegradable, ensuring it breaks down naturally at the end of its life cycle to minimize environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Verify product composition through manufacturer declarations and laboratory biodegradability tests; check for certifications indicating biodegradability; review product labels for biodegradability claims.
indicators.target: Product must be certified or demonstrated to be biodegradable according to recognized standards or pass biodegradability tests within a defined timeframe.

indicators.name: Recyclable Components
indicators.description: Evaluation of the proportion and presence of recyclable materials in the product components to ensure environmentally responsible disposal at end of life.
indicators.measurement: Verify product material composition through manufacturer declarations and third-party lab analysis; check for recyclable material symbols on packaging; assess compliance with ISO 14001 environmental management standards.
indicators.target: At least 90% of product components by weight should be recyclable according to local recycling standards.

indicators.name: Compostable Waste Bags
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether pet waste bags are compostable, ensuring they break down under composting conditions to reduce landfill waste and environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Verify product claims through manufacturer declarations and certification labels; conduct compostability tests according to ISO 17088 or equivalent standards; check for compliance with recognized compostability certifications.
indicators.target: 100% of pet waste bags used are certified compostable and meet recognized compostability standards.

indicators.name: Take-back Programs
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the pet care product manufacturer or retailer offers a take-back program to facilitate responsible end-of-life management and recycling or disposal of the product.
indicators.measurement: Verify the existence of documented take-back programs through manufacturer declarations, check retailer policies, and confirm participation via product labels or official program websites.
indicators.target: Product must have an active take-back program that allows consumers to return used products for proper recycling or disposal.

indicators.name: Low Shower Flow Rate
indicators.description: Evaluation of the showerhead's water flow rate to ensure it operates efficiently by using less water per minute, reducing overall water consumption during use.
indicators.measurement: Measure the flow rate using a flow meter or volumetric container by running the shower for one minute and recording the liters of water dispensed.
indicators.target: < 6 L/min

indicators.name: Water-saving Technology
indicators.description: Evaluation of the incorporation and effectiveness of technologies designed to reduce water consumption in products or processes, ensuring efficient water use without compromising performance.
indicators.measurement: Verify presence and functionality of water-saving features through product specifications, performance testing, and certification verification; assess water consumption rates against benchmark values using standardized testing methods.
indicators.target: Products should incorporate water-saving technologies that achieve at least 20% reduction in water use compared to conventional models or meet recognized water efficiency certification criteria.

indicators.name: Efficient Filtration
indicators.description: Evaluates the effectiveness of filtration systems in reducing water contaminants while minimizing water waste during the filtration process.
indicators.measurement: Assess filtration efficiency through laboratory testing of contaminant removal rates and measurement of water loss during filtration cycles using standardized test protocols.
indicators.target: Filtration systems should achieve at least 90% contaminant removal efficiency with water loss below 10% per filtration cycle.

indicators.name: Minimal Water Waste
indicators.description: Evaluates the extent to which a product or process minimizes water wastage during its operation or lifecycle, ensuring efficient water use.
indicators.measurement: Quantify water consumption versus output using water flow meters and water footprint analysis according to ISO 14046; verify reductions in water loss through audits and performance testing.
indicators.target: Achieve water use efficiency that results in less than 5% water wastage during operation or production processes.

indicators.name: Smart Water Monitoring
indicators.description: Evaluation of the implementation and effectiveness of smart water monitoring systems that track water usage in real-time to optimize consumption and detect leaks.
indicators.measurement: Verify installation of smart water meters or sensors with real-time data reporting capabilities; review monitoring logs and alerts for leak detection; assess integration with water management platforms.
indicators.target: Continuous real-time monitoring with automated alerts for anomalies or leaks, enabling at least 10% reduction in water consumption through optimized usage.

indicators.name: Durable Materials
indicators.description: Evaluates the use of materials that ensure product longevity and resistance to wear, reducing the need for frequent replacement and conserving water resources over the product lifecycle.
indicators.measurement: Assess material specifications and durability tests such as tensile strength, corrosion resistance, and lifespan under typical usage conditions; verify manufacturer durability claims and review third-party certification reports.
indicators.target: Materials must demonstrate durability consistent with industry standards, enabling a minimum product lifespan of 5 years under normal use to minimize water consumption related to manufacturing and replacement.

indicators.name: Recyclable Components
indicators.description: Evaluation of the proportion and presence of recyclable materials used in the product components to reduce water footprint and environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Verify product composition through material declarations and certifications; conduct material recycling potential analysis using standardized tests; review manufacturer documentation and product labels for recyclable content percentage.
indicators.target: At least 90% of the product components by weight should be recyclable.

indicators.name: No Harmful Chemicals
indicators.description: Evaluation of product materials to ensure absence of harmful chemicals that negatively impact water quality and aquatic ecosystems during manufacturing, use, or disposal.
indicators.measurement: Verify through chemical composition analysis, review of safety data sheets (SDS), and compliance audits against restricted substance lists; confirm certifications and manufacturer declarations indicating no harmful chemicals used.
indicators.target: Zero presence of harmful chemicals as defined by relevant water quality protection standards and restricted substance lists.

indicators.name: Plastic-Free Filters
indicators.description: Evaluates whether water filters are manufactured without plastic components to reduce plastic pollution and enhance sustainability.
indicators.measurement: Verify product specifications and materials list for absence of plastic; confirm through manufacturer declarations and third-party testing reports; inspect product labels and certifications indicating plastic-free status.
indicators.target: Filters must be completely free of plastic materials.

indicators.name: Durable Construction
indicators.description: Evaluation of the product's construction materials for longevity and resistance to wear, ensuring reduced need for replacement and lower water usage over its lifecycle.
indicators.measurement: Assess material specifications and durability tests such as tensile strength, corrosion resistance, and lifecycle analysis; verify manufacturer durability claims and review third-party testing reports.
indicators.target: Product materials must demonstrate a minimum lifespan of 10 years under normal usage conditions to minimize water consumption associated with replacements.

indicators.name: Filtration Efficiency
indicators.description: Evaluates the product's ability to effectively filter contaminants from water, ensuring high removal rates of impurities to conserve water quality.
indicators.measurement: Assess filtration efficiency through laboratory testing following NSF/ANSI standards, measuring percentage removal of specific contaminants using standardized water samples.
indicators.target: Achieve filtration efficiency of at least 90% for common contaminants as defined by NSF/ANSI benchmarks.

indicators.name: Water Pressure Maintenance
indicators.description: Evaluates the product's ability to maintain consistent water pressure during operation to ensure efficient water use without compromising performance.
indicators.measurement: Measure inlet and outlet water pressure using a calibrated pressure gauge under standard operating conditions; verify pressure drop does not exceed 10% of nominal pressure.
indicators.target: Maintain water pressure within 90-100% of nominal operating pressure throughout use.

indicators.name: Filter Lifespan
indicators.description: Evaluates the durability and operational lifespan of water filters to ensure prolonged use and reduced replacement frequency, contributing to water conservation.
indicators.measurement: Verify manufacturer specifications and test reports indicating filter lifespan in hours or volume processed; conduct laboratory endurance tests; review product labels and certifications confirming lifespan claims.
indicators.target: Filter lifespan should meet or exceed manufacturer claims, ideally lasting at least 6 months or processing a minimum of 10,000 liters before replacement.

indicators.name: Contaminant Removal Efficiency
indicators.description: Evaluates the product's ability to effectively remove contaminants from water, ensuring water quality improvement and safety for use or discharge.
indicators.measurement: Verify contaminant removal rates through laboratory testing against recognized standards such as NSF/ANSI protocols; review product certifications and performance data; conduct on-site water quality analysis before and after treatment.
indicators.target: Achieve contaminant removal efficiency meeting or exceeding NSF/ANSI standards for relevant contaminants, with removal rates typically above 90%.

indicators.name: NSF/ANSI Certification
indicators.description: Evaluation of the product's effectiveness in water conservation based on compliance with NSF/ANSI certification standards, which ensure performance and safety related to water use.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of NSF/ANSI certification marks on product labels or documentation; confirm certification status through NSF/ANSI official databases or manufacturer declarations.
indicators.target: Product must hold a valid NSF/ANSI certification to demonstrate verified water conservation effectiveness.

indicators.name: Easy Installation
indicators.description: Evaluates the ease of installing the water conservation product, focusing on minimizing time, tools, and technical expertise required to ensure user-friendly setup.
indicators.measurement: Assess installation time through timed trials; verify if installation requires only standard tools; review manufacturer instructions for clarity and completeness; conduct user surveys to confirm ease of installation.
indicators.target: Installation should be completed within 30 minutes using standard household tools without specialized skills.

indicators.name: Low Maintenance
indicators.description: Evaluates the ease and frequency of maintenance required for water conservation products to ensure minimal resource use and operational downtime.
indicators.measurement: Assess maintenance schedules and procedures through manufacturer documentation, verify maintenance frequency logs, and conduct inspections to confirm minimal maintenance needs.
indicators.target: Maintenance requirements should be minimal, with intervals between servicing exceeding industry averages and no need for specialized tools or frequent interventions.

indicators.name: Replaceable Parts Availability
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the product is designed with replaceable parts to facilitate maintenance and extend its lifespan, reducing water waste and resource consumption.
indicators.measurement: Verify through product documentation and manufacturer declarations that key components can be individually replaced without discarding the entire product; confirm availability of parts in the Brazilian market.
indicators.target: All critical components of the product should have replaceable parts readily available for purchase and replacement.

indicators.name: Clear Installation Instructions
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the product includes clear, comprehensive instructions for installation and maintenance to ensure proper use and maximize water conservation benefits.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence and clarity of installation and maintenance instructions through document review, user manuals, and manufacturer declarations; assess if instructions cover step-by-step procedures, troubleshooting, and maintenance schedules.
indicators.target: Product must provide clear, detailed, and accessible installation and maintenance instructions that enable correct setup and upkeep without external assistance.

indicators.name: DIY Installation Ease
indicators.description: Evaluates the ease with which a product can be installed and maintained by a non-professional user without specialized tools or skills, promoting water conservation through proper setup and upkeep.
indicators.measurement: Assessment through user manuals, installation time trials by typical consumers, presence of clear step-by-step instructions, and verification of no requirement for specialized tools or professional assistance.
indicators.target: Product installation and maintenance procedures should be fully executable by an average consumer without professional help, supported by clear documentation and minimal tool requirements.

indicators.name: Recyclable Filters
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the product's filters are designed to be recyclable at the end of their lifecycle, reducing waste and environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Verify product documentation and manufacturer declarations for recyclability claims; inspect physical filter materials for recyclability; confirm compliance with relevant certifications indicating recyclability.
indicators.target: Filters must be fully recyclable according to recognized standards or certifications.

indicators.name: Take-back Programs
indicators.description: Evaluation of the presence and effectiveness of take-back programs that enable the collection and proper recycling or disposal of water-related products at the end of their life cycle to minimize environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Verify the existence of documented take-back programs through manufacturer declarations, review program participation rates, and assess compliance reports or certifications confirming proper collection and recycling processes.
indicators.target: Implementation of a take-back program covering 100% of product returns with documented recycling or environmentally sound disposal methods.

indicators.name: Biodegradable Components
indicators.description: Evaluation of the product's components for biodegradability to ensure they break down naturally at end of life, minimizing environmental impact on water resources.
indicators.measurement: Verify component materials through laboratory biodegradability tests and review manufacturer declarations; assess compliance with recognized biodegradability standards and certifications.
indicators.target: All product components should be biodegradable under standard environmental conditions within a specified timeframe (e.g., 6 months to 1 year).

indicators.name: Refurbishment Options
indicators.description: Evaluation of the availability and implementation of refurbishment options for water conservation products at the end of their life cycle to extend product usability and reduce waste.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of documented refurbishment programs or services offered by the manufacturer or authorized third parties, including repair, component replacement, or remanufacturing processes; review product labels and manufacturer declarations for refurbishment eligibility; assess compliance with relevant standards supporting refurbishment practices.
indicators.target: Products should have accessible refurbishment options that enable at least 50% of end-of-life units to be refurbished and reintroduced into the market, minimizing disposal and resource consumption.

indicators.name: Organic Cotton Use
indicators.description: Evaluation of the use of organic cotton in menstrual and baby products to ensure materials are sustainably sourced and free from harmful chemicals.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of organic cotton through product labels, manufacturer declarations, and certification documents; conduct laboratory testing for fiber composition if necessary.
indicators.target: 100% of cotton content in the product must be certified organic cotton.

indicators.name: Chlorine-Free Materials
indicators.description: Evaluation of menstrual and baby product materials to ensure they contain no harmful chemicals, specifically verifying that they are chlorine-free to prevent toxic residues.
indicators.measurement: Verify product material composition through laboratory chemical analysis for chlorine compounds and review certifications and manufacturer declarations confirming chlorine-free status.
indicators.target: Materials must be free of chlorine and chlorine-derived compounds, ensuring no harmful chemical residues are present.

indicators.name: Biodegradable Materials
indicators.description: Evaluation of the use of biodegradable materials in menstrual and baby products to ensure environmental compatibility and reduced waste impact.
indicators.measurement: Verify material composition through product labels and manufacturer declarations; confirm biodegradability via certifications and compliance with ANVISA regulations; conduct laboratory biodegradability tests if necessary.
indicators.target: 100% of materials used in the product are biodegradable according to recognized standards.

indicators.name: Reusable Material Preference
indicators.description: Evaluates whether menstrual and baby products prioritize the use of reusable materials to reduce waste and environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Verify product specifications and labels for reusable material claims; review manufacturer declarations and product lifecycle information; check for compliance with ANVISA regulations regarding material safety and reusability.
indicators.target: Products should primarily use reusable materials, with at least 80% of product components designed for reuse.

indicators.name: Medical-grade silicone
indicators.description: Evaluation of the use of medical-grade silicone as the primary material in menstrual cups to ensure safety, biocompatibility, and compliance with health regulations.
indicators.measurement: Verify material composition through manufacturer declarations and material safety data sheets (MSDS); confirm compliance with ANVISA regulations for medical-grade silicone; conduct third-party lab testing for material purity and biocompatibility.
indicators.target: Menstrual cups must be made entirely of medical-grade silicone compliant with ANVISA standards for medical devices in Brazil.

indicators.name: Natural Fiber Content
indicators.description: Evaluation of the use of natural fibers in menstrual and baby products to ensure material sustainability and safety. This indicator assesses the presence and proportion of certified natural fibers in the product composition.
indicators.measurement: Verify product composition through manufacturer declarations and product labels; confirm certification of natural fibers via GOTS, USDA Organic, or Ecocert certificates; cross-check compliance with ANVISA regulations and ISO 14001 environmental management standards.
indicators.target: Products should contain at least 90% certified natural fibers to meet sustainability and safety criteria.

indicators.name: Product Reusability
indicators.description: Evaluates whether menstrual and baby products are reusable, such as cloth diapers and menstrual cups, to reduce waste and environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Verify product type and materials through manufacturer declarations and product labels to confirm reusability; check for compliance with ANVISA regulations for reusable products; assess presence of certifications indicating sustainable textile use.
indicators.target: Products should be reusable, specifically including cloth diapers or menstrual cups, to minimize single-use waste.

indicators.name: Product Lifespan
indicators.description: Evaluates the durability and longevity of menstrual and baby products by assessing whether they maintain functionality and safety over a period exceeding two years.
indicators.measurement: Review manufacturer durability testing reports, conduct accelerated aging tests, and verify product performance after repeated use cycles; confirm compliance with ANVISA regulations on product lifespan.
indicators.target: Product lifespan greater than 2 years under normal usage conditions.

indicators.name: Ease of Cleaning
indicators.description: Evaluates how easily the product can be cleaned to ensure hygiene and maintain reusability without degradation. This includes assessing the materials and design features that facilitate effective washing and drying.
indicators.measurement: Conduct user testing to assess cleaning time and effectiveness using standardized washing procedures; verify material resistance to repeated washing cycles; review manufacturer cleaning instructions and compliance with ANVISA hygiene standards.
indicators.target: Product should be cleanable within 10 minutes using standard washing methods without material degradation or loss of function after at least 50 wash cycles.

indicators.name: Durable Construction
indicators.description: Evaluation of the product's structural integrity and material quality to ensure it withstands repeated use without significant degradation or failure.
indicators.measurement: Conduct mechanical stress tests including tensile strength and abrasion resistance; inspect for material quality and stitching durability; verify compliance with ANVISA regulations on product safety and durability.
indicators.target: Product must maintain functional integrity after at least 50 wash cycles without significant wear or damage.

indicators.name: Cost-effectiveness Over Time
indicators.description: Evaluates the product's ability to remain economically viable through multiple uses by comparing initial cost against lifespan and frequency of reuse.
indicators.measurement: Calculate the cost per use by dividing the total purchase price by the number of recommended reuse cycles; verify product lifespan and durability through manufacturer data and user testing reports.
indicators.target: Cost per use should decrease over time, demonstrating a lower expense compared to disposable alternatives within the product's expected lifespan.

indicators.name: Hypoallergenic Properties
indicators.description: Evaluation of the product's potential to cause allergic reactions, ensuring materials and components minimize allergenic risks for sensitive users.
indicators.measurement: Verify compliance through laboratory dermatological tests for allergenicity, review of material safety data sheets, and confirmation of certifications indicating hypoallergenic standards adherence.
indicators.target: Product must demonstrate hypoallergenic properties with no adverse skin reactions in standardized dermatological testing and comply with relevant safety regulations.

indicators.name: Dermatological Testing
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the product has undergone dermatological testing to ensure it does not cause skin irritation or adverse reactions, particularly important for sensitive skin in menstrual and baby products.
indicators.measurement: Verification through review of dermatological test reports conducted by certified laboratories, checking for compliance with ANVISA regulations and presence of dermatological test claims on product labels or manufacturer documentation.
indicators.target: Product must be dermatologically tested with documented evidence showing no skin irritation or adverse effects under ANVISA standards.

indicators.name: Toxic Chemical Absence
indicators.description: Evaluation of the product to ensure it contains no toxic chemicals harmful to users, focusing on chemical safety and compliance with health regulations.
indicators.measurement: Verify absence of toxic chemicals through certification checks (e.g., GOTS, OEKO-TEX), review of ANVISA registration and compliance documents, and laboratory chemical analysis for restricted substances.
indicators.target: Product must contain no toxic chemicals as defined by ANVISA regulations and meet the criteria of relevant certifications.

indicators.name: pH Balance
indicators.description: Evaluation of the product's pH level to ensure it is balanced and compatible with the natural pH of the skin, minimizing irritation and maintaining safety.
indicators.measurement: Measure the product's pH using a calibrated pH meter or pH indicator strips under controlled laboratory conditions, ensuring values fall within the skin-friendly pH range.
indicators.target: Product pH should be within the range of 4.5 to 6.0, consistent with typical skin pH to ensure safety and comfort.

indicators.name: Sensitive Skin Safety
indicators.description: Evaluation of the product's safety for use on sensitive skin, ensuring it does not cause irritation or allergic reactions.
indicators.measurement: Conduct dermatological testing including patch tests on sensitive skin panels; verify compliance with ANVISA regulations for skin safety; review certifications confirming absence of harmful chemicals.
indicators.target: Product must be certified safe for sensitive skin with no reported adverse reactions in dermatological tests and comply with ANVISA safety standards.

indicators.name: Minimal Packaging
indicators.description: Evaluates the extent to which the product packaging is reduced to the minimum necessary to protect and deliver the product, minimizing waste and environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Assess packaging weight and volume relative to product size; verify absence of excessive layers or non-recyclable materials through physical inspection and manufacturer documentation; confirm compliance with ANVISA packaging regulations.
indicators.target: Packaging should use the least amount of material necessary to ensure product integrity and hygiene, avoiding unnecessary layers or components.

indicators.name: Recyclable or Compostable Packaging
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the product packaging is made from materials that can be recycled or composted, reducing environmental impact and waste.
indicators.measurement: Verify packaging material composition through manufacturer declarations and product labels; confirm recyclability or compostability via recognized certification marks or compliance with ISO 14001 and ANVISA regulations.
indicators.target: Packaging must be fully recyclable or compostable according to recognized standards.

indicators.name: Plastic-Free Packaging
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the product packaging contains no plastic materials, ensuring it is entirely free from plastic components to minimize environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Verify packaging materials through supplier documentation, material composition analysis, and visual inspection to confirm absence of any plastic; cross-check with manufacturer declarations and packaging labels.
indicators.target: 100% of packaging materials contain no plastic components.

indicators.name: Bulk Packaging Options
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether menstrual and baby product packaging offers bulk purchase options to reduce packaging waste and environmental impact. This assesses the availability and promotion of bulk packaging formats.
indicators.measurement: Verify product listings and packaging information for bulk purchase options; review manufacturer declarations and product labels indicating bulk packaging; assess compliance with ANVISA regulations on packaging; conduct supplier audits to confirm bulk packaging availability.
indicators.target: Products should offer bulk packaging options that minimize packaging material per unit and comply with ANVISA packaging regulations.

indicators.name: Biodegradability
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether disposable menstrual and baby products are biodegradable, ensuring they break down naturally after disposal without harming the environment.
indicators.measurement: Verify product composition through manufacturer declarations and laboratory biodegradability tests; check for compliance with ANVISA regulations and relevant ISO 14001 environmental management standards.
indicators.target: Disposable products must be fully biodegradable under standard composting conditions within a defined timeframe as per recognized biodegradability standards.

indicators.name: Compostability
indicators.description: Evaluation of the product's ability to be composted at end of life, ensuring it breaks down into non-toxic, organic matter without harming the environment.
indicators.measurement: Verify compostability through certified compostability tests and documentation, including compliance with ANVISA regulations and ISO 14001 environmental management standards; review product labels and manufacturer declarations confirming compostable materials.
indicators.target: Product must be fully compostable under industrial or home composting conditions without leaving toxic residues.

indicators.name: Recyclable Components
indicators.description: Evaluation of the proportion and identification of product components that are recyclable at the end of their life cycle, ensuring materials can be diverted from landfill and processed through recycling streams.
indicators.measurement: Verify material composition through manufacturer declarations and product labels; conduct material recyclability assessment based on local recycling capabilities; cross-check compliance with ANVISA regulations and ISO 14001 environmental management standards.
indicators.target: All product components should be recyclable or compostable where possible, aiming for at least 90% of materials by weight to be recyclable under Brazilian recycling infrastructure.

indicators.name: Disposal Instructions
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the product includes clear and proper disposal instructions to ensure environmentally responsible end-of-life management.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence and clarity of disposal instructions on product packaging or accompanying documentation through product label review and manufacturer declarations; check compliance with ANVISA regulations and ISO 14001 guidelines.
indicators.target: Product must provide clear, accessible, and compliant disposal instructions that align with ANVISA regulations and ISO 14001 standards.

indicators.name: Organic Non-GMO Seeds
indicators.description: Evaluation of the use of organic seeds that are non-GMO and heirloom varieties in urban agriculture practices to ensure sustainability and biodiversity.
indicators.measurement: Verify seed sourcing documentation including certificates of organic status and non-GMO verification; inspect product labels and supplier declarations; conduct random genetic testing if necessary to confirm non-GMO status.
indicators.target: 100% of seeds used must be certified organic, non-GMO, and heirloom varieties.

indicators.name: No Synthetic Pesticides
indicators.description: Evaluation of the absence of synthetic pesticide use in urban agriculture products to ensure organic and sustainable cultivation practices.
indicators.measurement: Verification through product labels, certification documents, and manufacturer declarations confirming no synthetic pesticides were applied; laboratory residue analysis may be conducted to detect synthetic pesticide traces.
indicators.target: 0% use of synthetic pesticides in cultivation

indicators.name: Natural Fertilizer Use
indicators.description: Evaluation of the use of natural fertilizers in urban agriculture practices, focusing on the replacement of synthetic inputs with organic and biodynamic nutrient sources to enhance soil health and sustainability.
indicators.measurement: Verify fertilizer inputs through product labels, supplier declarations, and on-site inspections to confirm the exclusive use of natural fertilizers such as compost, manure, green manure, and approved organic amendments; cross-check with certification compliance reports.
indicators.target: 100% of fertilizers used must be natural and comply with organic or biodynamic standards.

indicators.name: Composting Support
indicators.description: Evaluation of the implementation and support of composting practices within urban agriculture or garden settings to enhance soil fertility and reduce organic waste.
indicators.measurement: Verification through on-site inspection of composting facilities or practices, review of waste management records, and assessment of compost quality; interviews with producers regarding composting methods used.
indicators.target: Active and consistent use of composting practices that comply with EMBRAPA and Agroecology principles, ensuring at least 80% of organic waste is composted or recycled on-site or locally.

indicators.name: Biodiversity Promotion
indicators.description: Evaluation of practices that enhance and maintain biodiversity within urban agriculture systems, including use of diverse plant species, habitat creation, and avoidance of synthetic inputs.
indicators.measurement: Assessment through field surveys documenting species diversity, verification of crop rotation and polyculture practices, review of input usage records to confirm absence of synthetic chemicals, and inspection of habitat features such as native plant buffers or pollinator-friendly zones.
indicators.target: Implementation of diversified cropping systems with at least 3 different plant species per plot, maintenance of natural habitats or buffer zones covering minimum 10% of the area, and zero use of synthetic pesticides or fertilizers.

indicators.name: Native Brazilian Seeds
indicators.description: Evaluation of the use of native Brazilian seeds in urban agriculture to promote biodiversity and adherence to organic and agroecological principles.
indicators.measurement: Verification through seed origin documentation, supplier declarations, and certification labels confirming native Brazilian seed use; field inspections to confirm seed variety; and cross-referencing with EMBRAPA native seed databases.
indicators.target: 100% use of native Brazilian seeds in the production process.

indicators.name: Biodegradable Pots
indicators.description: Evaluation of the use of pots made from materials that decompose naturally without harming the environment, supporting sustainable urban agriculture practices.
indicators.measurement: Verify the pot material composition through product labels and manufacturer declarations; conduct biodegradability tests according to EMBRAPA standards or equivalent; confirm certification compliance with Organic, IBD (Brazil), Demeter, or SisOrg.
indicators.target: 100% of pots used are biodegradable and certified by recognized sustainability standards.

indicators.name: Recycled Tool Materials
indicators.description: Evaluation of the proportion and use of recycled materials in the manufacturing of gardening and urban agriculture tools to reduce environmental impact and promote circular economy practices.
indicators.measurement: Verify the percentage of recycled content through manufacturer declarations, product labels indicating recycled material use, and certification documentation. Conduct material composition analysis if necessary to confirm recycled content claims.
indicators.target: Tools should contain at least 50% recycled materials by weight to meet sustainability criteria.

indicators.name: Sustainable Wood Certification
indicators.description: Evaluation of the use of sustainably sourced wood materials certified by recognized standards to ensure responsible forest management and environmental protection.
indicators.measurement: Verify wood sourcing through certification labels such as FSC on product packaging or supplier documentation; conduct supplier audits and review procurement records to confirm compliance with sustainable forestry practices.
indicators.target: 100% of wood materials used must be certified sustainable wood, specifically FSC certified.

indicators.name: Natural Fiber Content
indicators.description: Evaluation of the use of natural fibers in product materials, ensuring they are derived from renewable, biodegradable sources to support sustainable urban agriculture practices.
indicators.measurement: Verify fiber composition through product labels, manufacturer declarations, and laboratory fiber analysis; confirm certification compliance with Organic, Demeter, IBD, SisOrg, or Non-GMO standards indicating natural fiber sourcing.
indicators.target: 100% of fibers used in the product are natural, renewable, and biodegradable.

indicators.name: Plastic-Free Materials
indicators.description: Evaluation of the use of materials in urban agriculture products to ensure they are free from plastic components, promoting sustainability and reducing plastic pollution.
indicators.measurement: Verify product composition through material analysis, review manufacturer declarations, and check for absence of plastic in packaging and components using visual inspection and laboratory testing if necessary.
indicators.target: 100% of materials used are free from plastic content.

indicators.name: Drip Irrigation Use
indicators.description: Evaluation of the implementation and effectiveness of drip irrigation systems to optimize water use in urban agriculture settings, reducing water waste and improving irrigation efficiency.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of drip irrigation systems through site inspection; measure water consumption before and after installation using water meters; assess irrigation scheduling and maintenance records to ensure system efficiency.
indicators.target: 100% of irrigation conducted via drip systems with documented water savings of at least 30% compared to traditional irrigation methods.

indicators.name: Water-saving techniques
indicators.description: Evaluation of the implementation and effectiveness of water-saving techniques in urban agriculture to reduce water consumption and improve irrigation efficiency.
indicators.measurement: Verify the use of water-efficient irrigation systems (e.g., drip irrigation, rainwater harvesting), assess irrigation scheduling records, and inspect adherence to EMBRAPA and Permaculture water management guidelines.
indicators.target: Implementation of at least one recognized water-saving technique that reduces water use by a minimum of 20% compared to conventional irrigation methods.

indicators.name: Rainwater Harvesting Compatibility
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the product or system is designed to be compatible with rainwater harvesting techniques, enabling efficient collection and use of rainwater for urban agriculture.
indicators.measurement: Verify product specifications and installation guidelines for features supporting rainwater collection, such as integration with rainwater tanks, gutters, or filtration systems; conduct on-site inspection to confirm compatibility.
indicators.target: Product/system must support integration with rainwater harvesting infrastructure without requiring major modifications.

indicators.name: Drought-Resistant Plants
indicators.description: Evaluation of the use of plant species that require minimal water and are adapted to drought conditions to improve water efficiency in urban agriculture.
indicators.measurement: Verify plant species through botanical identification and cross-reference with EMBRAPA drought-resistant species lists; assess water consumption records; confirm cultivation practices align with Agroecology and Permaculture principles.
indicators.target: Use of plant species classified as drought-resistant according to EMBRAPA guidelines, ensuring at least 80% of plants in the garden are drought-tolerant.

indicators.name: Mulching Material Use
indicators.description: Evaluation of the use of mulching materials to improve water retention and reduce evaporation in urban agriculture settings. This indicator assesses the type, quality, and application rate of mulching materials used.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence and type of mulching materials through site inspection and product labels; measure coverage percentage of soil surface by mulch; confirm material origin and certification via supplier documentation and certification labels.
indicators.target: Achieve at least 70% soil surface coverage with certified organic or biodynamic mulching materials that comply with EMBRAPA and Agroecology principles to maximize water retention and efficiency.

indicators.name: Clear Instructions
indicators.description: Evaluates the presence and clarity of instructions provided for the use, maintenance, and benefits of the garden or urban agriculture product to ensure user understanding and proper application.
indicators.measurement: Review product packaging and accompanying materials for step-by-step instructions; conduct user comprehension surveys; verify inclusion of instructions aligned with EMBRAPA guidelines and Agroecology principles.
indicators.target: Instructions must be clear, complete, and easy to understand, covering all essential steps for use and maintenance without ambiguity.

indicators.name: Educational Resources Availability
indicators.description: Evaluation of the availability and quality of educational resources provided to support sustainable urban agriculture practices, including training materials, workshops, and informational content aligned with agroecology and permaculture principles.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence and accessibility of educational materials such as manuals, workshops, and training sessions; assess alignment with EMBRAPA guidelines, agroecology principles, and permaculture standards through document review and stakeholder interviews.
indicators.target: Provision of comprehensive educational resources covering at least 3 key sustainable agriculture topics, with evidence of regular updates and accessibility to all stakeholders.

indicators.name: Community Support
indicators.description: Evaluation of the extent to which the product or practice promotes community engagement and support through educational initiatives related to sustainable urban agriculture.
indicators.measurement: Assess presence and scope of community education programs, workshops, or collaborations; verify documentation of community involvement; review participation rates and feedback from local stakeholders.
indicators.target: Active implementation of at least one community education or support program annually, with measurable participation and positive community feedback.

indicators.name: Permaculture Principles
indicators.description: Evaluation of the integration and application of permaculture principles in urban agriculture education programs, focusing on sustainable land use, resource efficiency, and ecological design.
indicators.measurement: Review of educational curricula and training materials for inclusion of permaculture principles; verification through participant surveys and practical demonstrations; assessment of alignment with EMBRAPA and Agroecology principles.
indicators.target: Educational programs must comprehensively cover core permaculture principles and demonstrate practical application in at least 80% of training activities.

indicators.name: Agroecology Focus
indicators.description: Evaluates the extent to which educational content and practices emphasize agroecology principles, promoting sustainable and ecological farming methods in urban agriculture.
indicators.measurement: Review of educational curricula, training materials, and workshops for inclusion of EMBRAPA agroecology principles, permaculture techniques, and biodynamic practices; verification through participant feedback and certification of trainers.
indicators.target: Educational programs must integrate core agroecology principles as defined by EMBRAPA and permaculture standards, with at least 80% of content dedicated to sustainable agroecological practices.

indicators.name: Climate-Appropriate Plants
indicators.description: Evaluation of the use of plant species that are well adapted to the local climate conditions to ensure resilience, productivity, and sustainability in urban agriculture settings.
indicators.measurement: Verify plant species lists against EMBRAPA climate adaptation guidelines and permaculture design principles; check for documentation or declarations from producers confirming local climate suitability; assess presence of certifications such as Organic, Demeter, or IBD that support climate-appropriate cultivation.
indicators.target: 100% of plants used should be proven to be adapted to the local climate according to EMBRAPA and permaculture standards.

indicators.name: Native Species Use
indicators.description: Evaluation of the use of native plant species adapted to local environmental conditions in urban agriculture to enhance ecological balance and sustainability.
indicators.measurement: Verify the proportion of native species used through botanical identification and species inventory compared against regional native species lists from EMBRAPA; review supplier declarations and certification documents confirming native species sourcing.
indicators.target: 100% of plant species used are native or locally adapted to the Brazilian region of cultivation.

indicators.name: Regional Adaptation
indicators.description: Evaluation of the product's suitability and adaptation to local regional conditions, ensuring it aligns with local agroecological practices and environmental factors.
indicators.measurement: Verify product compliance through certification checks (Organic, Demeter, IBD, SisOrg), review adherence to EMBRAPA regional guidelines, and assess alignment with Agroecology principles and Permaculture design in production methods.
indicators.target: Product must demonstrate adaptation to local regional conditions by meeting at least one recognized certification and conforming to EMBRAPA regional standards and agroecological principles.

indicators.name: Tropical Climate Suitability
indicators.description: Evaluation of the product's adaptability and performance specifically under tropical climate conditions, ensuring it supports sustainable urban agriculture in such environments.
indicators.measurement: Assess product compliance with tropical climate requirements through field trials in tropical regions, review of agronomic performance data, and verification of adherence to EMBRAPA tropical crop guidelines and permaculture principles.
indicators.target: Product demonstrates optimal growth and yield under tropical climate conditions with minimal external inputs, aligning with EMBRAPA and agroecology standards.

indicators.name: Multiple Use Durability
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the product is designed and tested to withstand more than 1000 uses without significant degradation in performance or safety.
indicators.measurement: Verify product durability through manufacturer testing reports, lifecycle assessments, and user manuals indicating minimum use cycles; conduct physical stress tests simulating repeated use; review product labels and declarations for use-life claims.
indicators.target: > 1000 uses

indicators.name: Durable Construction
indicators.description: Evaluates the product's build quality to ensure it withstands repeated use without significant degradation or failure, supporting long-term reuse and waste reduction.
indicators.measurement: Assess material strength and integrity through standardized durability tests such as impact resistance, tensile strength, and wear tests; verify manufacturer durability claims and inspect for robust assembly and quality of components.
indicators.target: Product must maintain structural integrity and functionality after a minimum of 100 reuse cycles without significant damage or performance loss.

indicators.name: Ease of Cleaning
indicators.description: Evaluates how easily the product can be cleaned to ensure it can be reused effectively without retaining residues or contaminants.
indicators.measurement: Assess cleaning procedures by testing residue removal after standard washing methods; verify compatibility with common cleaning agents and dishwasher safety where applicable.
indicators.target: Product must be fully cleanable with standard household cleaning methods without retaining residues or odors.

indicators.name: Dishwasher Safe
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the product can withstand dishwasher cleaning without degradation, ensuring durability and ease of reuse. This assessment confirms the product's suitability for repeated use in a dishwasher environment.
indicators.measurement: Verify product labeling or manufacturer declarations indicating dishwasher safety. Conduct standardized dishwasher tests simulating typical washing cycles to assess physical and chemical stability post-wash.
indicators.target: Product must be explicitly labeled as dishwasher safe and maintain integrity after at least 50 dishwasher cycles.

indicators.name: Long Lifespan
indicators.description: Evaluates the product's ability to maintain functionality and integrity for a period exceeding five years under normal usage conditions.
indicators.measurement: Verify product lifespan through manufacturer durability testing reports, user manuals specifying expected lifespan, and third-party laboratory assessments simulating long-term use.
indicators.target: Product lifespan greater than 5 years

indicators.name: Food-Safe Materials
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the materials used in the product are safe for direct food contact, ensuring they do not release harmful substances that could contaminate food.
indicators.measurement: Verify product certifications such as FDA Approved, LFGB, BPA-Free, and FSC for bamboo products; review manufacturer declarations; conduct chemical migration tests according to ISO 14001 standards.
indicators.target: Materials must be certified food-safe by at least one recognized certification (FDA Approved, LFGB, BPA-Free, or FSC for bamboo) to ensure zero harmful chemical migration.

indicators.name: BPA-Free Materials
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the product materials are free from Bisphenol A (BPA), a chemical commonly used in plastics that can have harmful health effects. Ensuring BPA-free materials reduces potential toxicity and supports safer reusable products.
indicators.measurement: Verify product labeling and manufacturer declarations for BPA-free claims; confirm through certifications such as BPA-Free certification; conduct chemical analysis if necessary to detect presence of BPA compounds.
indicators.target: Product materials must be certified BPA-free, with zero detectable BPA content as per applicable testing standards.

indicators.name: Non-toxic Materials
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the product materials are free from toxic substances that could harm human health or the environment during use and disposal.
indicators.measurement: Verify product certifications such as FDA Approved, LFGB, BPA-Free, and FSC for bamboo products; review manufacturer declarations for compliance with non-toxic material standards; conduct chemical analysis if necessary to detect harmful substances.
indicators.target: Materials must be certified non-toxic by recognized certifications or demonstrate absence of harmful chemicals according to Zero Waste International Alliance and ISO 14001 standards.

indicators.name: Sustainable Materials
indicators.description: Evaluation of the use of sustainable materials such as bamboo, stainless steel, and glass in reusable zero waste products to ensure environmental friendliness and durability.
indicators.measurement: Verify the material composition through product specifications and manufacturer declarations; confirm certifications such as FSC for bamboo products, FDA Approved, LFGB, and BPA-Free labels; and cross-check compliance with ISO 14001 environmental management standards.
