indicators.target: Products must be made primarily from bamboo, stainless steel, or glass, with bamboo products certified by FSC; all materials should comply with FDA Approved, LFGB, or BPA-Free standards where applicable.

indicators.name: Recycled Content
indicators.description: Evaluates the proportion of recycled materials used in the product's composition to reduce waste and environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Verify recycled content percentage through manufacturer declarations, product labels, and third-party certification reports; conduct material analysis if necessary.
indicators.target: Product should contain at least 30% recycled content by weight.

indicators.name: biodegradability
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the product materials are biodegradable at the end of their life cycle, ensuring they break down naturally without harming the environment.
indicators.measurement: Verify biodegradability through certification labels, manufacturer declarations, and compliance with recognized biodegradability standards such as ISO 14001; conduct laboratory compostability tests if necessary.
indicators.target: Materials must be fully biodegradable at end of life, complying with recognized biodegradability standards.

indicators.name: Practical Design
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the product's design supports ease of use, durability, and suitability for repeated use to minimize waste generation.
indicators.measurement: Assess product design features such as ergonomic usability, durability tests, and user feedback on functionality; verify presence of certifications indicating material safety and sustainability.
indicators.target: Product design must ensure ease of use and durability to support long-term reuse, minimizing waste generation.

indicators.name: Portability
indicators.description: Evaluates the ease with which the product can be transported and used on-the-go, ensuring it supports a zero waste lifestyle by being convenient to carry and use in various settings.
indicators.measurement: Assess product dimensions, weight, and design features such as foldability or compactness; verify user manuals or manufacturer specifications indicating portability; conduct user testing for ease of transport and handling.
indicators.target: Product should be lightweight (under 500g) and compact enough to fit into standard bags or backpacks without compromising usability.

indicators.name: Leak-proof Performance
indicators.description: Evaluates the product's ability to prevent liquid leakage under normal usage conditions, ensuring no spills or drips occur during handling or transport.
indicators.measurement: Conduct standardized leak tests by filling the product with liquid and subjecting it to movement and inversion for a specified duration; inspect for any signs of leakage or seepage.
indicators.target: Zero leakage under normal usage conditions during a 30-minute inversion and movement test.

indicators.name: Temperature Retention
indicators.description: Evaluates the ability of reusable bottles to maintain the temperature of their contents over a specified period, ensuring functionality for hot or cold beverages.
indicators.measurement: Measure temperature change of liquid inside the bottle over a 6-hour period using a calibrated thermometer under controlled ambient conditions; verify insulation performance through standardized thermal retention tests.
indicators.target: Maintain beverage temperature within ±5°C of initial temperature after 6 hours.

indicators.name: Versatile Use
indicators.description: Evaluates the product's ability to serve multiple functions or applications, reducing the need for multiple single-use items and supporting zero waste principles.
indicators.measurement: Assess product specifications and manufacturer declarations for multiple use cases; verify through user manuals or product testing that the item can perform at least two distinct functions effectively.
indicators.target: Product should demonstrate at least two distinct, practical uses to minimize waste generation.

indicators.name: Minimal Packaging
indicators.description: Evaluates the extent to which product packaging is minimized to reduce waste and environmental impact, focusing on using only essential materials.
indicators.measurement: Assess packaging weight and volume relative to product size; verify absence of excess layers or non-recyclable materials through physical inspection and manufacturer documentation.
indicators.target: Packaging must use the least amount of material necessary to protect the product, avoiding any superfluous layers or components.

indicators.name: Plastic-Free Packaging
indicators.description: Evaluation of packaging materials to ensure they contain no plastic components, promoting sustainability and waste reduction.
indicators.measurement: Verify packaging material composition through supplier documentation, material safety data sheets, and physical inspection to confirm absence of plastics; cross-check with certifications and product labels.
indicators.target: Packaging must be completely free of plastic materials.

indicators.name: Recyclable Packaging
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the product packaging is made from materials that can be recycled according to recognized standards, reducing waste and supporting circular economy principles.
indicators.measurement: Verify packaging material composition through manufacturer declarations and product labels; confirm recyclability by cross-referencing with local recycling guidelines and certifications such as FSC for bamboo products; conduct material testing if necessary.
indicators.target: Packaging must be fully recyclable according to Zero Waste International Alliance criteria and comply with ISO 14001 environmental management standards.

indicators.name: Reusable Packaging
indicators.description: Evaluation of packaging designed for multiple uses to minimize waste generation and environmental impact. This includes assessing materials and design that support reuse and durability.
indicators.measurement: Verify packaging materials and design through product testing for durability and reusability; review manufacturer declarations on reuse cycles; check for compliance with Zero Waste International Alliance guidelines and ISO 14001 environmental management standards.
indicators.target: Packaging must be designed for repeated use without significant degradation, meeting or exceeding Zero Waste International Alliance criteria for reusable packaging.

indicators.name: Recyclability
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the product is designed to be recyclable at the end of its life cycle, ensuring it can be processed and reused in manufacturing to minimize waste.
indicators.measurement: Verify product material composition and recyclability through manufacturer declarations, check for recycling symbols on product labels, and confirm compliance with recycling standards via certifications or third-party testing.
indicators.target: Product must be fully recyclable according to recognized recycling standards to support zero waste objectives.

indicators.name: Biodegradable Components
indicators.description: Evaluation of the presence and proportion of biodegradable components in the product to ensure it can decompose naturally at the end of its life cycle.
indicators.measurement: Verify product composition through manufacturer declarations and material safety data sheets; conduct biodegradability tests according to ISO 14855 or equivalent standards; check for certifications indicating biodegradability.
indicators.target: Product must contain at least 90% biodegradable components that comply with recognized biodegradability standards.

indicators.name: Take-back Programs
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the product manufacturer or retailer offers a take-back program to ensure responsible end-of-life management and recycling or reuse of the product.
indicators.measurement: Verify the existence of documented take-back programs through manufacturer declarations, program participation records, and consumer access information; confirm program compliance with Zero Waste International Alliance guidelines and ISO 14001 standards.
indicators.target: Product must be part of an active take-back program that facilitates 100% collection of returned items for recycling or reuse.

indicators.name: Repair Services Availability
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the product offers accessible repair services to extend its lifespan and reduce waste at end of life. This includes availability of repair instructions, spare parts, and authorized repair centers.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence of official repair services through manufacturer declarations, availability of spare parts for at least 5 years, repair manuals or guides, and authorized repair centers listed on the product website or documentation.
indicators.target: Product must provide accessible repair services including spare parts availability for a minimum of 5 years after purchase and clear repair instructions.

indicators.name: Product Utilization Rate
indicators.description: Evaluates the extent to which the product is used to its maximum capacity, minimizing idle time and increasing overall utilization efficiency within sharing economy services.
indicators.measurement: Calculate the ratio of actual product usage time to total available time using usage logs or platform data analytics; verify through user activity records and maintenance schedules to ensure continuous availability and minimal downtime.
indicators.target: Achieve a product utilization rate of at least 80%, indicating maximized use and reduced resource waste.

indicators.name: Production Reduction
indicators.description: Evaluates the extent to which the service reduces the need for new product manufacturing by promoting reuse, sharing, or extending product life cycles.
indicators.measurement: Assess the percentage reduction in new product purchases attributable to the service through user surveys, transaction data analysis, and lifecycle assessment comparing shared versus new product usage.
indicators.target: Achieve a measurable reduction in new product production demand directly linked to the service's operations, ideally exceeding 20% decrease in new production needs.
data_sources: Ellen MacArthur Foundation Circular Economy Principles
Manufacturer Declarations and Product Lifecycle Data

indicators.name: Product Lifespan Extension
indicators.description: Evaluates the extent to which the product's design and service model contribute to extending its usable lifespan, reducing the need for frequent replacements and minimizing resource consumption.
indicators.measurement: Assess product durability through manufacturer specifications and warranty periods; verify maintenance and repair services availability; analyze usage data to confirm lifespan extension; review company policies promoting reuse and refurbishment.
indicators.target: Product lifespan extended by at least 30% compared to average market alternatives or demonstrable implementation of refurbishment and reuse programs.

indicators.name: Efficient Logistics
indicators.description: Evaluation of the logistics processes to ensure minimal resource consumption and optimized transportation routes, reducing environmental impact and operational costs in sharing economy services.
indicators.measurement: Assess logistics efficiency through analysis of route optimization software usage, fuel consumption records, delivery time metrics, and carbon footprint calculations. Verify implementation of sustainable transport modes and load consolidation practices.
indicators.target: Achieve at least 20% reduction in fuel consumption or carbon emissions per delivery compared to baseline measurements, with optimized routes and consolidated loads.
data_sources: Ellen MacArthur Foundation guidelines on Circular Economy principles

indicators.name: Asset Sharing Optimization
indicators.description: Evaluates the efficiency of asset utilization within sharing economy services by assessing how well assets are shared to minimize idle time and maximize usage rates.
indicators.measurement: Measure asset utilization rates through usage logs and platform data analytics to determine percentage of active use versus idle time; verify implementation of optimization strategies aligned with Circular Economy principles and assess compliance with relevant certifications.
indicators.target: Achieve asset utilization rates above 75%, minimizing idle time to less than 25% to optimize resource efficiency.
data_sources: Ellen MacArthur Foundation Circular Economy guidelines
Platform usage analytics and manufacturer declarations

indicators.name: Affordable Pricing
indicators.description: Evaluation of the service's pricing structure to ensure it is affordable and accessible to a broad range of users, minimizing economic barriers to participation in the sharing economy.
indicators.measurement: Analyze pricing models and compare service fees against average local income levels and competitor pricing; verify presence of tiered pricing or subsidies for low-income users; review customer feedback on affordability.
indicators.target: Service pricing should be set at or below 10% of the average monthly disposable income of the target user base in Brazil, with provisions for discounted rates or subsidies for low-income groups.
data_sources: Manufacturer or service provider pricing declarations

indicators.name: Easy Access
indicators.description: Evaluates the ease with which users can access the sharing economy service, including availability, user interface simplicity, and geographic coverage within the Brazilian market.
indicators.measurement: Assess user accessibility through metrics such as service availability hours, number of access points or locations, user interface usability tests, and coverage mapping in Brazil. Verification can include user surveys, platform analytics, and geographic information system (GIS) analysis.
indicators.target: Service should be accessible to at least 90% of the target user base within major Brazilian urban areas, with intuitive user interfaces requiring no more than three steps to access the service.
data_sources: Manufacturer or service provider accessibility reports

indicators.name: User-friendly Platform
indicators.description: Evaluates the ease of use and intuitive design of the platform interface to ensure accessibility for a broad range of users, including those with limited technical skills.
indicators.measurement: Assess platform usability through user testing sessions, accessibility audits (e.g., WCAG compliance), and user satisfaction surveys focusing on navigation, clarity, and responsiveness.
indicators.target: Platform achieves at least 90% positive user feedback on ease of use and meets WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility standards.
data_sources: Ellen MacArthur Foundation guidelines on circular economy design

indicators.name: Wide Availability
indicators.description: Evaluates the extent to which the sharing economy service is accessible across diverse geographic locations and user groups, ensuring broad reach and inclusivity.
indicators.measurement: Assess the number and distribution of service access points or users across different regions, analyze platform accessibility features, and review user demographic data to confirm wide availability.
indicators.target: Service availability in at least 80% of targeted urban and peri-urban areas within Brazil, with accessibility features supporting diverse user needs.
data_sources: Ellen MacArthur Foundation guidelines on Circular Economy principles

indicators.name: Inclusive Service
indicators.description: Evaluates the extent to which the sharing economy service is designed and implemented to be accessible and inclusive to diverse user groups, including people with disabilities and marginalized communities.
indicators.measurement: Assess accessibility features through user accessibility audits, review of service design documentation, and feedback surveys from diverse user groups; verify compliance with inclusive design principles and accessibility standards.
indicators.target: Service must demonstrate inclusive accessibility features that accommodate at least 90% of identified user needs across diverse groups.

indicators.name: Regular Maintenance
indicators.description: Evaluation of the implementation and frequency of scheduled maintenance activities to ensure the quality and safety of sharing economy service products.
indicators.measurement: Verify maintenance logs and schedules, inspect service records for adherence to maintenance intervals, and confirm use of standardized procedures through audits and customer feedback analysis.
indicators.target: Maintenance activities performed at regular, predefined intervals as per manufacturer recommendations or industry best practices, with no lapses exceeding 10% of scheduled maintenance events annually.
data_sources: Ellen MacArthur Foundation Circular Economy principles guidelines

indicators.name: Quality Assurance
indicators.description: Evaluation of the processes and systems implemented to ensure consistent product or service quality in sharing economy platforms, focusing on adherence to recognized quality and sustainability standards.
indicators.measurement: Verification through audit reports, certification status checks, and review of quality management protocols aligned with Circular Economy principles; assessment of compliance with standards such as ISO 14001 and B Corp requirements.
indicators.target: Full compliance with at least one recognized certification (B Corp, ISO 14001, or Circular Economy certification) demonstrating effective quality assurance aligned with Circular Economy principles.
data_sources: Manufacturer or service provider quality assurance documentation

indicators.name: Professional Repairs
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the service ensures repairs are conducted by qualified professionals to maintain product quality and safety standards.
indicators.measurement: Verify repair records and certifications of technicians; audit repair procedures for compliance with professional standards; check for documented use of authorized parts and tools.
indicators.target: 100% of repairs performed by certified professionals following standardized procedures.

indicators.name: Certified Technicians
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether maintenance and repair services are performed by technicians holding recognized certifications to ensure quality and adherence to sustainability principles.
indicators.measurement: Verify technician certifications through documentation review, audit of maintenance records, and confirmation of compliance with recognized standards during service delivery.
indicators.target: 100% of maintenance technicians certified by recognized sustainability or quality standards.
data_sources: Manufacturer or Service Provider Technician Records

indicators.name: Repair Warranty
indicators.description: Evaluation of the presence and terms of a warranty covering repairs offered by the sharing economy service to ensure product reliability and customer protection.
indicators.measurement: Verify warranty documentation specifying coverage duration and conditions for repairs; check service contracts and customer feedback on warranty fulfillment; confirm compliance with warranty terms through service records.
indicators.target: Warranty coverage for repairs must be clearly stated and valid for a minimum period of 12 months from the date of service or product use.
data_sources: Manufacturer or service provider warranty declarations

indicators.name: Clear Terms and Conditions
indicators.description: Evaluation of the clarity, accessibility, and comprehensiveness of the service's terms and conditions provided to users, ensuring all key information is transparent and understandable.
indicators.measurement: Review the published terms and conditions document for completeness and clarity; conduct user surveys to assess understanding; verify availability in Portuguese and accessibility on digital platforms.
indicators.target: 100% of terms and conditions must be clearly stated, accessible, and written in clear Portuguese language without ambiguous clauses.

indicators.name: Transparent Pricing
indicators.description: Evaluation of the clarity and accessibility of pricing information provided to users, ensuring all costs are disclosed upfront without hidden fees.
indicators.measurement: Review of pricing information on service platforms for completeness and clarity; verification through user feedback surveys and audits of billing statements to confirm absence of undisclosed charges.
indicators.target: 100% of pricing information is clearly disclosed and accessible before transaction completion, with no hidden fees.

indicators.name: Product History Disclosure
indicators.description: Evaluation of the extent to which the full history of a product, including previous ownership, usage, and maintenance records, is transparently disclosed to users within sharing economy services.
indicators.measurement: Verify the availability and accessibility of detailed product history information through digital platforms or documentation, including ownership logs, maintenance records, and usage data; conduct audits or user surveys to confirm transparency practices.
indicators.target: Complete and accessible disclosure of product history for 100% of products listed in the sharing economy service.

indicators.name: Sustainability Reporting
indicators.description: Evaluation of the service provider's transparency in disclosing sustainability impacts, including environmental, social, and economic effects, through regular and comprehensive reporting.
indicators.measurement: Verify the availability and frequency of published sustainability impact reports, check alignment with Circular Economy principles and Ellen MacArthur Foundation guidelines, and confirm certification status such as B Corp, ISO 14001, or Circular Economy certification.
indicators.target: Service providers should publish at least annual sustainability impact reports that comprehensively cover environmental, social, and economic impacts, aligned with Circular Economy principles.

indicators.name: carbon footprint reduction
indicators.description: Evaluation of the service's effectiveness in reducing its carbon footprint by minimizing greenhouse gas emissions associated with its operations and supply chain.
indicators.measurement: Quantify greenhouse gas emissions using recognized carbon accounting methods (e.g., GHG Protocol), assess lifecycle emissions, and verify reductions through third-party audits or carbon footprint reports.
indicators.target: Achieve measurable year-over-year reduction in carbon emissions, ideally aligned with science-based targets or net-zero commitments.
data_sources: Manufacturer or service provider carbon footprint declarations

indicators.name: Waste Reduction
indicators.description: Evaluation of the service's effectiveness in minimizing waste generation through resource optimization, reuse, and recycling practices aligned with circular economy principles.
indicators.measurement: Assess waste management policies, track volume of waste generated versus reduced, verify implementation of reuse and recycling programs, and review adherence to circular economy frameworks through audits and reporting.
indicators.target: Achieve measurable reduction in waste generation year-over-year, with at least 50% of materials reused or recycled in operations.
data_sources: Manufacturer Declarations on Material Reuse and Recycling

indicators.name: Circular Economy Integration
indicators.description: Evaluates the extent to which the service integrates circular economy principles by minimizing waste, promoting reuse, and extending product life cycles in line with recognized frameworks.
indicators.measurement: Assess the presence of circular economy strategies through documentation review, lifecycle analysis, and verification of certifications such as Circular Economy certification or ISO 14001; conduct audits to confirm implementation of reuse, recycling, and resource efficiency practices.
indicators.target: Full integration of circular economy principles as defined by the Ellen MacArthur Foundation, demonstrated by obtaining Circular Economy certification or equivalent standards.

indicators.name: Green Logistics
indicators.description: Evaluation of the implementation of environmentally sustainable logistics practices that minimize carbon emissions and resource use in the sharing economy service operations.
indicators.measurement: Assess the adoption of green logistics strategies through verification of carbon footprint reports, use of low-emission transport modes, route optimization tools, and waste reduction practices in logistics processes.
indicators.target: Achieve certification or compliance with recognized environmental management standards and demonstrate measurable reductions in logistics-related carbon emissions year-over-year.

indicators.name: Low-Carbon Production
indicators.description: Evaluation of the use of low-carbon production methods in basic metals manufacturing, specifically the adoption of green hydrogen and electric arc furnace technologies to reduce carbon emissions.
indicators.measurement: Verify production process documentation and energy source data to confirm the use of green hydrogen or electric arc furnace methods; conduct audits or review third-party verification reports quantifying carbon emissions reductions.
indicators.target: Use of green hydrogen or electric arc furnace technology for primary metal production resulting in significantly reduced carbon emissions compared to conventional methods.

indicators.name: Emissions Transparency
indicators.description: Evaluation of the transparency and completeness of reported greenhouse gas emissions across Scope 1 (direct), Scope 2 (indirect from purchased energy), and Scope 3 (other indirect) emissions associated with the product lifecycle.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence and completeness of emissions data through third-party verified reports, emissions inventories, or disclosures aligned with recognized frameworks such as GRI or EU DPP. Confirm scope coverage and data accuracy via certification audits or manufacturer declarations.
indicators.target: Full disclosure and transparent reporting of Scope 1, 2, and 3 emissions associated with the product, verified by recognized standards or certifications.

indicators.name: Carbon Capture Usage
indicators.description: Evaluation of the implementation and effectiveness of Carbon Capture and Storage (CCS) technologies in reducing the carbon footprint of basic metals production.
indicators.measurement: Verify the presence and operational status of CCS technologies through facility audits, review of emissions data pre- and post-CCS implementation, and validation of carbon capture volumes via third-party reports or monitoring systems.
indicators.target: Full integration of CCS technologies capturing at least 90% of CO2 emissions generated during production processes.

indicators.name: EU CBAM Compliance
indicators.description: Evaluation of the product's compliance with the EU Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM) requirements, ensuring accurate reporting and accounting of embedded carbon emissions in basic metals.
indicators.measurement: Verify documentation and declarations aligned with CBAM reporting protocols, cross-check with EU Digital Product Passport data, and confirm certification status through ResponsibleSteel or Aluminium Stewardship Initiative audits.
indicators.target: Full compliance with EU CBAM regulations, including transparent carbon emission reporting and adjustment payments where applicable.
data_sources: Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM) official reports

indicators.name: Recycled Content Percentage
indicators.description: Evaluates the proportion of recycled material used in the production of basic metals, ensuring that recycled content exceeds 70% to promote resource efficiency and sustainability.
indicators.measurement: Verify the recycled content percentage through material composition analysis, supplier declarations, and certification audits confirming recycled material input in the product.

indicators.name: Scrap Metal Traceability
indicators.description: Evaluation of the ability to trace the origin of scrap metal used in production to ensure responsible sourcing and transparency throughout the supply chain.
indicators.measurement: Verification through documented chain-of-custody records, supplier declarations, and digital tracking systems such as the EU Digital Product Passport; audits confirming compliance with traceability requirements.
indicators.target: 100% traceability of scrap metal sources with verifiable documentation.

indicators.name: Secondary Raw Material Use
indicators.description: Evaluation of the proportion of secondary raw materials incorporated in basic metal products to reduce reliance on virgin resources and enhance circularity.
indicators.measurement: Quantify the percentage of recycled content in raw materials through supplier declarations, material composition analysis, and verification via recognized certifications.
indicators.target: Minimum 30% use of secondary raw materials in the product composition.

indicators.name: Water Consumption Reduction
indicators.description: Evaluation of the reduction in water consumption specifically in cooling and processing operations within basic metals production. This indicator assesses efforts to minimize water use to improve sustainability and reduce environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Quantitative measurement of water volume used in cooling and processing per ton of metal produced, verified through water meter readings, process monitoring reports, and water balance assessments. Comparison against baseline consumption data and implementation of water-saving technologies should be documented.
indicators.target: Achieve a measurable reduction in water consumption compared to baseline levels, aiming for continuous improvement in water use efficiency in cooling and processing stages.

indicators.name: Closed-loop Water Systems
indicators.description: Evaluation of the implementation and effectiveness of closed-loop water systems in basic metals production to minimize freshwater withdrawal and wastewater discharge.
indicators.measurement: Verification through site audits and water balance assessments to confirm water recycling rates, review of operational records for water reuse percentages, and analysis of wastewater discharge quality and volumes.
indicators.target: Achieve ≥90% water recycling within the production process, with zero discharge of untreated wastewater.

indicators.name: Wastewater Discharge Management
indicators.description: Evaluation of the responsible discharge of wastewater from basic metals production processes, ensuring compliance with environmental regulations and minimizing water pollution.
indicators.measurement: Verification through wastewater quality testing reports, compliance audits against local discharge limits, and review of wastewater treatment system certifications and operational records.
indicators.target: Wastewater discharge must meet or exceed local regulatory standards for contaminants, with zero unauthorized releases and documented treatment processes in place.

indicators.name: Ethical Raw Material Sourcing
indicators.description: Evaluation of the sourcing practices for raw materials such as iron ore and bauxite to ensure they comply with ethical standards, minimizing social and environmental harm throughout the supply chain.
indicators.measurement: Verification through supplier audits, chain of custody documentation, and certification compliance checks including ResponsibleSteel and Aluminium Stewardship Initiative certifications; cross-referencing with EU Digital Product Passport data and GRI reporting disclosures.
indicators.target: 100% of raw materials sourced from certified suppliers adhering to recognized ethical sourcing standards.

indicators.name: Fair Labor Practices
indicators.description: Evaluation of adherence to fair labor practices throughout mining and processing operations, including worker rights, safe working conditions, and equitable treatment.
indicators.measurement: Verification through audits of labor policies, worker interviews, compliance reports, and third-party certification assessments focusing on labor standards and health and safety records.
indicators.target: 100% compliance with fair labor standards as defined by recognized certifications and no recorded violations of labor rights in mining and processing stages.
data_sources: Global Reporting Initiative (GRI) Labor Practices Disclosures

indicators.name: Community Engagement
indicators.description: Evaluation of the company's processes for engaging with local communities and conducting impact assessments to understand social and environmental effects of operations.
indicators.measurement: Review documented community engagement plans, impact assessment reports, stakeholder consultation records, and grievance mechanisms; verify third-party audits and certifications related to social governance.
indicators.target: Demonstrated ongoing community engagement with documented impact assessments conducted at least annually, and effective grievance mechanisms in place.

indicators.name: Sustainable Natural Rubber Use
indicators.description: Evaluation of the proportion of natural rubber used in tyres that is certified sustainable according to recognized standards such as FSC or PEFC.
indicators.measurement: Verify certification documents and supply chain declarations confirming that natural rubber used is FSC or PEFC certified; cross-check with product labels and manufacturer sustainability reports.
indicators.target: 100% of natural rubber used in the tyre is FSC or PEFC certified sustainable.

indicators.name: Recycled Content
indicators.description: Evaluation of the proportion of recycled materials, such as carbon black derived from end-of-life tires, incorporated into the tyre composition to reduce virgin material use and environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Verify recycled content percentage through manufacturer declarations, material safety data sheets (MSDS), and third-party laboratory analysis; cross-check with EU Digital Product Passport data and compliance with ELT Directive requirements.
indicators.target: Incorporate a minimum of 10% recycled carbon black or equivalent recycled materials by weight in the tyre composition.

indicators.name: Harmful Substances Absence
indicators.description: Evaluation of the tyre materials to ensure they do not contain harmful substances such as high-aromatic oils, which can pose environmental and health risks.
indicators.measurement: Verify the chemical composition of tyre materials through laboratory analysis for presence of high-aromatic oils; review manufacturer declarations and compliance reports; check for conformity with EU Digital Product Passport (DPP) data and ELT Directive requirements.
indicators.target: Tyres must contain no detectable levels of high-aromatic oils or other harmful substances as defined by the ELT Directive and EU DPP standards.

indicators.name: Bio-based Materials Use
indicators.description: Evaluation of the proportion and presence of bio-based or renewable materials, such as natural rubber, used in tyre manufacturing to enhance sustainability.
indicators.measurement: Verify the percentage of bio-based or renewable content through supplier declarations, certification audits (e.g., FSC/PEFC for natural rubber), and compliance reports aligned with EU Digital Product Passport requirements.
indicators.target: Tyres should contain a minimum of 30% bio-based or renewable materials by weight, verified through certified documentation.

indicators.name: High Mileage Lifespan
indicators.description: Evaluation of tyre durability based on the total mileage achievable before performance degradation or replacement is required, reflecting long lifespan and resistance to wear.
indicators.measurement: Verify through standardized mileage testing protocols, manufacturer durability data, and real-world performance reports; cross-check with EU Tyre Label ratings and compliance with ELT Directive requirements.
indicators.target: Tyres should achieve a minimum mileage threshold consistent with high-performance standards, typically exceeding 40,000 km before significant tread wear.

indicators.name: Low Rolling Resistance
indicators.description: Evaluation of tyre rolling resistance to determine its impact on vehicle fuel efficiency by measuring the energy loss during tyre rotation.
indicators.measurement: Measure rolling resistance coefficient (RRC) using standardized laboratory tests such as ISO 28580 or equivalent methods; verify manufacturer data and test reports; assess compliance with EU Tyre Label rolling resistance class.
indicators.target: Tyres should achieve a rolling resistance class of 'A' or 'B' as per the EU Tyre Label, indicating low rolling resistance to improve fuel efficiency.

indicators.name: Retreadability and Repairability
indicators.description: Evaluation of the tyre's design and features that enable retreading and repair, extending its service life and reducing waste.
indicators.measurement: Verify presence of retreadable casing and repairable components through manufacturer technical documentation and physical inspection; assess compliance with ELT Directive requirements and check for inclusion in EU Digital Product Passport.
indicators.target: Tyres must be designed to allow at least one retreading cycle and support standard repair procedures without compromising safety or performance.

indicators.name: Wet Grip Performance
indicators.description: Evaluation of the tyre's ability to maintain traction and braking efficiency on wet surfaces, directly impacting vehicle safety.
indicators.measurement: Verify wet grip performance through standardized braking distance tests on wet asphalt as per EU Tyre Label protocols and ELT Directive requirements, supported by manufacturer test reports and product labeling.
indicators.target: Achieve a wet grip rating of class 'B' or better according to the EU Tyre Label classification.

indicators.name: Manufacturer Take-Back Scheme
indicators.description: Evaluation of whether the tyre manufacturer implements a take-back scheme for end-of-life tires (ELT) to ensure proper collection and recycling or disposal in compliance with regulations.
indicators.measurement: Verify the existence and operational status of a take-back program through manufacturer documentation, ELT collection records, and compliance reports; confirm alignment with the ELT Directive and EU Digital Product Passport requirements.
indicators.target: Manufacturer operates an active take-back scheme covering 100% of sold tyres at end-of-life, ensuring environmentally sound management in accordance with ELT Directive.

indicators.name: Recyclability Rate
indicators.description: Evaluates the proportion of tyre materials that can be effectively recycled at the end of the product's life cycle, reducing waste and environmental impact.
indicators.measurement: Assess the percentage of tyre components that are recyclable using material composition analysis and end-of-life processing reports; verify compliance with EU Digital Product Passport data and ELT Directive requirements.
indicators.target: Achieve a recyclability rate of at least 90% of the tyre's total material weight.

indicators.name: Material and Energy Recovery
indicators.description: Evaluation of the tyre's support for both material recovery (recycling) and energy recovery at end-of-life to minimize environmental impact and promote circularity.
indicators.measurement: Verify presence of documented processes or certifications demonstrating tyre recycling rates and energy recovery methods, including compliance with EU Digital Product Passport and ELT Directive requirements; review manufacturer declarations and third-party audits.
indicators.target: Tyres must support both material recovery and energy recovery processes in accordance with ELT Directive targets and be traceable via the EU Digital Product Passport.

indicators.name: Energy-efficient Manufacturing
indicators.description: Evaluates whether the tyre production process employs energy-efficient methods to minimize environmental impact and reduce energy consumption during manufacturing.
indicators.measurement: Verification through energy consumption records, energy audits, and compliance with energy management standards; review of manufacturer declarations and third-party certifications confirming energy efficiency measures implemented in production facilities.
indicators.target: Manufacturing processes must demonstrate reduced energy consumption compared to industry benchmarks and comply with recognized energy efficiency standards.

indicators.name: Water Stewardship
indicators.description: Evaluation of the tyre production process focusing on sustainable water management practices to minimize water consumption and pollution.
indicators.measurement: Assessment through water usage audits, wastewater treatment records, and compliance verification with water management standards; review of certifications and manufacturer environmental reports.
indicators.target: Implementation of effective water stewardship practices ensuring reduced water consumption and proper wastewater treatment in line with EU Digital Product Passport and ELT Directive requirements.

indicators.name: Digital Product Passport Compliance
indicators.description: Evaluation of the tyre manufacturer's adherence to the EU Digital Product Passport (DPP) requirements, ensuring transparent disclosure of production data and material traceability throughout the supply chain.
indicators.measurement: Verification of the presence and completeness of the Digital Product Passport for each tyre model, cross-checked against the EU DPP standards and ELT Directive compliance documentation provided by the manufacturer.
indicators.target: 100% of tyre products must have a compliant Digital Product Passport as per EU DPP and ELT Directive requirements.

evaluation_methodology.description: How to use these guidelines for product evaluation
steps: 1. Extract product information from user context (text selection, page title, URL)
2. Use web search to gather additional product details
3. Identify the most relevant product category based on keywords (fuzzy matching)
4. Apply category-specific sustainability criteria with their weights
5. Check for recognized certifications mentioned (international and Brazilian)
7. Use Groq LLM to analyze and score the product intelligently
8. Search for sustainable alternatives in the same category

scoring.excellent: 90-100: Meets > 80% of criteria with relevant certifications - Highly sustainable
scoring.good: 70-89: Meets 60-80% of criteria - Good sustainability performance
scoring.poor: 0-49: Meets < 40% of criteria - Low sustainability, alternatives strongly recommended
